loans.name: Santa Lucía Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su octavo ciclo.
La Sra. Maria Luz A. tiene dos hijos, quienes la ayudan realizando los trabajos de la casa mientras ella se va a vender quiniela (juego de azar). Es una persona muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de progresar.
Ella dice "Si uno se propone metas, todo se puede lograr con un poco de sacrificio".
texts.en:
This committee is in its eighth cycle.  

Señorita Maria Luz A. has two children, both of whom help her with the household chores while she goes and sells games of chance/lottery tickets.  She is a hardworking person with a great desire to progress.  Her motto is, "If one encounters challenges, they can always be overcome with a little bit of sacrifice."

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics (lipstick, creams, deodorants, perfume), clothes (pants, shirts, shorts, t-shirts), and sport shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothing to meet her customers' requests.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 33 años, es una mujer alegre y bastante trabajadora. En compañía de su esposo Eduardo y sus 4 hijos, formaron una familia feliz y consolidada, en la localidad de Playa Hermosa – San Ramón (selva central peruana). Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano, las frescas verduras que compran los pobladores del mercado central de la ciudad de San Ramón, son ofertadas por Ana desde hace ya 3 años. Lo que más le gusta a ella es poder brindar un buen trato a sus clientes, pues de ello depende su buena venta y preferencia. Como ya es conocida en el mercado, para el futuro desea obtener su propio puesto (espacio comprado dentro del mercado), con el que podrá adquirir mejores ganancias, ya que no pagará alquiler. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Claveles”, y este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una socia confiable y muy responsable. Ana tiene un respaldo económico que le sirve para poder abastecerse la compra de sus verduras, por ello con el crédito solicitado, está pensando adquirir varias hortalizas, verduras y legumbres para su próxima venta.
texts.en:
Ana, 33, is a cheerful, hardworking woman.  Along with her husband and their 4 children, they are a happy and close-knit family, living near Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (the central Peruvian jungle).  
Every morning for the past 3 years Ana has been selling fresh vegetables to the people in the central market of the city of 
San Ramón.  What she likes most is the interaction with the customers, since good sales and popularity depend on that.  Because she is respected in the market, in the future she would like to have her own stall (space that she buys inside the market) where she can increase her earnings since she wouldn’t be paying rent.  She belongs to the communal bank “Los Claveles” (the Carnations) and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is a trustworthy and responsible member.  Ana has the economic support that she depends on for the purchase of the vegetables.  That is why she is requesting the loan so that can buy various produce, vegetables and legumes for her next sale.

loans.use: To buy wholesale produce and legumes to supply her business.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEMBAGNOUMA est composé de femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs  enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à Sido, préfecture de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et d’augmenter le niveau de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire la restauration, le commerce d’arachides grillées, le commerce des glacières et des tasses thermos avec Chata D.. Elles sont à leurs onzièmes prêts de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Chata D., compte acheter, 20 douzaines de glacières (grand, petit et moyen modèle), 10 cartons de tasses thermos, 10 cartons de verre à café et  20 douzaines de cuillères.
Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé capitale de la république du Togo pour les revendre  en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit au marché de Sido à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Dembagnouma Group is composed of four married women, who on average are 35 years old and have four children. They live with their husbands and children in nuclear families in Sido, prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali). They know each other through ties of business, kinship and neighborhood.

To better serve their customers and increase their business activity, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They run a restaurant and sell roasted groundnuts; Chata D. sells iceboxes and thermos cups. This is their eleventh group loan and all their previous loans have been repaid on schedule.

Chata D. intends to use her loan to buy 20 dozens of iceboxes (large, medium and small size), 10 boxes of thermos cups, 10 boxes of coffee glasses and 20 dozens of spoons. She gets her supplies in Lomé, the capital of Togo, and retails her goods at the market in Sido, for cash or credit, to a clientele usually made up of women.

She expects to make an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs a month. Part of it will be used to repay the loan and any remaining amount will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy food utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials to build a wall

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, es una mujer decidida y hábil, de 47 años. Vive en compañía de su esposo Alberto y sus 3 hijos, con los que sale adelante en la localidad de Playa Hermosa – San Ramón (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace ya algunos años, es la confección de cortinas y manteles, los que comercializa en las ferias que se realizan en la localidad. Todos los miércoles, viernes y sábados. Pero conocedores de su arte, Victoria tiene clientes que le compran sus lindos manteles de mesa. Lo que más le gusta a ella es poder plasmar sus ideas en sus confecciones. Por ello tiene pensado para el futuro comprar máquinas de última generación, y así poder vender sus confecciones al por mayor. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Claveles”, y está es la segunda vez que trabaja con MFP, demostrando compromiso y éxito con los integrantes de su asociación. Victoria cada mes compra la mercadería necesaria para su negocio, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará varias telas, de diferentes colores y texturas.
texts.en: Victoria is a 47 year-old woman who is determined and highly skilled.  She lives with her husband, Alberto, and their 3 children in the locality of Playa Hermosa-San Ramon (in the central Peruvian rainforest.)  For some years now she has been making curtains and tablecloths that she sells in the markets that take place in her region every Wednesday, Friday and Saturday.  Victoria has customers who know of her art and who buy her beautiful tablecloths.  What she likes most is to be able to give shape to their ideas in her products.  In the future she is planning to purchase some state-of-the-art sewing machines so that she can sell her products at wholesale.  She belongs to the communal bank "Los Claveles," and this is the second time that she has worked with MFP, demonstrating commitment and success with the other members of her group.  Every month Victoria buys the merchandise she needs for her business, and to do this she requests a loan to buy a variety of fabrics of different colors and textures.

loans.use: to buy fabric of different designs and colors

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe MIRIYA sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant avec leurs époux et enfants  dans des familles nucléaires à Sido préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  des relations de parenté, de commerce  et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et agrandir la taille de leur entreprise, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour la 11ème fois dont tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement. Elles utilisent les prêts pour faire le commerce de boissons NBB non alcoolisées, des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique, des articles divers et avec Sali D. le commerce  de tissus et de pagnes.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Sali D., compte acheter, 50 mètres de tissus Kaki, 10 pagnes de tissus WAX, 10 pagnes de tissus fancy et 10 couvertures en tissus Burkinabé.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes, et effectue sa vente en détail à la maison et au marché, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elles comte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour des frais de santé  familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the Miriya solidarity group are married women who average 40 years of age and six children each. They live with their husbands and children in nuclear families in Sido, prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They came together as neighbours, and through their business activities and ties of kinship. 

In order to meet customer demand and expand their businesses, they joined the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on their 11th loan. All previous loans have been fully repaid.  They apply their loans to the sale of non-alcoholic NBB beverages, plastic cooking utensils, and other miscellaneous items. As for Sali D., she sells fabrics and pagnes (colourful West-African cloth).  

Sali D. plans to use the new loan to buy fifty meters of khaki fabric, ten Wax pagnes, ten fancier pagnes, and ten Burkinabé blankets.  She gets her stocks from wholesalers in Bamako, and conducts her retail sales from her home and at the market, for cash or credit, to a customer base consisting of both men and women. 

With this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, part of which will be reinvested in the business, the remainder to be used for the family’s healthcare expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, es una joven mujer trabajadora, que vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos en Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (selva central peruana). Todas las mañanas los comerciantes y visitantes del mercado central de la ciudad de San Ramón, visitan el puesto de comida de Delia, para saborear los ricos platos de comida que prepara. Su secreto es cocinar con mucho amor y cariño, ya tiene 2 años dedicándose a esto.  Por eso sus planes es ahorra lo necesario para poder generar un capital de trabajo necesario como para abrir su propio restaurante, y de esa manera expandirse más. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Claveles”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde es una socia responsable y trabajadora. Delia, comprará con el crédito solicitado insumos necesarios como: arroz, azúcar y demás ingredientes para la preparación de comida que expende.
texts.en:
Delia is a young working woman who lives with her husband and children in Playa Hermosa, San Ramón, in the central Peruvian jungle. Every morning both vendors and visitors in the central market of San R. stop by Delia's food stall to savour the delicious meals that she prepares. Her secret to cooking well is to cook with a lot of love and care, having spent two years preparing meals. Her plan is to save what she can to generate the working capital that she needs to open her own restaurant and expand her business further. 

Delia is a responsible and hardworking member of the community bank “Los Claveles” (The Carnations) and this is her second loan with MFP. Delia will use this loan to purchase necessary ingredients including rice, sugar and other ingredients to prepare the meals that she makes.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and other ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán,  se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, Leslie de 5 años, Jennifer de 11 y José Benjamín de 14 años de edad.
Ella tiene una tienda en su propia casa, donde ofrece a sus vecinos productos necesarios en el hogar, como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, pastas, condimentos, sodas, jugos y galletas. Pero Lorena quiere adquirir más mercadería y solicita un préstamo para esta compra, ya que productos como maíz, Arroz, Frijoles, jabón, sodas, entre otros, son muy demandados por sus clientes, por lo que previendo de esta demanda quiere mantener su inventario fuerte.
Su aspiración es mejorar su vivienda, instalar la energía eléctrica, agua potable, para que su familia tenga una mejor condición saludable para vivir, también estar al pendiente de las necesidades de sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Lorena lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. She sells basic consumer goods and lives with her husband and three children: José Benjamín (14), Jennifer (11) and Leslie (5).

Lorena runs a store from her own home where she offers her neighbours basic consumer goods including beans, rice, sugar, pasta, condiments, soft drinks, juice and biscuits. However, Lorena would like to acquire more merchandise and is requesting a loan to purchase products such as corn, rice, beans, ham and soft drinks, amongst others. Given that these products are in high demand from her customers, Lorena would like to keep up her inventory.  

Lorena aspires to improve her home by installing electricity and potable drinking water so that her family can have a healthier environment to live in. As well as these improvements, Lorena must also meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase corn, rice, beans, soap, soft drinks and other products

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es:
Bartola, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, vive con sus 6 hijos y 2 nietos, también su esposo, ella se dedica a fabricar y vender hamacas, junto a sus hijos Bartola cada día fabrican hamacas, haciendo un promedio D. 6 en el mes, este ingreso que reciben D. sus ventas les ayuda a cubrir necesidades del hogar, ya que es una familia numerosa.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. hilo D. diferentes clases y colores, manguillos entre otros que son necesarios para fabricar las hamacas, este préstamo le ayudara a tener materiales suficientes para realizar los trabajos y salir con los pedidos.
Para Doña Bartola el principal objetivo es que sus hijos estudien para que puedan tener un futuro diferente y mejoren sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Bartola lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department, with her six children, two grandchildren and her husband.  She manufactures hammocks to sell.  Together with her children Bartola makes hammocks daily making on the average six per month.  Income from sales helps them cover household needs because they are a numerous family.

She is asking for funds to buy cordage of different colors and kinds as well as other items that are necessary to make hammocks.  The loan will help her have sufficient materials to do the jobs and fill all her orders.

Bartola’s main objective is that her children go to school so that they will have a different future and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy different colored cordage and other hammock making supplies.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 41 años; es una mujer trabajadora y muy comprensiva. Junto a su esposo Eduardo y sus 4 hijos, vive en Playa Hermosa – San Ramón (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica está laboriosa mujer, es la venta de queso en el mercado central de la ciudad de San Ramón, donde es una asidua vendedora tanto así que cada fin de mes sus clientes esperan con ansias su llegada, pues saben de lo exquisito que son sus quesos. Pero constantemente viaja de feria en feria, para comercializar las distintas variedades de ropa que adquiere de la capital y aun precio muy bajo. Por el éxito que tiene en la venta de queso, ahora desea incursionar en más productos lácteos ya que en la selva tiene mucha demanda. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Claveles”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde es una socia activa y muy responsable. Ana, desea invertir en la compra de productos lácteos como: Yogurt, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará una variedad de dicho producto y en diferentes sabores para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and a hardworking and understanding woman. She lives with her husband Eduardo and her four children in Playa Hermosa, San Ramón, in the central Peruvian jungle. This hardworking woman sells cheese in the central market of San Ramón. A regular vendor, her customers wait anxiously for her arrival at the end of every month because they know how delicious her cheeses are. Ana also travels constantly from market to market to sell the various items of clothing that she acquires in the capital at a very low price. Due to the success that she has experienced with the sale of her cheese she would now like to enter the market with more dairy products since these are in high demand in the jungle. 

Ana is an active and responsible member of the community bank “Los Claveles” (The Carnations) and this is her second loan with MFP. Ana would like to use her loan to purchase dairy products such as yoghurt. She plans to purchase a variety of yoghurts in different flavours to resell.

loans.use: To purchase yoghurt in bulk to resell

loans.name: Nicaise

texts.fr:
Homme de 47ans, marié, père  de 2enfants qui a appris la maçonnerie et s’est spécialisé dans fabrication des buses, des poteaux, des balustres, pavés, des latrines  pour w.c. et  des briques.

Après ses études primaire, n’ayant pas reçus de soutient scolaire, il devient apprenti maçon auprès de son oncle.

Il a fait preuve de bon comportement durant les remboursements, vice-président du groupe, il a aussi dirigé ses membres sans difficultés.
Le premier lui avait permis d’acheter : du sable, du ciment, du gravier, des fers à béton, du ciment blanc. Avec ses vente journalières  de 20.000f, il veut passer au deuxième prêt et acheter plus de matériel comme 2 tonne de ciment; demi tonne du ciment blanc, fers de 10, 8 8m3 de de sable pour améliorer la qualité de son travail.     il compte fabriquer des buses, des pavés, des latrines turcs en ajoutant  des colories et décorations.

Très entreprenant, il compte former plus des jeunes pour élargir son activité afin de générer plus de revenus, et veut que cela contribue aussi a l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Nicaise is 47 years old, married and the father of 2 children. He learned masonry and became specialized in making pipes, posts, balusters, paving stones, toilets and bricks. 

After elementary school, and as he had no further means of support for education, he became an apprentice mason to his uncle. He repaid a previous loan correctly and, as vice-president, also managed the members of the group with no problems. With his first loan he was able to buy: sand, cement, gravel, iron bars for cement, and white cement. With daily sales of 20,000 F, he wants to obtain a second loan and buy more material such as 2 tons of cement,  half a ton of white cement, iron (10), and 8 m3 of sand to improve the quality of his work. He plans to make pipes, paving stones and Turkish-style toilets, adding decorations and colors. 

With his entrepreneurial spirit, he plans to train more young people in order to expand his business and increase revenue. He also wants to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a ton of cement, 8 m3 of sand, iron for cement (8) and white cement

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda C. M.
2011-04
300,000
Amanda C. M. tiene 47 años, viven en l aAurora de Heredia y se dedica junto a su social Mireidy Guzman a la distribución de helados en diferentes lugares del Valle Central, para esto requieren el apoyo de un carro estilo Pick up, en el cual transportan los helados para distribuirlos a sus clientes.
En este momento el vehículo a presentado dificultades que les han incrementado los costos de producción al tener que alquilar un vehículo, ya que no pueden descuidar a sus clientes.
El objetivo de este crédito es para la reparación de este y así poder seguir con su negocio de venta y distribución de helados. La señora Amanda C.  acaba de cancelar un crédito de Kiva para la mejora en un apartamento de alquiler, este se pago de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Amanda C. M.
2011-04
300,000

Amanda C. M., 47, lives in La Aurora de Heredia and together with her partner, Mireidy Guzmán, delivers ice-cream in various locations in the Central Valley.  To do this they rely upon a pick-up truck that they use to transport the ice-cream to deliver among their customers.

At the present, the vehicle is having a few problems that increase their production costs because they’ve had to lease a vehicle to continue to take care of their customers.

The objective of this loan is to repair their truck in order to continue selling and distributing ice-cream.  

Amanda C. has just repaid a Kiva loan that was used to make improvements on a rental unit; she repaid this loan on time.

loans.use: To repair her ice-cream delivery truck.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.ru:
Zahida M. rodilas v 1954 qodu. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Zahida, yeyo lubimiy muj i deti jivut v Absheron regione uje bolshe 15 let. Zahida uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom, ona u sebya doma izqotavlivayet nashi nacionalniye bludo "D0vga", "Dogramadj", "Ayran" , "Atlama" i prodayot ix v magazini v odnarazovix  posudax.
Zahida seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya izqotovleniya etix blud.
texts.en: Zahida M. was born in 1954. She's married and has three children; they have lived in the Absheron region for over fifteen years. Zahida is a cook. She makes ethnic dishes such as "Dovga", "Dogramadj", "Ayran" and "Atlama" at home and then sells them to various stores. She's worked like this for ten years and is asking for a loan now, in order to purchase the necessary ingredients for these dishes.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Maria Leonza

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la fabricación y venta D. hamacas, vive con su esposo y sus hijos María Gloria D. 24 años, Neni D. 20 y Ezequiel D. 6 años D. edad, ellos residen en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, el negocio lo realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijas, quienes le ayudan a confeccionar las hamacas  las cuales algunas son encargos y otras las ofrecen en el mercado municipal.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. materiales para mejorar el techo D. su casa, comprando teja y madera, además del pago D. mano D. obra, esta reparación ellos la necesitan realizar ya que el techo no tiene la resistencia para soportar el invierno D. este año.
Con este préstamo espera realizar los trabajos antes mencionados y que poco irá mejorando las condiciones D. esta, también quiere ayudar a sus hijos para que continúen estudiando y puedan optar por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María makes hammocks to sell.  She lives with her husband and children, María Gloria, 24, Neni, 20 and Ezequiel, 6, in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department.  Her daughters help her with the business helping her make the hammocks some of which are orders and some are sold at the municipal market.

She is asking for a loan to buy building materials to improve her house’s roof.  She is buying roofing tile and lumber as well as paying for labor costs.  They need to do these repairs because the roof isn’t strong enough to withstand this year’s winter.

With this loan she plans to have the above-mentioned work done which will gradually improve her house.  She also wants to help her children so that they will continue studying in order to be able to opt for a better future.

loans.use: To buy roofing tile and lumber and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a una granja D. gallinas indias, vive con su esposo y cerca D. su familia; su negocio lo tiene en su propia casa y es la granja D. gallinas las cuales alimenta y les da los cuidados necesarios para que pronto crezcan y engorden, para comercializarlas.
Miriam por el momento tiene la dificultad D. no tener suficiente alimento para su granja por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar concentrado, maicillo y materiales para mejorar la galera donD. viven estas gallinas, con este préstamo espera trabajar mejor, tener un lugar más apropiado para que los animales estén también mejor, además D. que tendrá alimentación para algún tiempo.
Su objetivo es que a través del préstamo pueda realizar lo planeado y realizar una buena inversión.
texts.en:
Miriam lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. She runs a free range chicken farm. She lives with her husband, close by to her family. She runs her business from her own home, feeding and caring for her chickens so that they will grow and fatten up enough for her to sell. 

At the moment, Miriam does not have enough feed for her farm, which is why she is requesting a loan to purchase feed, sorghum and materials to improve her chicken pen. With this loan she hopes to be able to improve her work, have a more appropriate place to keep her animals and more feed for them to improve their living conditions.

Miriam's aims for this loan is to carry out her plans and make a good investment out of her chickens.

loans.use: To purchase feed, sorghum and materials to improve her chicken pen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables like: watermelons, melons, apples, string beans, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Sarkar

texts.ru:
Sarkar B. 45 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, Sakir pereselenec iz Lachin regiona, Seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy i detmi. Sarkar uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom. 
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Sarkara v perviy raz on bral 1500$ za etu ssudu on blagodaren Kive i lenderam. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit baranov dlya pereprodaji. Sarkar tak je prodayet i sherst baranov obrabativaya iz.

http://www.kiva.org/lend/2943
texts.en:
Sarkar B. is 45 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person from the Lachin Region now living in the Absheron Region with his family and children. He has been in this line of work for 10 years. This is Sarkar’s second loan. The first time he took out $1500. He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy sheep for resale. He also prepares and sells sheep wool.



http://www.kiva.org/lend/2943

loans.use: kupit baranov

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su hijo de 19 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de comida y a atender una pequeña tienda, Inicio este negocio cuando su hijo era muy pequeño, la misma necesidad de cubrir los gastos le dio la idea de dedicarse a este negocio, su dificultad es la falta de recursos económicos para realzar el negocio y ser más eficiente.
Actualmente ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda, pretende surtirla de productos como frijol, arroz, azúcar, pollo entre otros que le ayudan para la tienda y a la vez para preparar comida, este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda para mantener el negocio más fuerte y dar abasto a las demandas de los clientes.
Su sueño es crear un negocio fuerte, auto sostenible que le provea las ganancias suficientes para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su hijo, manteniendo siempre el deseo de superación y mejora continua.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her 19 year old son in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department.  She sells food and tends to a small store.  She started the business when her son was very little.  The need to cover expenses gave her the idea to go into this business.  Her difficulty is the lack of economic resources to carry out the business and be more efficient.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise for the store.  She intends to stock it with such items like: beans, rice, sugar and chicken, among others, that will be of help for the store and at the same time allow her to prepare meals.

This loan will be very useful to maintain the business strong and self sufficient that will provide sufficient profits to improve her and her son’s quality of life maintaining always her desire for improvement and continued success.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store like: beans, rice, sugar and chicken.

loans.name: Maria Gricelda

texts.es:
María resiD. en San Miguel, departamento D. San Miguel, se dedica a la venta D. productos lácteos y destazo D. cerdo vive con su familia la cual está compuesta por: su esposo, sus hijos Sonia D. 8 años, Claudia D. 17, Iveth D. 15 y Jeovany D. 4 años D. edad.
El negocio consiste en  salir a vender en un vehículo productos lácteos y carD. D. cerdo, desD. las 6:00 D. la mañana hasta las 3:00 D. la tarD., su esposo le ayuda a realizar las ventas, todos los días desD. temprano se preparan para destazar y recoger los productos como queso, crema, cuajada, su dificultad es la falta D. dinero para comprar cantidades grandes D. esta mercadería. Ella actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar cuatro cerdos y productos lácteos, con el propósito D. que estos cerdos ellos los cuidaran y engordaran para luego destazarlos.
Este préstamo será una gran ayuda para ellos y su negocio, ya que contaran con materiales para continuar vendiendo. Su sueño es seguir creciendo, multiplicando su negocio y aumentando las ganancias para ofrecer a sus hijos un futuro mejor y que estos se superen.
texts.en:
María lives in the city of San Miguel, in the state of San Miguel. She dedicates herself to selling dairy and pig products. She lives with her family, which is maD. up of her husband and four children: Sonia who is 8 years old, Claudia, 17, Iveth, 15 and Jeovany, 4.

The business consists of going out and selling dairy and pig products from a vehicle, from 6:00 in the morning until 3:00 in the afternoon. Her husband helps her with the sales each day. Beginning early in the morning they prepare by gathering their goods, which incluD. cheese, cream and curd. The difficulty is the lack of money to buy large quantities of merchandise. Currently, María is asking for a loan in order to purchase four pigs and dairy products, with the aim of raising the pigs, fattening them and then butchering them.

This loan will be a great help to the family and to their business, as it will allow them to attain inventory and continue selling product. Her dream is to keep growing the business, and increase earnings in order to offer her children a better future and allow them to get ahead.

loans.use: Compra de cuatro Cerdos, concentrado para alimentarlos y productos lacteos.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 46 años vive con uno de sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, negocio que lo tiene instalado desde la comodidad de su casa; desde entonces atiende todos los días, siendo más las ventas por las mañanas. En ocasiones su hija la ayuda en la atención hacía los clientes. Por otro lado, una de las actividades que le gusta también desarrollar es la agricultura, ya que le permite tener ganancias que le ayuda para el sustento de su familia. Por ahora lo que más desea es abastecer su tienda con diversos productos.  Es su crédito numero 2 con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes.
texts.en: Elsa is 46 years old and lives with her two children in their own house. For the past six years she has been selling basic necessities. This business is conveniently located in her house. She works here everyday. She has the most sales in the mornings. Sometimes her daughter helps her attend to her customers. On the other hand, another activity that she also likes is agriculture, as it also gives her earnings that she uses to support her family. Right now, what she would like to do is stock her store with a greater variety of products. This is her second loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she has the support of this financial organization. She has always been responsible with her payments. Also she is thankful for the community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive. She is thankful for the people that are providing her with this loan that she is requesting. The loan will be really useful for her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy more supplies for her grocery store

loans.use: She will buy products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
Hermenegilda, es una señora D. 65 años D. edad, se dedica a la ganadería y crianza D. cerdos, vive con su esposo y una hija llamada Silvia. Residen en Corinto departamento D. Morazán, su negocio lo tiene desD. hace mucho tiempo, cuidando del ganado y D. los cerdos los cuales comercializa en el tiangue D. Corinto.
Ella por el momento necesita un préstamo para comprar un caballo para usarlo como transporte, su intención es desplazarse D. un lugar  a otro sin la necesidad D. ocupar vehículo. Los sueños D. doña Hermenegilda es mejorar el negocio, aumentar su número D. cerdos en la granja y establecer una situación económica más estable.
texts.en:
Hermenegilda is a 65-year-old woman. She raises cattle and pigs. She lives with her husband and their daughter, named Silvia. They live in the Corinto department in Morazon. She has been doing this business for a long time. She takes care of the cattle and the pigs that she sells in the market in Corinto
At this moment, she needs a loan in order to buy a horse to use as transportation. Her goal is to use the horse to get from one place to another without using a vehicle. She dreams of improving her business buy increasing the number of pigs on her ranch. Thus she will establish a more stable economic situation.

loans.use: She will buy a horse.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Tacumbú Group

texts.es:
Este grupo, llamado "Mujeres Emprendedoras de Tacumbú", es un comité  que está en el décimo-primer ciclo y cuenta con 17 integrantes.
La Sra. Lilian S. es peluquera y manicurista a domicilio, en la zona de Tacumbú y su sueño es montar su propio local en su casa.
texts.en: This group is called "Enterprising Women of Tacumbú". They are a group that is on their tenth loan cycle. There are seventeen members of the group. Mrs. Lilian does manicures and pedicures in her house, which is located in the zone called Tacumbú. Her dream is to have a special place for her business in her house.

loans.use: They will buy materials to be used to sew made to order clothes and sheets as well as T-shirts, skirts, towels, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niña, pero desde hace 3 años decidió cultivar de manera independiente junto con su esposo. En la actualidad esta a cargo de sus terrenos y contrata peones para sembrar y cosechar los productos que llevará a vender al mercado central de su ciudad, o como también hay personas que ofrecen comprar todo el terreno ya cultivado, pero depende de Elizabeth cual es mejor opción de elegir siempre y cuando recure la inversión y pueda ganar a la vez. Para el futuro desea tener más terrenos de cultivo y aumentar  la cantidad de semillas a sembrar. Es el crédito número 5  con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas para la próxima siembra de maíz.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 26-years-old and lives with her husband in their own house. She has been working in agriculture since she was a child. For the past three years she has been working independently with her husband. Actually, she is in charge of the land. She hires workers to plant and harvest products that she brings to the central market of her city to sell. There are people who wish to buy all of the products on her cultivated land.  It is up to Elizabeth to decide on the best alternative for her products. She looks at which option will give her the greatest profit. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy to have financial support. She has always been responsible with her payments. Also, she is grateful to the community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. She is grateful to the people that provide her with this loan that she is requesting, as it will be very helpful with her business. With this loan that she is requesting, she will buy fertilizer and seeds for cultivating corn.

loans.use: She will buy fertilizer and corn seed.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín tiene 26 años, vive con su mama en su casa propia. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a L. venta D. animales, su padre le enseñó  a reconocer  a los animales en buen estado para garantizar una buena inversión y este conocimiento lo ha ido perfeccionando a lo largo D. los años. Actualmente tiene ovejas, y cada día los lleva a pastar en las alturas D. su pueblo, ya que hay diversas llanuras, llenas D. pastos. Cada fin D. semana los venD. directamente en L. feria ganadera, el ganado vacuno que adquiere lo venD. y revenD. inmediatamente. Considera que este negocio es rentable por lo que desea incrementar su capital D. trabajo. Es su crédito numero 2  con MFP, esta muy contento D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. más animales.
texts.en: Efraín is 26 years old and lives with his mother in his own house. Since he was a child, he has sold animals. His father taught him to recognize healthy animals in order to guarantee a good investment. This knowledge he has perfected, as he has grown older. Actually, he has sheep and each day he brings the sheep to graze in the highlands above his village. There are many plains nearby, full of grass. Each weekend he sells the sheep himself at the cattle market. If he buys vicuña (a small, llama-like animal) he sells it immediately. He thinks this business is profitable, that is why he wishes to increase his working capital. This is his second loan with MFP. He is very happy to have financial support. He has always been responsible with his payments. Also, he is grateful to the community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. He is grateful for the people that proviD. him with this loan that he is requesting, as it will be very helpful with his business. With this loan that he is requesting, he will buy more animals.

loans.use: He will buy more animals such as vacuña and sheep.

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.ru:
Tunzala Heshimova 31 qod. Ona zamujnaya jenshina i imeyet 2 detey. Tunzala yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Kalbadjar regiona i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoimi detmi i mujem. Tunzala uje 6 let kak rabotayet uchitelniccey.
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Tunzali  ona ochen blaqodarna lenderam za pervuyu ssudu. Tunzala seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit knigi i testi kotoriye stoyat doroqo i deti ne imeyut vozmujnosti pokupat ix vsex.
texts.en: Tunzala Heshimova is 31 years old. She is married and has two children. Tunzala is an Internally Displaced Person, a refugee from the Kalbadjar Region now living in the Absheron Region together with her husband and children. Tunzala has been working as a school teacher for six years. This is Tunzala’s second loan, and she is very grateful to the lenders for her first loan. At present Tunzala needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase books and tests, which are expensive, and many children are unable to afford them all.

loans.use: Purchasing books and tests

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comité Nuevo Horizonte nació hace un par de años después de finalizar otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en la misma zona.
Desde el primer fin de semana de su conformación las integrantes están realizando actividades de tal forma a cancelar correctamente el crédito que obtuvieron. Están muy contentas ante la posibilidad de organizarse y progresar de manera comunitaria.
Las señoras que integran este comité se dedican a la venta de comidas en el barrio.
En promedio reciben cada una 1,000,000 Gs., el cual será invertido en la compra de artículos que posteriormente serán vendidos en sus respectivas actividades comerciales.
texts.en: The New Horizon group was started a couple of years ago after another group from the same area ended. Since the first weekend it was formed, its members have been working to pay off the loan they have obtained. They are very happy with their ability to organize and progress as a community. The ladies that make up the group sell food in their neighborhood. On average each member has received $1,000,000 Paraguayan guaranies (~$200 USD) which will be used to buy items that will be sold at their respective businesses.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, wine, beer, sugar, maté, noodles, rice, oil, bread, etc.

loans.name: Qolquewasi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QOLQUEWASI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende otro tipo de productos como golosinas, gaseosas, aceites, fideos entre otros más, la socia está contenta con su negocio ya que mediante este ella saca a su familia adelante, la socia es una persona bien perseverante en todo lo que se propone.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra  de más mercadería para su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y así poder tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de celulares, tienda de abarrotes, venta de insumos forestales, también hay socios profesionales como profesores y una enfermera.

La socia se siente feliz por el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
These individuals belong to the communal bank named "Qolquewasi". It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Elena: she is 39 years old, married common-law, and the mother of 2 children. She has a convenience store from where she sells basic needs products, such as rice, sugar, and milk but she also sells other types of products, such as snacks, soft drinks, cooking oil, pastas and more. She is happy with her business and it is through this business that she is able to support her family. She is someone who perseveres with everything she sets out to do. 

She requests a loan to purchase more merchandise for her convenience store, to add a greater variety of products to sell to her clients.

The other members have various businesses including, cell phone sales, convenience store, and timber sales. There are some members who are professionals, including teachers and a nurse. 

She is very happy to have the loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: The Chapel Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama la Capilla se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Anenecuilco, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por 11 personas que son vecinos y conocidos ellos son Antonia Gutiérrez Martínez va a comprar con su crédito frutas, verduras, para surtir su negocio, la señora Porfiria R. González va a comprar perfumes y cosméticos para su venta, la señora Araceli P. C. va a comprar calzado para su venta, la señora Ángela P. F. va a comprar colchas, cobertores, muebles de cocina, máquina de coser, gabinetes, para surtir su negocio, la señora Reyna C. Vélez va a comprar tela para hacer cortinas, vestido, etc. Para surtir su negocio, el señor Miguel C. P. va a comprar y vender artículos para el hogar, la señora Teresa F. E. va a comprar Dulces de todo tipo para surtir su negocio, la señora Guadalupe A. F. va a comprar refacciones para autos, y poder generar más movimientos, la señora Petra F. H. va a comprar frutas, verduras, como zanahorias, manzana, jitomate, tomate, etc. Para surtir su negocio, la señora Silvia Gutiérrez Sánchez va a comprar perfumes, cosméticos, ropa interior,  etc. Para surtir su negocio y vender su mercancía, la señora Marciana N. B. va a comprar sus catálogos de la temporada para que pueda ofrecerlos y tenga sus primeras ventas. La señora Reyna C. Vélez tiene 70 años de edad, fue hasta el primer año de primaria, ella es viuda tiene 3 hijos Lorena de 48 años de edad es casada y está en los Estados unidos, Sergio tiene 38 años de edad es casada y vende en los tianguis ropa, Xochitl tiene 29 años de edad es casada y está en los estados unidos, la señora Reyna tiene su negocio de confección de prendas de vestir y sabanas y venta por catalogo de Fuller y solicito su préstamo para comprar tela para elaborar sabanas, ella ofrece a sus clientes confección de prendas de vestir uniformes, pantalones, vestidos, blusas.  Ella inicio su negocio hace 53 años confeccionando ropa y con la venta de Fuller y stanhome inicio hace 4 años.  Ella inicio su negocio  por iniciativa propia y la necesidad, ella trabajo en un taller de costura haciendo los terminados, pegando botones, cierres, bastillas, planchado, con un aguinaldo que le dieron en el taller donde trabajaba compro tela y su máquina de coser, hilos, cintas, cierres, botones  y fue como inicio con su negocio. Su negocio es importante porque de ahí se sostiene económicamente de ahí paga todos los gastos, la luz, el agua, todo le gusta de su negocio y le da gran satisfacción u orgullo que ha podida salir adelante con todos sus hijos y sus nietos y está muy orgullosa de su negocio, sus clientes son muchos de todo tiene, las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para sus gastos, para comprar más tela y figurines. Ella está planeando ampliar su negocio comprar más tela para elaborar mas sabanas y salir a venderlas y lo piensa lograr con el préstamo que le hicieron. Su negocio ha ayudado a su familia a sacar a sus hijos adelante a su casa a ir Haciendo detalles para su casa le puso lamina de asbesto por que la tenia de cartón, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son ponerle piso y repellar su casa, sus planes y esperanzas son seguir trabajando, terminar su casa, echarle colado y le va a ayudar a su hijo con la cal y el cemento lo piensa hacer con las ganancias del negocio, ella está muy feliz con este préstamo que le dan porque va a surtir su negocio. Ella está pensando ayudarle a su hijo a desplantar su casa a construir su casa y lo piensa lograr con las ganancias de su negocio. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “estamos muy agradecidos con su apoyo que nos dieron y gracias, les agradecemos la oportunidad que nos dan de obtener este crédito y esperamos que su corazón siempre este presto para seguir ayudando a más personas que lo necesitan”. En Anenecuilco se encuentra la casa museo de Emiliano Zapata hay cuadros, artículos personales del general Emiliano Zapata pasan una película con la historia, el 8 de agosto se celebra el Nacimiento de Emiliano zapata el día 7 hacen una velada con bailables, cantantes en la primaria Emiliano Zapata y después se van a la casa museo de Emiliano Zapata a dar la mañanitas. También se celebra el 5º. Domingo de semana santa al señor Jesús de Anenecuilco, hay misas, van los danzantes, hay procesión.
texts.en:
This group is named La Capilla and it is located in the community of Anenecuilco in the state of Morelos in Mexico. It is made up of 11 individuals who are neighbors and friends. 

Antonia G. M. will invest her loan in the purchase of fruits and vegetables to supply her store. 

Porfiria R. G. will purchase perfumes and cosmetics for resale. 

Araceli P. C. will purchase shoes for resale. 

Angela P. F. will purchase blankets, bed spreads, kitchen furniture, a sewing machine, and cabinets to supply her store. 

Reyna C. V. will purchase fabric to make curtains, dresses, etc. 

Miguel C. P. will purchase items for the home to supply his store. 

Teresa F. E. will purchase all types of sweets to supply her store. 

Guadalupe Alvaro F. will purchase automotive spare parts in order to increase her sales. 

Petra F. H. will purchase fruits and vegetables, including carrots, apples, tomatoes, etc. to supply her store. 

Sylvia G. S. will purchase cosmetics, perfumes, undergarments, etc. to supply her store and to resell the merchandise. 

Marciana N. B. will purchase catalogues for the season to use them and make the first sales of the season. 

Reyna C. V. is 70 years old and she has a grade one education. She is a widow and she has 3 children: Lorena is 48 years old and she is married. She lives in the USA. Sergio is 38 years old and is married and he sells clothing in the market. Xochitl is 29 years old and she is married. She also lives in the USA. Reyna has a seamstress business, making articles of clothing and bed sheets. She also makes sells through a Fuller brand catalogue. She requests a loan to purchase fabrics to make bed sheets. She offers her clients to make articles of clothing including uniforms, pants, dresses, and blouses. She started her business 53 years ago and the Fuller and Stanhope catalogue sales she started 4 years ago. 

She started her business under her own initiative and for personal need. She works in a sewing shop, doing detail work, sewing buttons, zippers, hems, and pleats. With a pension that she received from a shop where she used to work she purchased fabrics, a sewing machine, threads, ribbons, zippers, and buttons, and that's how she started her business.  Her business is important because she is able to support herself financially and she is able to pay all her expenses, including hydro and water. She likes everything about her work and it gives her great personal satisfaction and pride to have been able to provide for her children and grandchildren. She is very proud of her business. She has many clients and they ask for all types of things. The profits from her business are used to pay for her expenses, to purchase more fabrics and appliqués. 

She plans on expanding her business by purchasing more fabrics to make bed sheets destined for sale and she plans on doing this with her loan. Through her business she has been able to support her children and the house. She has been improving her house, including changing the cardboard tiles to asbestos sheets. The improvement she wants to make to her house now is to install a floor and to plaster the walls. 

Her plan and her hope is to keep working and to finish building her house by putting in some concrete. She will help her son with the purchase of lime and cement with the income from her business. She is very happy with this loan because she is able to supply her business. She is thinking about helping her son replace his house and to build a new one. She plans on doing this with the profits from her business. 

The members of this group wish to convey the following message to Kiva and to Fundacion Realidad (Kiva Field Partner). "We are thankful for the support you have given us. We appreciate the opportunity that you have given us to access this loan and we hope that your heart will always be ready to help even more people who are in need." 

The Emiliano Zapata museum is found in Anenecuilco. There are paintings and personal artifacts of General Emiliano Zapata. They also show a historical film. Emiliano Zapata's birthday is commemorated on August 8 and on the seventh day there is a candlelight ceremony and a dance. A group of singers start their tour at the Emiliano Zapata primary school and travel to the Emiliano Zapata museum to sing La Mananitas (a version. The fifth week of Holy Week is also celebrated in Jesus Anenecuilco. There are masses, dancers, and a procession.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to make articles of clothing.

loans.name: Sahuaro Group

texts.es:
El grupo se ubica en el barrio san francisco de Copainala estado de Chiapas México.

            La señora María del Carmen Velasco García, es casada con el señor Adán López Hernández, tiene a  su  responsabilidad a una hija de nombre Laura Patricia de dieciocho años de edad que esta dando su servicio como instructora  de preescolar.

            Durante a estado solicitado el préstamo lo a invertido en la compra y venta de pollos para luego venderlo aliñado (destazado),  en donde lleva dos años y la va bien ya que con esto se ha estado apoyando con los ingresos de su hogar un que también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja  en el campo.

          El motivo para realizar esta actividad es para ganar su propio dinero y así tener de donde depender en los gastos que se generan en su hogar, como tambien tener para pagar puntualmente el prestamp solicitado.


        Con lo que obtiene  de su ganancia lo invierte en la compra de refrescos en el. Cual tambien ha estado invirtiendo el préstamo solicitado y cometa que le va bien con estas dos actividades.

        Su más grande anhelo es lograr ahorrar para que con ello logre salir adelante cuando ya estén grandes de edad y así tenga de donde sostenerse de  lo que les  haga falta en los Díaz qué Dios le siga prestando vida y ver que su hija termine una carrera.

          El grupo se llama sahuaro la razón de nombre es porque hay una planta  con muchas espinas que se identifica con ese nombre y les pareció buen idea. Formaron el grupo cuatro señoras quien cada una tiene diferente actividad.


           Las integrantes del grupo son: 

        Zoraida López Velasco: invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de zapatos por cátalo, de la marca Andrea, pardo y terra.

         Maria estela López M.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra  cosmético, como son: labiales, desodorantes, cremas, entre otros.

           Maria del carmen Velasco García: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de pollos para luego venderlo en la misma localidad

         Juarda Sánchez Sánchez: invertirá el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para elaboración de tamales.
texts.en:
This group is located in the community of San Francisco de Copainala in the state of Chiapas in Mexico. 

Mrs. Maria del Carmen Velasco G. is married with Mr. Adan L. Hernandez. She has a daughter in her care and her name is Laura Patricia. She is 18 years old and she is a preschool teacher. 

This loan has been invested in the purchase of chickens to later sell as meat (butchered). She has two years in the business and it has been successful. She has been contributing to the household finances, although she also has her husband’s support. He is an agriculturist. 

The reason she took up a business is to earn her own money and to be able to provide for the expenses generated by the home. She also wants to make her loan payments on time. 

The earnings that she perceives are invested in the purchase of soft drinks. The loan she requested is also invested in this loan. She mentions that both businesses are doing well. 

Her major goal is to have enough money to support herself and her husband in their old age, to have a source of income form where to have whatever they need for whatever time God grants them. She also wants to see her daughter finish studying for a career. 

The group's name is Sahuara and they chose the name for a spiny plant by that name. They thought it was a good idea. Four women formed the group and they each have a different business. 

The members of the group are as follows: 

Zoraida L. Velasco: she will invest her loan in the business of buying and selling shoes through a catalogue, especially the Andrea, Pardo, and Terra brand names. 

Maria Estela L. M.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of cosmetics, such as lipsticks, deodorants, skin lotions, and others. 

Maria del Carmen Velasco G.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of chickens for later resale in the same community. 

Juarda S. S.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients to make tamales.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Happiness Group

texts.es:
El Comité Alegre nació en el mes de marzo del 2010 mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo.
Su presidenta es la Sra. Agripina L., ella se dedica a vender comestibles, dentro de un pequeño almacén, a los vecinos de su barrio, por eso solicita el crédito, para aumentar las variedades de productos comestibles.
Durante este tiempo las integrantes han hecho un intenso trabajo y por ello han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
texts.en:
The group named Alegre, meaning Happiness, was started in the month of March in 2010 through the guidance and support of another group in the same locale. 

This group is from San Lorenzo and lately they have working intensively and as a result their group has grown socially and financially. They are known in their community for being very hard working women. They went through a very difficult challenge in the past loan cycle after many members failed to meet the weekly commitments. But they managed to pay off the loan and they decided to restart their group anew.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, pasta, meat, milk, breads, rice, soft drinks, cooking oil. flour, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
María tiene 29 años. Ella es soltera y tiene un hijo pequeño aún. Trabaja vendiendo joyas de plata desde el año 2008 de forma ambulante (visitando casas y oficinas). Como su madre y su hermano trabajan en jardinería y tienen un vivero, ella desea asociarse a ellos y de esta forma dedicarse también a la venta de plantas y flores.
Necesita de este crédito para comprar semillas de modo que su hermano realice la siembra de las plantas de estación. Con esta actividad ella desea aumentar sus ingresos para brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar a su hijo.
Su anhelo es contar con una casa propia, pues se encuentra viviendo en la casa de su madre.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old, single, and the mother of a young son. She has been selling silver jewelry since 2008 itinerantly (visiting houses and businesses). But as her mother and brother work as gardeners and since they have a greenhouse, she decided to join them by selling plants and flowers. 

She needs this loan to purchase seeds so that her brother can start the plantation for the season. She wants to increase her income through this business in order to provide greater security and wellbeing for her son. 

Her goal is to have a house of her own. She currently lives with her mother.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, plants and flowers.

loans.name: Mario Efigenio

texts.es:
Mario de 30 años de edad, reside en Corinto, departamento de Morazán, se dedica al comercio de ganado, está casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos José Orlando de 8 años, Kenia de 7 años de edad, ambos estudian en el mismo centro escolar. Él aprendió el oficio desde pequeño, como herencia de sus padres lo sigue desarrollando para ayudar a su familia, para que estos no pasen dificultades.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una vaquilla, esto le ayudara pues una vaquilla es una ganancia ya que podrá no solo multiplicar su ganado sino que también le dará leche, ayudándole a la alimentación de sus hijos.
SU objetivo es seguir trabajando en la ganadería, ahorrar y estar pendiente de su hogar y de las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is 30 years old and he lives in Corinto of the department of Morazan. He is a cattle farmer. He is married and lives with his wife and two children, Jose Orlando, 8 years old, and Kenia, 7 years old. They both attend the same school.

He learned the business since he was young, as an inheritance from his parents. He remains in the business to support his family and to ensure they do not suffer any difficulties. 

He requests a loan to purchase a calf. A new calf is a step ahead because it not only adds to the herd but she will also produce milk, helping him with his children's nutrition. 

His goal is to keep working as a farmer, to save money, and to support the household and to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a calf.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Mariano, tiene 50 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive solamente con su esposa, él trabajó como empleado 10 años en un taller de enderezado y pintura, luego decidió instalar su propio taller que hoy tiene ya 3 años de existir, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 6:00pm, a la fecha no presenta ningún problema.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar un compresor, esta herramienta la está necesitando para realizar su trabajo, con este préstamo tendrá la posibilidad de adquirir esta herramienta y agilizar sus trabajos, esperando realizar con calidad y mucho empeño cada trabajo realizado.
Sus objetivos en cuanto al negocio es cada vez que exista la posibilidad de adquirir herramientas que enriquezcan el taller hacer todo lo que este a su alcance para realizarlo, además de velar por las condiciones de su familia y cubrir los gastos mensuales.
texts.en:
Mariano is 50 years old and he lives in San Miguel, alone with his wife. He worked in an automotive body shop for 10 years but he later decided to set up his own shop. And he has now been in business for 3 years. He works every day from 7am to 6pm, and to date he has not faced any difficulties. 

He requests a loan to purchase a compressor. He needs this tool to carry out his work. With the help of this loan he will be able to acquire this tool which will facilitate doing quality work. 

As for his business, the goal is to acquire more tools whenever there is an opportunity in order to better equip his shop with everything that he needs to work. He also wants to improve his family's living conditions and to provide for their monthly expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Telma Olimpia

texts.es:
Telma Olimpia es una señora muy afanada, vive con sus dos hijos de 22 y 18 años de edad, es madre soltera, reside en San Miguel, La señora Telma a sus 61 años de edad, es empleada del ministerio de educación, como profesora, su horario de clases es de 12:00 pm a 5:00pm, de lunes a viernes, por el momento su dificultad es la falta de recursos para el pago de las colegiaturas de sus hijos, ya que uno estudio ya en la Universidad y el otro en educación media.
Por el momento ella está solicitando un préstamo que le ayude a cubrir esta necesidad, y ha hacer realidad para sus hijos el seguir en sus estudios, este préstamo será muy importante ya que sus ingresos por el momento no le permiten disponer de esta cantidad.
Su objetivo es velar por que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, por lo que ella quiere continuar trabajando para apoyarlos.
texts.en:
Telma Olimpia is a very devoted woman. She lives with her two children, 22 and 18 years of age. She is a single mother and she lives in San Miguel. Telma is 61 years old and she is employed as a teacher by the Ministry of Education.  She works from 12pm to 5pm, from Monday to Friday. She faces insufficient resources to pay for her children's tuition. One of her kids is in university and the other is in college. 

She requests a loan to fill this need, to keep her children in school. This loan will be very important for her because her income is not enough to reach this goal. 

Her wish is to see her children finish their studies, and to this end she wants to keep working for their support.

loans.use: To pay for her kids' tuition.

loans.name: Damas De Hierro Group

texts.es:
El comité Damas de Hierro nació hace más de dos años.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo, en estos dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido económicamente.
Nélida es la presidenta de este grupo y ella se dedica a preparar comidas para vender a las personas que acuden a su pequeño negocio, siempre trata de aumentar la calidad de sus productos para que sus clientes queden satisfechos.
La mayoría de las integrantes son madres y buscan progresar para poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
The group named Damas de Hierro (Iron Women) was formed more than two years ago. 

Nelida is the president of this group and she works preparing food for people who come to her small business. She is always trying to improve the quality of her products so that her clients are satisfied. 

This group is located in San Lorenzo. And following two years of intense work they have managed to grow financially. The majority of the members are mothers who work to provide their children with a better life and wellbeing.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, rice, flour, tomatoes, lettuce, onions, potatoes, meats, eggs. etc.

loans.name: Victor Anibal

texts.es:
Víctor, tiene 38 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, de 14, 12 y 10 años edad, Víctor se dedica a la venta de agua, jugos, refrescos al mayoreo, este trabajo lo encontró gracias a su hermano, quien le ayudo para que comenzara en esta área, hoy día tiene 13 años de estar trabajando independiente.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería como agua en bolsa, refrescos por cajas, jugos, con esta compra espera aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y generar más ingresos que le ayude a cubrir los gastos familiares.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente y liberarse de las deudas, para tener más libre las ganancias y ahorrar para comprar un camión grande donde pueda ofrecer más producto.
texts.en:
Victor is 38 years old and he lives in San Miguel with his wife and three children, aged 14, 12, and 10 years old. Victor sells water, juices, and soft drinks in wholesale. He started this business thanks to his brother who helped him get started in the field. He has 13 years in the business and he works independently.

He requests a loan to purchase merchandise, including water in sacks, boxes of soft drinks and juices. With this purchase he will increase the volume of his sales and generate a greater income. It will help him cover the family's expenses. 

His goal is to work hard and rid himself of any debts, in order to have greater earnings and to save to purchase a large truck from where to sell more products.

loans.use: To purchase drinks (water, juices, soft drinks)

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
La Sra. Valeria tiene 53 años. Ella es soltera y sus hijos son todos mayores de edad. Una de sus hijas tuvo que viajar al exterior para trabajar y por ello fue quien le brindó la ayuda para iniciar su taller de costura en el año 2007. Empezó tomando pedidos particulares de confección sobre medida, luego fue visitando oficinas y sus propias clientes la recomendaban con otras personas.
Hoy ya cuenta con una clientela formada, también confecciona uniformes para una escuela, tanto para los alumnos como para las docentes.
Necesita de este crédito para comprar un lote de telas aprovechando una oferta que se le presentó. Pues ya debe iniciar la confección de uniformes escolares.
Su anhelo es que su hija pueda regresar al país y estar juntas nuevamente.
texts.en:
Valeria is 53 years old, single, and her children are all grown. One of her daughters needed to travel outside the country to work and she was able to provide assistance in setting up her sewing shop in the year 2007. She started taking custom orders but later she started visiting businesses and existing clients gave their recommendations to others. 

Today she depends on a steady clientele. She makes school uniforms for the students and for the teachers. 

She requires this loan to purchase a measure of fabrics, taking advantage of the special offer presented to her. She needs to start making school uniforms. 

Her goal is to see her daughter return to the country and to be together again.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, threads and accessories, such as buttons, ribbons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Ada Antonieta

texts.es:
Doña Ada, tiene 54 años D. edad, resiD. en San Miguel, en este lugar vive con sus dos hijos D. 21 y 17 años D. edad, ambos estudian, y dependen económicamente D. ella, doña Ada se dedica a un taller D. costura, comenzó este oficio luego D. que aprendiera en una academia, eso hace 21 años, trabaja D. 7:30 am a 8:00pm, este horario depenD. D. la cantidad D. trabajos pendientes que tenga.
Por el momento ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. telas para la época escolar, y pagar el mantenimiento D. 4 maquinas D. coser que tiene en el taller, con esta ayuda podrá mantener a disposición D. los clientes diferentes clases y colores D. telas para uniformes escolares así como para trajes formales. 
Su objetivo es mantenerse activa, con un taller fortalecido y estable, en buenas condiciones, crecer en personal D. apoyo y velar por los interese del hogar, también por el estudio D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ada is 54 years old and she lives in San Miguel. She lives with her two children, 21 and 17 years of age. They are both in school and are financially dependent on her. Ada has a sewing shop. She started the business following some training she took at an academy 21 years ago. She works from 7:30 am to 8pm. Her work schedule depends on the number of orders she has outstanding. 

She requests a loan to purchase fabrics to get ready for the back to school season, and to pay for maintenance repairs to 4 sewing machines she has in her shop. These improvements will help her proviD. her clients with a variety of colors and types of fabrics for school uniforms and formal wear. 

Her goal is to keep active with a strong and stable shop, and to increase the support staff. She endeavors to proviD. for the wellbeing of the home and to support her children in her studies.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics in various colors.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice and Corey, co-owners of an art gallery, clothing and accessories shop in San Francisco’s Lower Haight neighborhood, pride themselves on providing a space for local artists to shine. “We are really proud of the people we’ve been able to bring together,” says Janice. Since the store’s founding in 2006, Lower Haters has developed a dedicated following of artists, designers, friends, and fans. 
 
Marketing and finding new customers is Lower Haters’ biggest challenge, according to Janice, but once people have visited they usually come back. All of the items found in Lower Haters are designed by local artists, so “people feel connected to every piece in here. The artists often stop by the store, and we end up becoming a big family.” 
 
Janice and Corey further foster that sense of community by actively participating in the neighborhood merchant’s association, the Lower Haight Art Walk, and by transforming Lower Haters once a month for their late-night art receptions. In addition, they have begun hosting trunk shows where vendors are able to set up their own booths right in the shop, and interact directly with their customers. 
 
Janice and Corey now want to add silk-screening to the list of services that they can offer. Up-and-coming artists, who may not be able to afford the higher cost of small run printing services offered by other companies, will be able to bring their designs to print at Lower Haters. Printed t-shirts will be sold directly in the store, or made for concerts and other promotional events. 
 
But despite Lower Haters’ success and the new business that silk-screening will attract, Janice and Corey were unable to secure a small business loan from a traditional bank. With a $5,000 loan from Opportunity Fund, their local microlender, Janice and Corey will be able to purchase a used silkscreen machine and begin operating it at their store. They are excited about the collaborations this new equipment will allow them to pursue. 
 
To find out more about Lower Haters and shop online, visit: http://lowerhater.com

loans.use: To purchase a used, commercial screen printing machine

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Doña Concepción, tiene 47 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, vive con sus cuatro hijos Manuel de 19 años, Walter de 13, Kevin de 10 y Julisa de 6 años de edad, ella es empleada del parque recreativo Monte Grande, donde labora como cocinera del restaurante.
Doña Concepción necesita usa lentes ya que ha visitado al oftalmólogo por molestias en sus ojos, pero no cuenta con el dinero para la compra, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a solventar dicha situación. Esta compra representa para ella la necesidad de seguir mejor con sus ojos y que su enfermedad se corrija, también otra parte del préstamo la necesita para comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos.
Su objetivo es trabajar por el bien de sus hijos, tener una fuente de ingresos para cubrir las necesidades del hogar y espera cubrir perfectamente las cuotas de este préstamo para continuar trabajando de la mano con los préstamos.
texts.en:
Concepcion is 47 years old and she lives in San Miguel, in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her four children, Manuel, 19, Walter, 13, Kevin, 10, and Julisa, 6. She is an employee of the recreational park of Monte Grande. She works as a cook in the restaurant. 

Concepcion was told that she needs to wear glasses following a visit to the ophthalmologist. But she doesn't have enough money to make the purchase. She requests a loan to resolve this situation. This purchase will help her correct her vision problems. A part of the loan will also be used to purchase school supplies for her children. 

Her goal is to work for the wellbeing of her children and to have a source of income to provide for the necessities of the home. She expects make her payments on time in order to be eligible for future loans.

loans.use: To purchase prescription glasses and to cover tuition fees.

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.es:
El comité Esperanza nació mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que también trabajaba por los mismos objetivos.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo, las integrantes fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas.
Las mismoas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Lilian M., presidenta del grupo tiene 35 años, ella está domiciliada en San Lorenzo, y es una mujer casada con 3 hijos, es muy emprendedora e innovadora, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación.
texts.en:
The group named Esperanza, meaning Hope, was started with the guidance and support of another group who works with the same objectives. 

This group is in San Lorenzo. The members set themselves a goal of stimulating the development of each individual. 

They are known in their community for being hard working women. 

Mrs. Lilian M. is the leader of the group. She is 35 years old and she lives in San Lorenzo. She is a married woman and she has 3 children. She is enterprising and innovative and through all of the past loan cycles she has demonstrated a great wish for self-improvement.

loans.use: To purchase breads, vegetables, fruits, snacks, sweets, and natural remedies.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca, reside en San  Miguel departamento de San Miguel, tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos Isolina de 14 años y David de 11 años de edad, ellos tienen casa propia y Blanca es empleada de una empresa llamada EDT, vendiendo por mayoreo a tiendas y comerciales grandes productos como cereales y bebidas.
Ella actualmente necesita un préstamo para compra materiales de construcción, ya que quiere remodelar la vivienda construyendo una pared en una parte del patio y construirle techo. Con este préstamo obtendrá todo lo necesario  y llevar a cabo la construcción.
Su objetivo es trabajar arduamente por el bienestar de su familia y con este préstamo administrar correctamente los fondos y realizar la mejora de la vivienda para vivir más cómodamente con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in San Miguel, of the department of San Miguel. She is 40 years old and she lives with her husband and children, Isolina, 14, and David, 11 years old. They live in their own house and Blanca is an employee of a company named EDT. She sells in wholesale to stores and businesses common products such as cereal grains and soft drinks. 

She requires a loan to purchase construction materials to renovate her house. She wants to build a new wall in a section of the patio and install a roof over it. She will acquire all that she needs to build. 

Her goal is to work very hard for the wellbeing of her family, and to administer the funds of this loan properly to carry out the renovations to live in greater comfort with her children.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, and bricks.

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es:
José se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 30 años, vive con su esposa Roxana y sus hijos Cristian de 12 años y Kevin de 3 años de edad, tiene casa propia en San Miguel departamento de San Miguel, José trabaja como jornalero en una hacienda ganadera, además cultiva su propia tierra todos los años con Maíz y maicillo, este trabajo lo aprendió desde pequeño al lado de su padre.
José actualmente desea  construir una pequeña habitación y solicita un préstamo para comprar madera, cemento y hierro , para llevar a cobo la construcción, con esta inversión él y su familia tendrán su propia casita donde más amplia para que sus hijos estén cómodos.
Su propósito es que su condición de vida mejore y trabajar por conseguir este sueño es lo cada día le alimenta el espíritu trabajador.
texts.en:
Jose is an agriculturist. He is 30 years old and he lives with his wife, Roxana, and their children, Cristian, 12 years old, and Kevin, 3 years old.
