The member's name is Hugo. He is 44 years old and single. He alternates his household work with a business running a hostel. He is the proprietor, and he works from 5:00am until 7:00pm. He has a hostel that is visited by Peruvian and international guests. He wants to expand and improve the hostel so he is requesting a loan to do this. 
The member is happy to have the loan and promises to abide by the repayment schedule.

loans.use: El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar el hospedaje.

loans.name: Agripina Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Agripina Maritza; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de bisutería, ella vende aretes y collares en forma ambulatoria y también trabaja como cocinera  en un restaurant turístico, ella vende la bisutería en las mañanas desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de bisutería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artes y collares al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "El Molinito II". The bank is located in the Cusco district, which is in the province and department of Cusco.
The member's name is Agripina. She is 24 years old and single. She alternates her household work with a business selling costume jewelry. She sells earrings and necklaces in the street and also works as a cook in a tourist restaurant. She sells jewelry during the day, from 7:00am until 3:00pm. She wants to expand and improve her jewlery business so she is requesting a loan to buy necklaces and earrings in bulk. 
The member is happy to have the loan and promises to abide by the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy earrings and necklaces in bulk.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Janet; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de camote y plátano al horno, ella vende en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes calles del Cusco, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para construir su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Janet belongs to the El Molinito II community bank in the district, province and department of Cusco, Peru. She is 34 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living selling baked sweet potatoes and bananas on the different streets of Cusco. She works from 10 a.m. until 6 p.m. Janet wants to expand her business and build a home. She is requesting the loan to purchase materials for her home's construction. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase materials to build her home

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de venta de boletos en una empresa de transporte, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Maribel belongs to El Molinito II community bank in the district, province and department of Cusco, Peru. She is 30 years old, single and has one son. She makes a living selling tickets at a transportation company. She works from 9 a.m. until 8 p.m. She wants to have a business selling groceries. Maribel is requesting the loan for personal use. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Y's Group

texts.en:
In Preaek Chhmouh village, located in the Kandal province, a group of seven people is seeking a group loan. Mrs. Y S. is the group leader. She was selected to be the leader by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Chann Sieb, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate rice and lotus. To support the growth of their farming activities, Mrs. Y S. would like to ask for a loan to buy pesticide and to pay for laborers to grow her lotus. She also earns additional income by breeding pigs. 

Mrs. Y S. is 46 years old, and she is the mother of three children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and the last one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and to pay for laborers to grow lotus

loans.name: Lok

texts.en:
Mr. Lok T. is a villager who lives in Kaoh Prak village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to cultivate vegetables to sell to support his family. He would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for growing vegetables on his farm. The rest of the loan he wants use to buy bamboo to build a vegetable trellis. His wife, Mrs. Chea San, stays at home and also helps her husband with the farming. 
This couple has four children. Three of the children are seamstresses in a garment factory and the last one is a farmer. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
In the Tuol Tnaot village in Kandal Province there are five people seeking a group loan.

Mr Sum R. is 57 years old and he is the chosen group leader. He is a Khmer who sells cakes in local villages to support his family. He would like to ask for a loan to purchase rice, coconuts, and sugars to support his business and increase his income to improve his family's standard of living.

Mr. Sum R. is a widower with three children. One is a seamstress in a garment factory and the others are laborers.

loans.use: To purchase rice, coconuts, and sugar

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Mrs Lach S. was born in 1980 and is a married woman living in Ta Skor village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr Soeung Sal, earn their living fishing. At the moment they don't have enough fishing supplies to support their business, so Mrs Lach S. would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing nets and a fishing boat. 

The couple has five children. Three of them are attending the local school and the others are too young to study or work. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and a fishing boat

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina R. is 47, married and supports her family by operating two business ventures: a food production and sales operation, and a meat vending business.  She lives in Brgy. Camburoy, Samboan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF, and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Delfina is now borrowing PHP 12,000 to fund the operations of her business. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Delfina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on www.kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of food products businesses

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Mrs. Prom S. is a villager who lives in Chrouy Pisei village in Kandal province. She was born in 1955, and is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.
Mrs. Prom S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows different vegetables to sell to support her family. In her business, she faces a problem with insufficient funds to grow vegetables. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide, and to pay for farming laborers to cultivate her vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticide, and to pay for farm laborers

loans.name: Chheun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheun S. is a 38-year-old married villager who lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She is the mother of five children: one is a teacher, two attend the local school, and the others are between two and five years old and not in school yet.
Mrs. Chheun S. and her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Ork (shown in the picture with her), are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to support their family. Mrs. Chheun S. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide for cultivating rice. Aside from farming, she also knits at home when she can in order to earn a little extra income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticide for cultivating rice

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe V. is a widow who lives in Brgy. San Sebastian, Samboan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a food production/sales business and an e-load retailing business.
Fe joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Fe has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living.
This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business (purchasing fresh fish, meat and other ingredients) so that she could continue to save up for its future expansion. Fe V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish, meat and other ingredients

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai S. is a villager who lives in Tuol Krang village in Kandal province. She is 30 years old, and a mother of two children: one attends a local school and the other is four years old and not in school yet.
Mrs. Thai S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice for a living. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she also works as a seamstress in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Tort Sokly (pictured with her), is a recycling seller, from which he earns a small income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline for cultivating rice

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mrs. Min L. is a 46-year-old villager who lives in Preaek Andoung village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kry Kimheang, have a child who attends a local school. The couple are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. In their business, they face some problems because they do not have enough farming supplies to grow their rice. Therefore, Mrs. Min L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine and hoses for growing rice. Aside from farming, they also earn an income by fishing in the local village.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and hoses for growing rice

loans.name: Sean's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members; they are located in Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Sean S. was born in 1969, and she is the group leader.  She was selected as the group leader by the other members.  She and her husband, Mr. Em Hel, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate corn and different vegetables that they sell to support the family.  The house they are currently living in does not have electricity. Mrs. Sean S. is asking for a loan to pay for accessing electricity. 

This couple is working hard with the farm to support their three children: one is a farmer and the others are students and also support their parent's farming.

loans.use: To pay for accessing electricity.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma B. is 40-years old, married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  food production/sales and butcher shop businesses.  She lives in Poblacion Santander, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her food production/sales and butcher shop businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 21,000 PHP.  Elma is borrowing 50,000 PHP so that she could continue to fund her business operations.  This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of 50,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Five people are forming a group loan; they are located in Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province. The members of this group will use their portions to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Srey E. is 45 years old and she is the group leader, selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Seang Lay, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice for selling to support their family. They also earn by selling vegetables and mango in the markE.. 

This couple has three children who are students and also help on their parents' farm. 

In order to improve their children's education, Mrs. Srey E. decided to ask for a loan to pay for her children's school fee. With the rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizers to support her farming crops.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fee

loans.name: Men's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Men K. L., 56, lives in the Preaek Andoung village in Kandal province, She is the group leader for this loan, having been selected by the other members. The members of this group will use their portions to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Men K. L. is single, and she is a farmer. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice that she sells to support herself. In order to support this farming, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide and to hire laborers to plow her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticide and hire laborers to plow her farm

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo M. is 49 years old and married with five children who all attend school.

He has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya that produces milk and eggs. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last seven years and sells his products locally. He depends solely on the income from his farm to meet the basic needs of his family. His biggest challenges have been diseases that affect his cows and poultry.

He has requested a loan of 51,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to meet the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Aoko

texts.en:
Aoko M., 34, is married with three children who all attend school. She has been practicing mixed farming for five years and produces milk and maize, which she sells locally. She also earns income from her posho-mill business in the same location.

She has requested a loan of 51,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her improve her family's livelihood. She plans to have three quality dairy cows and a chuff-cutter in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Chann's Group

texts.en:
Four people are forming a group loan; they are located in Preaek Ta Ong Ti Muoy village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Chann S. O. is a 32 year old married woman, and she is the group leader, selected by the other members. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeng Sokhom, is 30 years old and works as a iron welder, who is able to earn a little income to support his family.

This couple has three children. One is attending a local school and the others are too young to study or work.  

Mrs. Chann S. O. earns her living by making and selling mats to support the family. She would like to ask for a loan to purchase more raw materials to make mats.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials to make mats

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is 55 years old and married with six children whose ages range between 15 and 31. Two of the children are currently attending school.

Esther has a dairy farm in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for 15 years and sells her milk through Kenya Cooperative Creameries. She has employed one farmhand. She also earns income from her small-scale farming of tea, which she sells locally.

Esther has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable her to meet her family's basic needs. She would like to increase the number of her dairy cows, build a modern dairy unit and improve the quality of her dairy feeds in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly K. is a mother of 13 children who are all adults. She is a dairy farmer in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya, where she has been farming for 20 years now. She sells her milk through Brookside Company in Litein town. She also earns income from the sale of tea and vegetables to the local market.

Her biggest challenge in this business has been lack of enough funds to expand her farming.

She has requested a loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. Selly is a hardworking farmer and would like to improve her dairy farming in the future by acquiring high-yielding dairy cows and building a modern dairy unit.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana K. is 64 years old and married with eight children who are all adults.

Juliana is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been in the farming business for 20 years now and employs one farmhand. She sells her milk locally. She also earns income from her small-scale farming of tea, which she sells locally.

Lack of ready markets and diseases have been her major setbacks.

She has requested a loan of 70,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve her family's livelihood and improve her farming activities as well.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en:
In Champuh K'aek village, in Kandal province, the members of this village bank loan selected Mrs. Sao K. as the president. The members hope to increase their income and improve the living standards of their families with these loans.

Mrs. Sao K. is a 35-year-old married woman. Her husband, Mr. Kang Kun, is 35 years old. He works as wedding chef to earn a little income to support his family. This couple has three children who are attending the local school.
  
Mrs. Sao K. earns her living by selling bananas and mangoes in the market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy more mangoes to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes to enlarge her business

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Mrs. Pho S. is a 29-year-old married woman, and she is a villager who lives in Ta Kdol village in Kandal province. 

She is a seamstress in a garment factory and her husband, Mr. Prum Sareth, is a security guard. With their careers, they are able to make a little salary to support their family. 

This couple has two children. One is attending a local school and the younger one is 2 years old. 

They don't have a lavatory in their house. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a lavatory.

loans.use: To add her savings to build a lavatory

loans.name: Chuluunbat

texts.en:
Chuluunbat, 25, is married and lives with his wife and one-year-old son in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They have been living together in a small house for the past two years. After graduating from high school, Chuluunbat started his own transportation business. Chuluunbat operates a taxi business. His business runs between his town and Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Chuluunbat also helps his wife, who operates a sewing business. She started her sewing business in 2009 making traditional items such as deels, traditional clothing, and coverings for Mongolian nomadic housing tents. She got a loan from our bank to buy a sewing machine and other necessary tools for her business. She operates her sewing business in a rented space and is now popular in her area for making traditional items. 

This family wants to expand their business in order to support their needs and save money for their son's future education. Chuluunbat is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy more tools and spare parts for his car also for his wife's sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy more tools and spare parts

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en: Erdenebat, 34, is married and lives with his wife and a son in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His son attends local primary school. Erdenebat started his business in 1999 making wooden products. He has expanded his business operation and now it is more stable. He makes wooden furniture and ger structure parts. A ger is a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His business is the source of income that supports his family. Erdenebat is a hardworking and motivated person who wants to expand his business and become a popular carpenter in his area. He is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to get more wood and increase his production.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús V. M. de 39 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa y dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad. Manuel es una persona muy responsable, quien se dedica a la venta ambulante de verduras y frutas, las cuales comercializa en el pueblo de Sensuntepeque, en donde posee muchos clientes frecuentes. Manuel solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda incrementar la cantidad de productos que posee, así de esta manera atender a más clientes, y así mismo para aumentar la variedad de frutas y verduras. Manuel desea mucho salir adelante y poder contar con una vida mejor para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús V. M. is 39 years old and resides in Cojutepeque, which is in the Department of Cuscatlán. There he lives with his family, which consists of his wife and two children (ages 9 and 3). Manuel is a very responsible individual who sells vegetables and fruits as a traveling merchant in the town of Sensuntepeque where he has many repeat customers.

He is requesting a loan for Apoyo Integral so that he can increase his inventory of products. This will enable him to serve more customers and offer a greater variety of fruits and vegetables. Manuel wants very much to get ahead so that he and his family can have a better life.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables & fruits in bulk

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase corn & lime for making tortillas

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en:
Batbileg is 36 years old and lives with his 11-year-old daughter in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His daughter attends a local primary school. They have been living in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in his sister's backyard for the past 8 years. 

In 2005, Batbileg began a transportation business. He currently operates a clothing trading business. He started his business with his own working capital and has received two loans from our bank. Batbileg is a hardworking, motivated person and a caring father who says, " I want to expand my business and increase my profit to make my daughter an educated person in the future."  He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy more goods for his business.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase basic necessity products

loans.name: María Delia

texts.es: María Delia M. D. M. D. 52 años D. eda, resiD. en la cabecera departamental D. Santa Ana en donD. vive únicamente junto a su compañero D. vida. María es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual desea brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para poder salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. tortillas, las cuales realiza en su casa D. habitación D. lunes a domingo. A pesar que este es un trabaja bastante pesado, María lo realiza con una acititud positiva. María solicita un préstamo, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra D. maíz y D. cal para la elaboración D. tortillas, y así mismo para comprar leña la cual utiliza para cocinar las tortillas, ya que María cuenta con una cocina típica D. esta región la cual se conoce como “comal”. Con esto ella espera mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
María Delia M. D. M. is 52 years old and resides in the departmental capital of Santa Ana, where she and her life partner live by themselves. María is a hardworking individual who wants to proviD. all the help she can to her husband so that they can get ahead. She makes and sells tortillas out her home Monday through Sunday. Even though the work is tedious, María maintains a positive attituD..

She is requesting a loan so that she can have the necessary funds to invest in the purchase of corn and lime for making tortillas. In addition, she will buy firewood that will be used for cooking the tortillas. María has a traditional cooking surface that is common in the region known as a “comal” (tortilla griddle). With this support, she hopes to improve her family’s finances.

loans.use: Purchase corn, lime, and firewood

loans.name: Mirna Yanira

texts.es: Mirna Yanira M. D. D. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en Merliot, en el departamento D. La Libertad, en donD. vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 7 y 10 años D. edad. DesD. hace dos años atrás que Mirna trabaja en su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda D. productos deportivos como zapatos, toallas, calzonetas, sandalias, flotadores y mucho más, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en las instalaciones del polideportivos D. Ciudad Merliot, en donD. muchos jovenes y niños reciben clases D. natación, lo cual es una ventaja para Mirna. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda surtir el negocio comprando mayor cantidad D. calzonetas, sandalias y otros accesorios más los cuales son necesarios para realizar el deporte D. la natación.
texts.en:
Mirna Yanira M. D. D. is 32 years old and resides in Merliot, Department of La Libertad, where she lives with her husband and two children (ages 7 and 10). For the past two years, Mirna has worked in her own business. She has a store where she sells sporting goods such as shoes, towels, swimming trunks, sandals, floats, and many other items. Her business is located at the sports facility in Ciudad Merliot where many young people and children take swimming lessons, which is advantageous for Mirna.

She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can restock her business by purchasing a large quantity of swimming trunks, sandals, and other accessories that are necessary for the sport of swimming.

loans.use: Purchase swimming trunks, sandals, and other swimming accessories

loans.name: Jesinta

texts.en:
Jesinta has a mixed farm that produces coffee, miraa (an herbal stimulant), maize, bananas and vegetables which are all sold locally. She also operates a small business in her hometown of Nkubu in eastern Kenya.

Jesinta is 48 years old and a widowed mother of three children, ages 9, 13 and 25. Two of the children are currently attending school.

She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to improve her dairy shed and start poultry farming. The extra income from this loan will enable her to improve her family's livelihood. Drought has been her major setback in the farming business.

loans.use: To improve her dairy shed and start poultry farming.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary W. is a married lady. Her husband is a businessman and they have two children, ages six and three.

Rosemary owns a general store at the Umoja estate in Nairobi. She sells an assortment of goods which includes eggs, cereals, chicken feed and kerosene. She has been in this business for seven years now and has managed to provide employment to two people. She says that this business is profitable.

The only major challenge she has is the transportation of cereals, since they are bulky. Oil prices, too, fluctuate a lot, sometimes leading to people not buying when prices are high, thus causing slow movement of her stock. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well.

She is using her loan of 40,000 KES to buy more cereals to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers.

In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land to build on. She also hopes to give her children a good education to the university level. She describes herself as humble and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 32, is married with four children whose ages range between 5 months and 8 years old. Two of the children are currently attending school. He is a dairy farmer in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya, where he has been farming for nine years. He sells his milk through a local dairy plant.

He has requested a loan of 70,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to meet the basic needs of his family. He plans to construct a dairy unit in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann G. K. is thirty-two years old and married. Her husband is an electrician and they have two children, aged nine and five years old. Ann G. K. owns an M-pesa (m-mobile pesa-money) shop in which she does money transfer services. She also does sim cards registration as well as selling airtime. 

Her business is located near a college in Nairobi, so students form a large number of her clientele. She also provides the services to the local residents. She has been in this business for two years now and has managed to provide employment to one person. She says that this business is profitable. 

The only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 45,000 KES to add float to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. 

In the future, she wants to become a Safaricom dealer (local mobile phone service provider). She also hopes to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She describes herself as aggressive, caring and determined.

loans.use: Adding float to her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya, where she has been farming for ten years. She has employed one farmhand and sells her milk to a local tea estate. She also earns income from the sale of maize and tea to the local market.

Jane has requested a loan of 35,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says that her major challenges have been the lack of a proper market for milk and her lack of knowledge on animal diseases and feeds. 

In the future, she would like to increase the number of her dairy cows and improve the quality of her animal feeds to improve her dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. lives in the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. For the last two years, she has made a living by providing transportation services and earns about 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from GDMPC and is applying for a new one, for 15,000 PHP, to buy tires and other accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and woman, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy tires and other accessories

loans.name: Vizminda

texts.en:
Vizminda I. lives in the city of Panta-on, Ozamis City. She is 31 years old, married and has six school-aged children. For more than six years, she has made a living by providing transport services and makes about 2,600 PHP a month from her work.

In 2008, Vizminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid three loans from GDMPC and is applying for a new one, for 10,000 PHP, to repair her vehicle so that she can provide better service to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.  

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Mechelyn

texts.en:
Mechelyn A. lives in the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married and has for the last 10 years made a living by buying and selling fish. She makes about 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2005, Mechelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid three previous loans of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC and is applying for a new one, for 15,000 PHP, to buy more fish to sell. She plans to use the  additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and the father of two children who are 3 and 6 years old. His older child attends school while he works as a farmer and sells his goods in a local market. Peter has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kes from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a cow and expand his poultry business. The extra income he earns from this loan will help him expand his farm and improve his family's living standards. He is determined to increase the size of his poultry flock for the next five years.

loans.use: To buy a cow and more poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell more cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase necessary tailoring materials

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is 36 years old and married to Ljaz who has a business providing carton packing material like tapes, ribbons etc to different factories and shops. He takes orders from customer and fulfills them on time to earn an income.  

Shahida is the mother of 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her sons left their education after 5th grade and started work to financially support the family. Her elder son helps his father in his business while the younger one operates a computer sales and services shop. Her daughters are enrolled in school and are getting their education. 
 
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more packing material like adhesive tapes, ribbons, to offer better quality material to his clients to make an extra income.  Shahida is hopeful that through a loan investment, her husband will be able to grow his business  and improve the financial condition of his family.  

Shahida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.  She lives in Faisalabad which is a big city in Pakistan known for its textile industry. Her house is located in the area of Mai-de-jughi where she came with her family 10 years ago.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Shahida”.

loans.use: To buy cartons of packing material like adhesive tapes, ribbons etc for selling

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome W. is a single lady. She has two children, aged ten and two years old. Salome owns a clothes stall at the busy Adams Arcade market in Nairobi. She sells baby's clothes only. She has been in this business for five years now and has managed to provide employment to two people. She says that this business is profitable. 

The only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 60,000 KES to increase her stock of baby clothes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers.

In the future, she hopes to be able to import baby clothes from abroad to sell. She also hopes to give her children quality education to the university level. She describes herself as a very responsible lady.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith S. is from the city of Pantaon, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old. Judith is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a motor transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Judith is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina C. is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occdental. She is 60 years old. Felomina is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Felomina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Felomina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 7th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard has been practicing mixed farming for ten years and employs one farmhand. He is currently producing milk at low levels which he sells to local households. He is also employed by the Municipal Council of Kitale. 

He has requested a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this business will assist him in educating his children. His target is to have 5 quality dairy cows in the next 5 years. He comments that the cost of feed in the local market is expensive and hence prohibits production.

Benard is 38 years old and married with 6 children between 4 and 16. Five of them are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn S. is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Bebelyn runs a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Bebelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC and is now is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Bebelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a 38 years old housewife and lives with her family in a 3 room brick house in a city Faisalabad which is a well known for its textile industry in Pakistan. Her house is located in the area of Mai-de-jughi where she came with her family 09 years ago. 

Her husband’s name is M. B. and he is a fruit vendor by profession. He puts the fruits on his four-wheeled cart on every day morning and sells by visiting different streets of the city. His fruits are fresh and of good taste and that’s why he makes good sales every day. 

Perveen has given birth to 7 children, 4 sons and 3 daughters. All of them study except the eldest and youngest one. Her eldest son helps his father in his business while her youngest son is 8 years old and has not started attending school yet. Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband for the expansion of his fruit selling business. By utilizing the loan money her husband will buy some fresh quality fruits for selling through his four-wheeled cart. Perveen is hopeful that through the loan investment, her husband’s business will grow further and his income will be increased.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. With her previous loan, she has built a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Perveen”.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits for selling

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has a mixed farm in the outskirts of Kitale town in western Kenya that is currently producing milk which he sells to the local households. He has been in the farming business for four years and also runs a brick molding business to supplement his income.

He has requested a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the proceeds from the increased milk sales will enable him pay school fees for his children. In future, he would like to expand his farm to 5 acres to enable him to venture fully into dairy farming.

Moses is 33 years old and married with 4 children between 5 and one. Two of the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand call center

loans.name: Kellan

texts.en: Kellan N. is forty-nine years old and married; her husband works at The National AIDS Council. They have two children aged nineteen and thirteen. Kellan owns a tailoring shop and makes dresses and tablecloths at the Eastleigh shopping centre in Nairobi. She has been in this business for twenty-four years now and has managed to provide employment to one person. She says that this business is profitable. The only major challenges she has are financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more materials to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her business, buy a plot of land, and give a quality education to her children. She describes herself as hardworking and dedicated.

loans.use: tailoring materials

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar S. is 31 years old and single. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last seven years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His main products are eggs and vegetables that are all sold locally.

Edgar has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry farm. The extra income from the sale of eggs will help him improve his livelihood and pay school fees for his siblings. He plans to expand his poultry farming and acquire a posho mill (a mill that grinds wheat or maize into flour) in the next five years.

loans.use: For poultry farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the resident of Faisalabad which is a big city of Pakistan and famous for its textile industry. She is married to M. M. who is a barber by profession and runs a barber shop in the community. He has been in this profession for past many years, satisfying his customers through his good services. 

A very kind and caring lady, Nasreen stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is known in her community for her hospitable nature. She welcomes her neighbors with a good attitude and serves them with good tea when they come to her home.    

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy scissors, blades and some furniture like chairs for his shop so he will able to provide comfort to his customers and offer a  better quality service to them as well.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Nasreen”.

loans.use: To buy scissors, blades, and chairs for a barber shop

loans.name: Saimon

texts.en:
Saimon K., 45, is married with fifteen children whose ages range from one to 28. Eight of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer in Kitale town, western Kenya, where he has been farming for ten years. His main products are eggs, maize and beans that are all sold locally. He is also employed as a cook in a local school.

Saimon has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry project. The extra income from this loan will enable him to provide for the basic needs of his family as well as pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in the next five years he will be able to be a large-scale poultry farmer.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna R. is a widow who lives in Poblacion, Santander, Cebu. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a used clothing business.  Lorna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lorna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7200, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is again borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase stock of used clothing so that she can continue to save up for the future and the improvement of her business. Lorna R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase a stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Bivamuntuyo Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
27-year-old K. Saulo has for the last decade been engaged in running a carpentry business in Kikubabamutwe-Lugazi. This hard-working gentleman who is a father to five says he began this business on sensing the high demand for furniture such as chairs and tables around his neighborhood  in Lugazi town. 

Weekly Saulo says this business generates him 55,000 shillings and he says with this Kiva loan he is going to purchase more lumber to make furniture to resell. Saulo belongs to Bivamuntuyo development group-Lugazi

loans.use: The purchase of more timber

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita O. is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  hog raising and manicure/weaving businesses. She lives in  Brgy. San Sebastian, Samboan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

 By working hard at her   hog raising and manicure businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Agapita is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she  can continue to fund the operations of her business.   This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.

 Agapita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

loans.name: Turyasiima

texts.en: Turyasiima E. is a client from Rukungiri. He is 34 years old and married with 5 children. E. has an agricultural business, selling his crops such as matooke (green plantain), Irish potatoes and maize to his customers in Mabungo. He works with his wife and both of them are trustworthy people. He is able to get 140,000 UGX as weekly profits since he is also involved in the sale of coffee to individual clients and coffee factories. He is very hard working and needs a loan to be able to improve his agricultural farm.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Dedan

texts.en:
Dedan M. is 34 years old and married. His wife is a businesswoman and and they have three children aged between 6 and 12 years old. Dedan owns a general store in which he sells different items including mattresses, cushions, batteries, nails, etc. near a stage at Kawangware in Nairobi. He has been in this business for fourteen years and has managed to provide employment to one person. Dedan also sells scrap metal to the local residents. He says that his business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well.

He is using his loan of 50,000 KES to buy scrap metal to expand his other business venture. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand his businesses, open more stores and provide employment to people. He also sees himself buying a plot of land where he will build a better home for his family. He describes himself as honest, humble and committed to his work.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2008. Despite his young age, he has to work hard each day to help his father to cover the family expenses.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to replace his shuttle bus’s engine with a new one so that he can transport his clients safely without facing any vehicle damage.

loans.use: to replace his shuttle bus’s engine with a new one

The extra income from this loan will enable him to be an independent person. He would like to build a modern dairy unit and increase his production over the next 5 years. Ngetich is 26 years old and single.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and two children who are attending school. She has owned a mini-market since 2006. In addition to her husband’s income, she is the only other income provider for the family.  

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional daily-need and dairy products so that she can increase her sales and therefore her profits.

loans.use: to purchase additional daily-need and dairy products

loans.name: Kiplangat

texts.en:
Kiplangat has been practicing mixed farming for the last three years in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya. His mixed farm produces tea, pineapples, and milk which are all sold locally. He is also employed and depends on his salary to cater for the basic needs of his family.

Kiplangat is 29 years old and married with one child who is aged 2½ years old. 

He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children. In the next five years, he would like to have improved his dairy farming by adopting modern techniques.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus M. is a married man. His wife is a teacher and they have two children, aged eleven years old and eight years old. Cyrus owns a general store in which he sells different items including school bags, sweets, sodas and many other items. His business is located near the busy Jogoo Road where he finds customers easily.

 He has been in this business for nineteen years now and has managed to provide employment to two people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is harassment from corrupt local authorities. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well.

 He is using his loan of 50,000 KES to buy more bags and restock his general store to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. In future, he hopes to acquire more space to expand his business, educate his children, and develop his plot of land by building on it. He describes himself as resilient.

loans.use: more school bags for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and one sibling. He has been working as a freelance plumber for 5 years,  depending on clients' demand. He helps his father who represents the main income source for the family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new tools and equipment so he can expand his business operation and earn superior profits.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more matooke for resale

loans.name: Ro-Ann Mae

texts.en:
Ro-ann Mae J. is 22 years old, married and is the mother of an infant. She is from the village of Nailon in the municipality of Tudela within Misamis Occidental province in the Mindanao islands. Ro-ann Mae uses her vehicle to drive around local communities to sell fish. Ro-ann Mae has been in business for over a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Ro-ann Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Ro-ann Mae is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles R. is 23 years old and married with one child. He is a farmer from Rukungiri. He has a farm in Mabungo where for the past seven years he has been growing bananas to sell in Mabungo’s trade center. He is also involved in the sale of coffee and has a bar where he sells beers and soft drinks. He attributes his monthly income of 200,000 UGX to hard work and commitment.

Charles needs a loan to buy fertilizer for his plantation to increase output.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock his business with more bags of charcoal and more secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy planks, plywood, varnish and sandpaper

loans.name: Garyahandere

texts.en: Garyahandere Y. is an individual client from Rukungiri. He has a retail shop in Bwambara Trading Centre that has been in existence for over seven years. He operates his shop with the help of his wife, and most of their customers are people in their locality. On average, he is able to make monthly profits amounting to 220,000 UGX, although he has other sources of income, like the sale of coffee, maize, and other cereals. He is trustworthy, and his dream is to expand his businesses fully.

loans.use: Restocking his business with more goods and general merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and one school-age child. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as a products transporter since 2008. He sticks with multiple projects and his mission consists of delivering products from the company to the project area. He is the only income source in the family.  Today he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to register his van and sign the required official papers to make his transportation more secure and legal.

loans.use: To register his van

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul M. W. is 33 years old and married. His wife is a shopkeeper, and they have one 7-year-old child to whom they wish to give a quality education to the university level. Paul owns a butcher shop in which he sells meat to the local people at Kawangware in Nairobi. He has been in this business for eleven years now and has managed to provide employment to one person. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 50,000 KES to increase his stock of meat in order to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. In the future, he hopes to open another butcher shop and become more financially stable, to raise the living standards of his family. He describes himself as responsible and aggressive.

loans.use: To increase his stock of meat

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with one parent. He has been working as a farmer for the past 15 years and in 2007, he started working independently on his land raising cattle. He produces dairy products such as milk, yogurt, etc. He is able to cover the household expenses by himself.

Today he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase the number of cattle as a result of his business expansion and income rise.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock with more spare bicycle parts.

loans.name: Sehliyali

texts.ru:
Sehliyali M. 40 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey  odin iz kotorix uchitsya v shkole a druqoy v kolledje. Sehliyali yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. On uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom.
Ranshe on razvodil baranom no teper on uje razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa i uvelicheniya kolichestva proizvoditelnoqo produkta. Sehliyali prodayet u sebya doma yogurt, moloko i maslo.
texts.en:
Sehliyali M. is 40 years old. He is married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school and the other in college. Sehliayli is an Internally Displaced Person, relocated from the town of Fuzuli and now living in the Region of Fuzuli together with his beloved family. He has been raising livestock for 10 years.

He used to raise sheep but now he raises cows. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy  cows so as to develop his business further and increase his production. Sehliayli sells yogurt, milk and butter out of his home.

loans.use: Purchasing  cows

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children. He is from Lebanon. He has more than 18 years of experience in the car repair business. He opened a small car repair shop in his town in 2000. He specializes in changing car oil and filters. His shop is located in a busy area so he has been able to gain a good number of customers during this period. He is the only income source for the family. 

Today he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his tools to offer his clients better services, which enables him to gain a greater income.

loans.use: To renew his tools

loans.name: Murad

texts.ru:
Murad M. 34 qoda. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom , pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Murad jenat i imeyet 3 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Murad uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. 
On seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva prodovayemoqo produkta  eto moloko iz kotoroqo Murad delayet sir,yogur i kefir i prodayet ix v magazini.
texts.en: Murad M. is 34 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person, relocated from the town of Fuzuli now living in the Fuzuli Region together with his family. Murad is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Murad has been raising livestock for seven years. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy  cows to increase the milk level production. Murad uses the milk to prepare cheese, yogurt and kefir and sells these products to stores.

loans.use: Purchasing cows

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 61-year-old married man living with his wife and one child. He is from Lebanon. He has 35 years of previous experience in the agriculture business. He is specialized in selling all types of vegetables on a freelance basis. He has obtained four Kiva loans and he has been an excellent client with prompt payments. Despite his old age, he works hard to satisfy his family's needs.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business by performing the needed maintenance on his shuttle so he can pass by all the regions in his town and its surroundings without facing any vehicle problems.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his shuttle

loans.name: Linner

texts.en:
Linner is 40 years old and is married with six children. Her children range between 2 and 20 years of age. Five of the children are currently attending school. Linner has been practicing mixed farming for the last fifteen years and employs one farmhand. She sells her beans, vegetables and milk to the local market. Her primary challenge has been lack of enough dairy feed and water.

Linner has requested a loan of 45,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that with the acquisition of the dairy cow her family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Anahid from Al Bayader, Amman , is a 37 year-old married woman and mother of 4. Years ago, Anahid learned to sew and design clothes and started her own business in fashioning and embroidering dresses. She used the first two loans that she took from Tamweelcom to develop her business by purchasing new machines and training women. Anahid is requesting a loan of 300JOD to purchase new sewing machine and train a woman to use it.

An aspiration of Anahid is to expand her business and employ additional women to help them improve ther living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Katooke Tweimukye Group

texts.en: James is a member of Katooke Tweimukye group where each member guarantees the others for access to credit. James has been in the retail trade business for the last four years. His business desire is to own a wholesale shop and his family goal is to set up an income generating activity for his household members. James needs the loan to buy rice, sugar and soap for sale.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice and soap for sale

loans.name: Kasongode Lubimbiri Group

texts.en: John is a member of Kasongode Lubimbiri group where each member guarantees the other for access to credit. He is into retail trade and has been in business for three years.He longs to educate his children upto university level and his business dream is to own a wholesale shop.John intends to use the loan to buy sugar,salt and soap.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, salt and soap for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a car jack to help him fix more vehicles

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENDIYA sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 49 ans, 4 enfants et vivant avec leurs époux et enfants dans des familles nucléaires à Sido préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  des relations de parenté, de commerce  et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et d’augmenter la taille de leurs entreprises, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles achètent avec les  prêts des céréales (tel Fanta SINAYOGO), des condiments alimentaires et des ingrédients pour faire de la restauration.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Fanta S., compte acheter, 5 sacs de 50 kg de riz fumé, 2 sacs de 100 kg de maïs et 2 sacs de 100 kg de petit mil.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants au niveau des cultivateurs pour en suite revendre dans son magasin à son domicile en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elles compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans son entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour des frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the BENDIYA solidarity group are married women who average 49 years of age and four children each. They live with their husbands and children in nuclear families in Sido, prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They came together as neighbors, through their business activities, and through ties of kinship.

In order to satisfy customer demand and expand their businesses, they joined the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. They use their loans to buy cereals (Fanta S.’s activity), condiments and cooking ingredients.

With this new loan, Fanta S. plans to buy five 50 kg sacks of smoked rice, two 100 kg sacks of maize, and two 100 kg sacks of millet. She gets her stocks from farmers in the surrounding villages and conducts her retail sales from the shop in her home, for cash and credit, to a customer base consisting of both men and women.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA part of which will be reinvested in her business, the other portion to be used for her children’s medical expenses.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
SÉRIEUX est un groupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées, de l’association DJIGUISSEME, ayant en moyenne 51 ans, 6 enfants et vivant dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs époux et enfants  à Sido préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe SÉRIEUX se sont connus à travers des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans l’idée de trouver un fonds de commerce suffisant pour satisfaire leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé d’adhérer une fois de plus au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles utilisent les prêts pour faire le commerce de savon, de tissus, d’articles divers et par Sitan T. le commerce de condiments.  Elles sont à leurs onzièmes prêts de groupe dont tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement à l’échéance.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Sitan T. la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, 5 paniers de tomate, 5 sacs d’oignons, 2 sacs de 25 kg de sel et 5 paquets de cube maggi.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Sido au niveau des grossistes et effectue sa vente à la maison en détail, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans son activité et le reste pour rembourser le prêt et payer les frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
"Sérieux" is a group of four married women from the Djiguisseme Association. They average 51 years of age, with an average of six children each, and live in nuclear families with their husbands and children in the Sido prefecture of Bougouni (Mali's third administrative region). 

The members of the Sérieux group met each other through relations and neighbors. With the aim of finding sufficient business funds to satisfy their customers, they decided once more to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They use their loans to trade in soap, fabric and other products. Sitan T., for instance, trades in condiments. The women are on their eleventh group loan, and all the previous loans were repaid on time and in full. 

With this new loan, Sitan T., who is the president of the group, is planning on buying five baskets of tomatoes, five sacks of onions, two 25kg sacks of salt and five packets of "Maggi" stock cubes. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the market in Sido and sells her goods at home on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of women and men.

With this loan she is hoping to make a monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, of which part will be reinvested in her business and the rest used to repay her loan and her children's health costs.

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris has been practicing mixed farming for the last seven years and sells her milk, beans and maize to the local market.

She has requested for a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. Her biggest challenge has been competition, which has led to low prices of milk.

Doris is 38 years old and married with 5 school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Atuheire

texts.en: Atuheire A. is a client from Rukungiri. She is 27 years old and married with 1 child, aged 3.  A. has an agricultural business, selling matooke (green plantain) in Keitumura. A. is happy that for the last 6 years she has been in business, she has been able to develop a good clientele and earn 100,000 UGX as weekly profits. As another source of income, A. has a salon, which she started after realizing that it was profitable. She is a hard working woman who needs a loan to improve her farm and buy more matooke for resale.

loans.use: to improve her farm and buy more matooke

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El señor Nelson M. de 45 años de edad está casado con la señora Silvina Toledo de M., quien tiene 39 años de edad, ambos de la ciudad de Caacupé. La pareja tiene 8 hijos y una hija.
El señor Nelson vive en la compañía Cabañas en el barrio María Auxiliadora. En su domicilio cuentan con una despensa hace 3 años.
Por mas que el señor trabaje mucho posee algunas necesidades que desea satisfacer. Solicita el crédito para la compra mercaderías de consumo de primera necesidad para cargar su despensa y poder satisfacer la demanda de su comunidad.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y KIVA el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello su negocio está creciendo, brindando sus servicios y productos de buena calidad a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Nelson M. is 45 years old and married to Sra. Silvina Toledo de M., who is 39. Both of them are from the city of Caacupé. The couple have eight sons and one daughter.

Sr. Nelson lives in the María Auxiliadora neighborhood in the municipal district of Cabañas. He has managed a grocery store out of his home for three years.

Even though he works hard, Sr. Nelson has a few needs that he needs to fulfill. He is requesting a loan to buy basic necessity products to restock the inventory of his store and meet the demand in his community.

Nelson is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and KIVA for the support that he has been able to obtain for his business so that it can keep growing and providing high-quality goods and services to the community.
