loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, sugar, and other products

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 33 years old and is married with two children. He earns his living doing photography and shooting video.  Samson has been engaged in the business for twelve years. He runs the business with one employee. 

Samson aspires to have a well established business in the future. He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he is able to educate his children. Samson has requested a loan of 65,000 Kes to buy a digital camera and camera lens.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera and camera lens.

loans.name: Kahuna Tweyimukye Group

texts.en: Dorothy is a 27-year-old married woman with three children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a nursery school and has been in service for 3 years now. It has been growing as pupils’ enrollment increases almost every term. With the money generated she has been able to buy land, and her goal is to build her own school and stop renting. Dorothy is requesting this loan to start building classrooms. She is a member of Kahuna Tweyimukye where each member guarantees each other’s loans.

loans.use: To build classrooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help pay for his children's education

loans.name: Grayik

texts.en: Grayik H. is 58 years old. He lives in the Zovaber village of Sevan with his wife and son. Grayik’s wife worked at kindergarten; Grayik's son helps him with farming. For about 14 years Grayik worked as a driver but from 1990 until now he has been engaging in animal breeding and land cultivation. Grayik and his son raise cows, sheep and chickens, and they cultivate wheat. Thanks to his farming, Grayik can support his family. He is asking for a loan of 850,000 Armenian drams to buy fodder for his farm animals and seeds which he will sow in spring.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals and seeds

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Señor Felix C. C. tiene 33 años y vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en el Pueblo de Quillacollo a 30 minutos al sur de la ciudad. Felix no se caso aun y no tiene hijos él vive solo con su hermano menor. Felix es Albañil hace más de 20 años, no tiene un trabajo fijo pero no le falta trabajo, puesto que tiene mucha experiencia en el rubro y hay escases de personas que brinden este servicio.

Felix vive en una casa que no es de su propiedad el esta como inquilino y esta la razón por la cual nos pide el crédito. Felix necesita el crédito para comprar un pequeño terreno por la zona donde vive y con sus propias manos construir una pequeña casita donde pueda vivir tranquilo y ya no preocuparse de pagar alquileres. Es este el mayor sueño de Felix.
texts.en:
Sr. Felix C. C. is 33 years old and lives in Pueblo de Quillacollo, which is 30 minutes south of the city of Cochabamba. He is not married and does not have children. Felix lives alone with his younger brother. He has worked as a mason for more than twenty years. Even though he does not have a steady job, he does not lack work. He has plenty of experience in this field and does not lack customers for whom he provides his service.

Felix lives as a tenant in a house that is not his, so he is requesting this loan. He needs the loan to buy a small plot of land in the district where he lives. With his own hands, he will build a small house where he can live peacefully and not worry about paying rent. This is Felix’s greatest dream.

loans.use: Purchase a plot of land on which he will build a house

loans.name: Thandiwe Group

texts.en:
Reginah is 52 years old and married with 5 children, ages 12 to 26. She sells live chickens at her home in Empangeni in South Africa (KZN). She has been in this business for one and a half years. She also earns income from the government’s child support grant. She says that the main challenges to her business are the death of chickens when there is heavy rain and when the chickens lose weight due to disease, making them unsellable.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses (WDB) to buy more live chickens. She says that the extra income from this loan will help feed her family and provide her children with proper school facilities. In the future, she would like to have a decent shelter for her chickens. She would also like to have a machine for keeping the chicken eggs warm. 

In the photo she is standing on the left wearing a purple skirt. Reginah says she is looking forward to being honest and committing herself in working with WDB and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy live chickens for resale

loans.name: Bulbulaiym

texts.en:
Bulbulaiym M. is 39 years old and has two sons. With her medical education she worked as a nurse at the hospital. After the birth of her younger son, her marriage broke down and she became the only bread-winner for her children. Her salary as a nurse was very low and didn’t cover all of the expenses of her family. For this reason, Bulbulaiym decided to start her own business of reselling day-to-day goods. She opened a small shop and, using the revenues, she was able to make her elder son’s dream come true – he became the student of a military college. 

In 2005, Bulbulaiym’s tireless energy led her to open a shop with ware and children’s toys at the local market. She started it with the initial capital of 40,000 KGS and now her monthly earnings amount to 15,000 KGS. She worked hard to develop her business and managed to buy a house for her family. Bulbulaiym is now applying for a loan of 120,000 KGS to broaden her assortment of goods. This will allow for further development of her business in the market. 

Bai-Tushum & Partners, one of the leading microfinance instutions in Kyrgyzstan, partners with Kiva to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden the assortment of goods at her shop

loans.name: Emiline

texts.en: Emiline, 50 years old, has been selling food to earn a living for twelve years. She hopes to develop her business into a hotel in the future. Emiline believes that with the help of Faulu Kenya, she will manage to improve her business. With her first loan of 50,000 KES, she will buy rice, beans and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's education

loans.name: Benjamin Waweru

texts.en:
Benjamin Waweru M., 28 years old, is married to Mary and they are blessed with two children.  He operates an electronics shop as a primary business and at the same time, he manages a motorcycle transport business locally known as ‘Boda boda‘ in the Kiserian market. This market is very busy, thus many customers.  He has been in this business for six months with a good income.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing member of KADET, and he is applying for his first loan of KES. 80,000, which he intends to use to add more tools to the electronics shop e.g. brakes, screws, pampers, etc. The extra income he will use to buy more bulbs and petrol engine oil.

In the future, he hopes to grow his business, open another branch, and ensure that his family’s basic needs are met.

loans.use: To add more electronic tools to the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital for his taxi business

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en: Japhet is 34 years old, married and a father of two children aged 3 and 9 years old.  He is able to educate his children with the income he gets from selling bananas.  He hopes to open another business that can generate more income in the future.  Being a member of Twaweza group, he can easily get loans from Faulu Kenya. Therefore, he has requested 30, 000 KES to buy green bananas.

loans.use: To buy green bananas

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 35 years old, married and a mother of three.  She runs a retail shop in Kiambu.  She has been running the business for over five years.  She is now hoping to expand the business into a wholesale business in the future.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her finances.  She has requested 50,000 KES to buy maize flour, sodas and ropes.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sodas and ropes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a businessman who runs a grocery store.  Its eight years since he started the business.  So far, he has managed to employ one person.  He works hard in his business to provide for his family.  He previously bought a piece of land on which he is planning to build a home for his family.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya for funding him.  He hopes to stabilize his business in five years.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy beans, maize, potatoes and onions.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Khodeir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has 3 children.

After getting good experience in the baking field, Khodeir opened his own bakery in 2005. He is becoming well-known in his local community and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $1500 loan to buy a bakery machine and a generator. He is planning to extend his business and increase his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Buy a machine and a generator

loans.name: Muhororo Tukore Group, Kihihi

texts.en: K. Micheal is the leader of the Muhororo Tukore group in Kihihi. He is 30 years old and married with 4 children and all of them are in school. Micheal has a tea plantation from which he sells tea leaves to the tea factory and he is able to make 200,000  UGX as weekly profits. He also has another source of income and this is the banana plantation from which he makes 40,000 UGX as profits weekly. Micheal needs a loan to be able to buy fertilizer for his tea plantation of 8 years. He says that he is lucky that he has a ready market for his tea leaves since he is near the tea factory. He is a hard working and cooperative man and he needs to expand his business and educate all his children to the highest level.

loans.use: Buying fertilizer for his tea plantation.

loans.name: Rosa Mística Group

texts.es:
Las Señoras del presente comité son de la compañía Jhugua Hu de la Ciudad de Caacupé.
La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Justina O., es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada, la Sra. Justina vive con su marido y sus 6 hijos, de los cuales 3 son los que trabajan, al igual que su marido ella trabaja incesantemente en su tallercito de costura para poder ayudar en el sustento de su hogar.
La Sra. Justina desea invertir su crédito en la compra de materiales para costura, ella y todas las integrantes del comité están muy contentas y agradecidas por tan importante apoyo económico que les ha brindado para poder invertir en sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The women of this existing committee are from the municipal district of Jhugua Hu in the city of Caacupé.

The president of the committee is Sra. Justina O., a hardworking and sacrificing woman. Sra. Justina lives with her husband and six children, three of whom are working. Like her husband, she works constantly – managing a sewing workshop to help maintain their household.

Sra. Justina wants to invest her loan in the purchase of sewing materials. She and the rest of the committee members are very happy and grateful for such important financial support that has provided them the ability to invest in their small businesses.

loans.use: Purchase thread, buttons, fabric, sewing machine parts, elastic, and other items

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 56 years old, married, and has 5 children.

In 2006, Jawad decided to open his own business so he opened a food market in the area where he lives. He is becoming well-known and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to install an external ceiling, redecorate his shop and buy a generator. He is aiming to have his business grow bigger and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Install an external ceiling, redecorate his shop, and buy a generator

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan A. O. is thirty years old and married. The husband is a motor cyclist and has five children aged between thirteen years old and one and half years old. She owns a general store in which she sells foodstuffs, toiletries and groceries. Her business is located at Manyatta Market in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for production of fish and it is well known as the lake region. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy a fridge to store beverages to keep them cold to sell to her customers since Kisumu's weather is hot and humid. She hopes to grow her business and become a wholesaler. She describes herself as a person who relates well with her clients.

loans.use: Fridge

loans.name: Milengo

texts.en: Milengo is 30 years old and single.  He works as a mechanic to earn a living.  He has been in the business for almost six years.  He dreams of opening a garage in the future.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money.  This has helped him to invest in his business.  He has requested 50,000 KES to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a member of the Neema Githiga group in Faulu Kenya.  He has been farming for three years.  He also works as a mason to get more income.  He is a widower with five children and works hard to provide for his family.  He believes that through Faulu Kenya he will grow his business and become more stable.  He has requested 45,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 62-year-old widowed man from Lebanon. He lives on his own. He worked in a roastery for more than 42 years. Then, he decided to open his own roastery 5 years ago and started to offer people from his community delicious nuts and crackers. This competent older man was able to cover his expenses all across the years. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new machinery and additional tools to increase his productivity, sales, and income.

loans.use: to purchase new machinery and additional tools

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio San Antonio de Caacupé.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Rosa Ramona O., ella vive con su marido y sus 4 hijos, trabaja en su copetín, como también sus compañeras. Están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y KIVA, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras están en el primer ciclo con sus 10 integrantes.
texts.en:
The women of this existing committee are from the neighborhood of San Antonio in Caacupé.

The committee president is Sra. Rosa Ramona O.. She lives with her husband and four children. Rosa works at a snack bar, as well as her fellow group members. They are very satisfied with the financial support that Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva have provided. With this capital, the women have grown their small businesses as well as their incomes to achieve a better quality of life.

The women are in their first loan cycle with ten members.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, baked goods, beverages (sodas, beer, bottled juices), sweets, candy, and crackers

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio María Auxiliadora de la Cía. Cabañas de  Caacupé.
La presidenta, la Sra. María Estela C., vive con su marido y sus dos hijos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de plantas, que es su especialidad.
Ella, al igual que sus compañeras, está muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya, porque gracias al crédito que se le otorga, puede invertir en su negocio, y de ese modo generar mayores ingresos, ayudar a su marido al sustento de su hogar y a darle mejor futuro a sus dos hijos pequeños.
texts.en: The women of this group are from the María Auxiliadora neighborhood in Caacupé. The president, María Estela C., lives with her husband and two children. She is a very hard-working woman who makes a living selling plants, which is her specialty. María, just like her fellow group members, is very grateful to Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya because thanks to the loan she can invest in her business and in this way earn more income, help her husband with the household finances and provide a better future for her two young children.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, planters, fertilizer, fumigation items, plants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 60 años, vive sola en su casa propia. Hace más de 2 años se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de cuidado de niños, actividad que lo realiza en su misma casa, desde entonces brinda educación y protección a los niños cuyas madres son solteras y trabajan. De esta manera logra tener algo de ingresos económicos, actualmente la gente de su zona la conocen y sabe de su oficio por el cual ha ganado la confianza de cada uno de ellos. Considera que este trabajo es muy bueno y digno, por el cual le agrada ejercerlo y por tal desea mejorar la instalación de su casa para que los niños se sientan más acogedores. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de algunos artículos para niños como juguetes y muebles.
texts.en: Bertha is 60 years old and lives by herself in her own home. For more than two years she has made a living offering child care services out of her home. Since that time she has provided education and protection to children whose mothers are single and working. In this way she has been able to earn some income. Now, the people in her area know her and her work because she has gained their confidence. She considers this work very good and respectable, so she enjoys doing it. She wishes to make improvements to her home so the children fell more comfortable. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very content in knowing she has financial support. Furthermore, she enjoys being part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very united. She is grateful to those people who will be funding the loan she is requesting, which will be very useful to the progress of her business. With the loan, she plans to purchase some children's articles, such as toys and furniture.

loans.use: Purchase educational items, toys and furniture

loans.name: Agua Buena Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AGUA BUENA ”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. MatilD.; ella tiene 56 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. verduras y fruta, la socia viaja a  provincia a vender su mercadería como a Urubamba, Calca y Ollantaytambo especialmente en las ferias dominicales, también venD. en el mismo Cusco siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento la socia venD. D. forma ambulatoria, la socia es una persona bien emprendedora que tiene muchas ganas D. seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra  D. más mercadería para su negocio D. venta D. fruta y verdura para sí poder tener más variedad y poder ofrecer a sus clientes.

Las otras socias se dedican al mismo negocio D. venta D. fruta y verduras, crianza D. animales, venta D. madera y venta D. tejidos hechos a mano.
La socia se siente feliz por el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas.
texts.en: The members belong to the "Agua Buena" ("Good Water") community bank in the district, province and department of Cusco. One of the members is MatilD.. She is 56 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She travels to other provinces to sell her products, such as to Urubamba, Calca and Ollantaytambo, especially for the Sunday markets. She also sells on the streets of Cusco itself. MatilD. is a very enterprising woman who has a strong desire to make headway. She is requesting the loan to purchase more merchandise for her fruits and vegetable business so she can have more variety to offer her customers. Some other members make a living selling fruits and vegetables like MatilD., while others raise livestock, sell wood or sell hand-woven items. The members feel happy about the loan and promise to make the payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Virumi Oipurukuaáva Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del asentamiento Caacupé Poty de la ciudad de Caacupé.
La Presidenta, la Sra. Graciela R., es una mujer muy batalladora, se dedica a la venta de frutas. Vive con su marido y sus cuatro hijitos. Ella al igual que sus compañeras, agradece y valora mucho el apoyo económico que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya, además de las capacitaciones que realizan, porque todo eso les ayuda a crecer personal y comercialmente.
texts.en:
The women of this existing committee are from the settlement of Poty in the city of Caacupé.

The president, Sra. Graciela R., is a determined woman who sells fruit. She lives with her husband and four young children. Like her fellow group members, Graciela is grateful and appreciative of the financial support that Fundación Paraguaya has provided and the training classes they have completed since this assistance has helped them grow personally and commercially.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, and medicinal plants

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera I. is a 38-year-old villager who lives in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. She has one daughter. Venera was born into a low-income family, and from early childhood she had to help her parents around the house. After finishing school, in order to find means of subsistence, she started to work as a babysitter. When she got married in 2006, Venera and her husband went to Russia in search of making a living and returned in two years. Using money they had earned there, Venera started a business of selling fruits and vegetables at the local market. Unfortunately, in 2010 a tragedy changed their family plans – Venera’s husband died in an accident. 

When Venera became the only breadwinner for her daughter, she decided to find an additional means of subsistence for her small family. In her local area, cattle breeding is one of the main business activities. Using an initial amount of 5,000 KGS, she bought one milk cow, whose milk she sold to the dairy factory. Now, Venera has two milk cows and one calf at her farm.
 
Venera requests a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy one more milk cow and a bull calf for fattening and reselling. That will allow further development of her household and business. With the revenues, she plans to give a good education to her daughter. 


Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable members of the population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading micro-finance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, it contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Santa Teresita de la cuidad de Caacupé.
La presidenta del comité es la señora María Odulia G., vive con su marido y sus 3 hijos, ella trabaja como empleada doméstica en su horas libres y vende empanadas.
Las integrantes de este comité están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les están brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y KIVA, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios.
El comité Santa Teresita está en el cuarto ciclo de su programa, con una antigüedad de aproximadamente 2 años.
texts.en:
The women of this existing committee are from the neighborhood of Santa Teresita in the city of Caacupé.

The committee president is Sra. María Odulia G. who lives with her husband and three children. She works as a housekeeper in her spare time and sells empanadas.

The committee members are satisfied with the financial support provided by Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. With this capital, the women have grown their small businesses. The Santa Teresita Committee is in its fourth loan cycle in the program and has been in existence for approximately two years.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth tiene 31 años, vive con sus  2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niña se dedicaba a la agricultura, hoy se ha convertido en su fuente principal de ingresos económicos. Los principales productos que siembra son: papa y maíz; asimismo posee un establo donde cría ovejas, cerdos y cuyes, animales que cuida y cada cierto tiempo los vende en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Esta actividad le produce más ganancias que en la agricultura, pero aunque espera la cosecha aún así le resulta rentable; por ello espera intensificarse en la actividad agrícola. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Janeth is 31 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. She has been farming since she was a young girl. Today she relies on it as her main source of financial income. The primary crops that she grows are potatoes and corn. In addition, she has a stable where she raises sheep, pigs, and guinea pigs. Janeth cares for the animals and every so often sells them at the local livestock fair. This activity generates more income than farming and it gives her something to do while she waits for her harvest. However, most of her time is intensely devoted to farming.

This is her third loan with MFP. Janeth is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support, so she always shows that she is responsible with her payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members have been responsible and supportive individuals. Janeth thanks those who granted the loan she is requesting because it will be useful in advancing her business. With the requested funds, she will purchase sacks of compost for her crop of corn.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost for growing corn

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS GOLONDRINAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. María; ella tiene 76 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 9 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio D. costura ella confecciona materiales D. tela para cubrir licuadoras , microondas entre otros mas también realiza otro tipo D. manualidades como fundas para almohadas ,paneras,portalapiceros entre otros, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas D. seguir adelante ya que mediante este trabajo ella sigue apoyando en lo que pueD. a su familia y también es una distraccion para ella,la socia está feliz por ese motivo y desea continuar desea forma. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra  D. más mercadería para su negocio como hilos D. todos los colores, tijeras, telas, reglas entre otros más. 

Los otros socios  se dedican al turismo tienen sus agencias D. viajes, tiendas D. venta D. equipo D. camping, otro socio trabaja con su carrito ofreciendo servicios D. tours y una socia se dedica al negocio D. venta D. cosméticos.  

La socia se siente feliz por el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank “Las Golondrinas” (The Swallows), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. María. She is 76 years old, married, and has nine children. María has a sewing business in which she makes covers for blenders, microwaves, and other appliances. She also produces other types of handmaD. items such as pillowcases, bread baskets, pencil holders, and other items. María is a cheerful person who has tremendous desire to get ahead in her work so that she can support her family. In addition, her work serves as a distraction. For this reason, María is happy and wants to continue in the same manner.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more supplies for her business such as threads of every color, scissors, fabric, rulers, and other items.

The other members engage in the tourism industry. Some manage travel agencies and camping supply stores. One member has a vehicle for offering tours while another member has a business selling cosmetics.

The members are happy with this loan and promise to complete their payments.

loans.use: Purchase thread, scissors, fabric, rulers, and other items

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Antonio es de la compañía Ndavarú de Carapeguá, está casado con la Sra. Felicita Mendoza, quien es tejedora de colchas artesanales, ambos viven en casa propia y tienen 3 hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad.
El cliente opera con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 1994 y cuenta con buen historial de crédito.
El crédito es utilizado para compra de artesanía, que luego se encargará el Señor Antonio de la distribución en forma ambulante por la zona de Itaguà y Capiatá.
texts.en:
Sr. Antonio is from Ndavarú de Carapeguá. He is married to Sra. Felicita Mendoza, who is a weaver of handmade quilts. They live in their own home and have three children, all of whom are adults.

Sr. Antonio joined Fundación Paraguaya in 1994 and has established a good credit history. This loan will be used to buy handicrafts which he will eventually distribute as a traveling merchant in the districts of Itaguá and Capiatá.

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Yisela

texts.es: Yisela, de 29 años, vive en casa de sus abuelos en compañía de ellos, sus dos hijos y de su esposo; juntos trabajan cada día para salir adelante. Hace 5 años atrás, Yisela, decidió vender productos de belleza, en el entorno de su hogar, siendo sus primeros compradores sus familiares de su casa, y poco a poco ofrecía a más amistades, es por eso que hoy en día todas sus vecinas de su barrio la reconocen como tal.  Por ello, Yisela antes de salir a la calle se asegura de cargar su bolso con productos de belleza y sus catálogos, para que de esa manera logre vender más que la campaña anterior. Con la ayuda de su esposo puede cubrir los gastos de su hogar y de sus hijos.  Se siente muy contenta con la actividad que desarrolla; por ello desea ampliar su negocio y diversificar con otros negocios también. Es el 34avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, para acceder a posteriores créditos, pues quiere continuar progresando con su taller. De obtener el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza, para continuar desarrollando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Yisela is 29 years old and lives with her grandparents at their house as well as with her two children and her husband. Together they strive each day to get ahead. Five years ago, Yisela decided to sell beauty products from home. Her first customers were her relatives and over time she offered them to more of her friends. Today all of her neighbors in the area know her for this business. Prior to going out on the streets to sell, Yisela makes sure that her bag is filled with beauty products and catalogs. By working in this manner, she is able to sell more than in the previous season. With the help of her husband, Yisela is able to cover the household expenses and support their children. She is very happy with how her business has developed. For this reason, she wants to expand her business and diversify with other products as well.

This is her 34th loan with MFP. Yisela promises to complete her payments on time so that she eligible to access subsequent loans to help with advancing her business. With the loan she obtained, she plans to buy more beauty products so that she can continue developing in her work.

loans.use: Purchase more beauty products to sell

loans.name: Elba Claudia

texts.es: El señora Elba dedicada a la producción de empanadas, donas, y masitas en general, lleva ya años en el trabajo realizando sus masitas desde muy tempranas horas, para poder distribuirlas en el transcurso del día, ella distribuye a tiendas de barrio, kioscos, a colegios, también realiza estos productos a pedido. Con los ingresos que llega a reunir durante la semana ella puede ayudar a mantener a su familia y ayudar con la economía de su hogar. El crédito que la señora solicita es para poder comprar más insumos para realizar sus deliciosas galletas y masitas ya que estas fechas de inicio de clases elaboran en cantidad para la entrega.
texts.en:
Sra. Elba has been producing empanadas, donuts, and snacks for several years. In order to make her products, she starts very early so that she can distribute them throughout the day. Elba sells her products to neighborhood stores, kiosks, and schools. She also makes her products upon request. With the income that she generates each week, Elba is able to support her family and help with the household finances.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more supplies for making her delicious cookies and snacks since classes are about to start, so she must produce in quantity in time for delivery.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for producing cookies & snacks

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es: Luciano, de 49 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposa. Por el momento no tiene hijos. Desde muy pequeño trabajó en diversas actividades, actualmente ofrece productos nutricionales, negocio que él esta yendo muy bien. Además como buen empresario, ha creado una red de amigos, quienes realizan estos pedidos y él los distribuye para que así sea más amplia la comercialización. Es así que considera este negocio muy rentable,  y por tal, ha apostado por la venta de productos de limpieza, que con la ayuda de su esposa, están entrando al mercado ofreciendo estos productos, así aumentan sus ganancias. Es ello que se siente muy feliz, ya que los realiza  en la comodidad de su casa aunque a veces debe madrugar para cumplir con sus pedidos.  Como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro desea diversificar su negocio con otros  productos. Es el 8vo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que quiere cumplir con todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Luciano tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de más productos nutricionales y accesorios de limpieza, que necesita para cumplir con un pedido que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Luciano is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. At the moment he does not have any children. From a very young age, Luciano has worked in various activities. He currently offers nutritional products, a venture in which he has done very well. Being a good businessman, he has created a network of friends who place orders with him. Through this method of distribution, he has been able to market his products more extensively. Luciano considers his business to be very profitable. As a result, he began selling cleaning products with the help of his wife. By entering the market with these products, he plans to increase his earnings. Luciano is very happy because he is able to work from the comfort of his home, but there are times when he must wake up early to complete his orders. Being an enterprising individual, he plans to diversify his business with other products in the future.

This is his eighth loan with MFP. Luciano promises to complete his payments on time because he wants to make a good impression to everyone who made this funding possible so that he could continue working and making progress. He plans to invest the loan he requested in the purchase of more nutritional products and cleaning accessories that he needs to fulfill his outstanding orders.

loans.use: Purchase nutritional products & cleaning accessories

loans.name: Elmer Andres

texts.es: El Sr. Elmer Andres G. U. vive junto a su esposa e hijo. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el caserio Pampa Chacaltana Ocucaje. Se dedica a la agricultura y por las noches le ayuda a su esposa en la venta de amburguesas. El Señor requiere el crédito para la compra de una mototaxi e incrementar su negocio. El está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Sr. Elmer Andres G. U. lives with his wife and child.  He has his own home located in the village of Pampa Chacaltana Ocucaje.  Elmer works as a farmer and at night helps his wife sell hamburgers.  This gentleman needs a loan to buy a motorcycle taxi and increase his business.  He is grateful for the support that has been provided through this funding.

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio es un joven de 26 anos, se dedica a la producción y venta de fajas artesanales y colchas, desde muy joven se dedicó a la venta ambulante, y generalmente realiza su venta por Ciudad del Este.
Es soltero y vive con sus padres en la compañía Tayy Loma de Carapeguá.
Solicita el crédito para compra de telas, colchas e hilos al por mayor, ya que comprando en cantidad consigue mejores precios y aumenta su margen de ganancia.
El cliente opera con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2007 y cuenta con buen historial de crédito.
texts.en:
Virgilio is a young man who is 26 years of age. He produces and sells handmade belts and blankets. From a young age, Virgilio has worked as a traveling merchant. He usually sells in Ciudad del Este. Virgilio is single and lives with his parents in Tayy Loma de Carapeguá.

He is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, quilts, and thread in bulk. By purchasing in quantity, he will be able to obtain better prices and increase his profit margin. Virgilio joined Fundación Paraguaya in 2007 and has established a good credit history.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, quilts, and thread in bulk

loans.name: Wilson Gustavo

texts.es:
El joven Wilson es de la  compañía Ndavarú de Carapeguá, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la  venta ambulante hace mas de 5 años.
Anteriormente trabajaba en Argentina como albañil, pero a causa de la enfermedad de su mamá tuvo que volver al Paraguay y buscó una alternativa de ingreso económico para poder sobrevivir.
Solicita el crédito ya que tiene muchos pedidos de uniformes y artesanía.
texts.en:
Wilson is a young man from the Ndavarú de Carapeguá company.  He is 26 years old, single and has been working as a door-to-door salesman for over five years.  He used to work in Argentina as a bricklayer but when his mother became ill he had to return to Paraguay and look for another way to make an income.

He is requesting the loan because he has received a lot of orders for uniforms and crafts.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads and crafts

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
El Sr. Victorino C. es de Carapeguá, compañía Cerrito, tiene 42 años y vive en concubinato, cuenta con casa propia y tiene una hija de 3 años.
El Sr. Victorino se dedica al comercio ambulante de ropa (macatero) hace más de 10 años; aprendió este trabajo desde muy joven viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso propio y así manejarse por cuenta propia.
Fue así que empezó a trabajar y hoy día cuenta con más de 60 clientes activos contando con un ingreso semanal considerable.
Comercia sus productos por la ciudad de Guarambaré, Mariano Roque Alonso y Luque.
texts.en:
Mr. Victorino C. is from Carapeguá, the Cerrito company, and is 42 years old.  He has his own home, a live-in partner and a three-year-old daughter.

Mr. Victorino is a door-to-door salesman who has been selling clothing for over 10 years.  He learned his trade when he was very young since he needed to start earning his own income and become independent.

He currently has over 60 active customers and earns a considerable weekly income.  He sells his products in the cities of Guarambaré, Mariano Roque Alonso and Luque.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, towels, blouses, etc.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Para la formación, el presente comité fue iniciado por la Sra. Mirian R. D., domiciliada en el Barrio San Miguel de la Carapeguá.
“San Miguel” fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en la etapa décimo-primer ciclo con 15 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican a diversas actividades, pero todas del ámbito de venta de comidas.
Algunas de las integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr mejorar su emprendimiento, otras sin embargo comienzan con su primera actividad ajena a los que se refiere a su familia.
Las mujeres agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la iniciativa, ya que mediante ella lograron desarrollar bastante la capacidad de trabajo.
Todas realizan actividades independientes, pero con ayuda y esfuerzo lo realizan en forma conjunta. El comité lo conforman mujeres muy sacrificadas que han luchado toda su vida para llevar adelante a sus familiares a pesar de los obstáculos que siempre existen.
texts.en:
This group was initiated by Mrs. Mirian R. D. who lives in the area of San Miguel de la Carapeguá.  The group is called "San  Miguel" and is currently in its 11th year, with 15 members.  The group is comprised of very responsible, hard-working women who have different business actitives all involving food sales.

Some of the members were already working before joining the Women Entrepreneurs group and they joined in order to improve their businesses.  For others, though, this is the first time they are branching out from their roles as homemakers.

The women are grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for this initiative since they are able to develop their work capacity with this support.  All of the members work independently but with the support and effort from the whole group.  These women sacrifice much of their time and have worked all their lives so their families can get ahead despite all the obstacles that stand in their way.

loans.use: To buy meat, rice, pasta, fruit and vegetables; and beverages in some cases

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario F. es de Carapeguá, compañía Tajy Loma, tiene 44 años, vive en pareja, cuenta con casa propia y tiene 5 hijos.
El Sr. Mario se dedica al comercio ambulante de ropa (macatero) hace más de 10 años; aprendió este trabajo con sus padres ya que ellos se dedicaban al mismo trabajo.
Fue así que se independizó y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia. Hoy día cuenta con más de 45 clientes activos y gracias a eso cuenta con un ingreso bastante bueno para su familia.
Comercializa sus productos por la zona de Gran Asunción.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías viendo la demanda existente de su clientela.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario F. is from Carapeguá, the company of Tajy Loma.  He is 44 years old, owns his own home, has a live-in partner and five children.

Mr. Mario has been a door-to-door clothing salesman for over ten years.  He learned his trade from his parents who ran the same business.

Through his work he was able become independent and have his own income.  Today he has over 45 active customers and is able to provide a decent living for his family.

He sells his products in the Gran Asunción area.  He plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise because of the increasing orders he is receiving from customers.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, jeans, pants, shirts, towels, etc.

loans.name: Selvy

texts.es: La Sra. Selvy  tiene  29 años,  de estado civil soltera,  tiene ya 3 años dedicándose a la venta de blusas, poleras, edredones, dejando al crédito o al contado en diferentes viviendas porque lo hace de manera ambulante, vive en casa de sus tíos desde hace 9 años. Doña Selvy   se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la demanda que posee pues tiene un buen grupo de clientes que le hicieron pedidos de blusas y con el dinero ella comprara ropa para realizar las entregas, su deseo de la Sr. Selvy es el de poder comprarse un lote de terreno y poder hacer construir su casita,  es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Selvy is 29 years old and single.  For three years she has been selling blouses, shirts, and quilts in a mobile business, leaving them in her customers' houses on credit or for cash payments.   She has lived in her uncles' house for the past 9 years.  Doña Selvy saw it necessary to ask for a loan from our institution because she has a lot of demand and a good group of clients that requested more blouses from her.  With the loan she will buy clothing for them.  Her wish is to be able to buy a piece of land and construct a small house.  She is a very hardworking woman and is very thankful to the institution for the support that has been given to her.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, quilts and sheets

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro tiene 45 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de  artículos de primera necesidad  en la zona de Carapeguá; tiene clientela formada y quiere solicitar el crédito para aumentar su stock de mercaderías. Está  ubicada a  la entrada  misma de la ciudad, es  muy trabajador  y  ha demostrado mucho  progreso ya que es cliente  antiguo de la  Fundación Paraguaya con  muy buen historial  de pagos.
Tiene casa propia y necesita aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Genaro is 45 years old, and sells articles that meet basic needs in the zone of Carapeguá.  He has established clientele and would like a loan in order to increase his stock of merchandise.  He is located at the entrance of the city, is very hardworking, and has made a lot of progress as a long-time client of the Fundacion Paraguaya with a very good history of repayment.

He has his own home and needs to increase his income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Buy sugar, bran, oil, milk, etc.

loans.name: Magarita

texts.es: Margarita se dedica al destace de cerdo. Tiene más 60 años, la ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del mercado. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación y se siente muy contenta de ser una buena cliente. La mayoría de sus clientes saben que ofrece un buen servicio con sus productos y que la calidad es muy buena. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos, pues actualmente no tiene mucho capital.
texts.en: Margarita is a pig butcher.  She is more than 60 years old.  Her business is located on the outskirts of the market.  She has worked with the Foundation for a long time and is very happy about being a good client.  The majority of her customers know that she offers a good service with her products and that her quality is very good.  This loan is to buy pigs, since she does not currently have much capital.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: La señora Segundina se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio, ya es su segundo ciclo en la institución y sigue contando con la ayuda de su hijo que le colabora con la preparación de algunos platos. Su esposo El Sr.  Eladio trabaja de noche como guardia de seguridad. El nuevo crédito que esta solicitando es para alquilar un local sobre la radial 10 ya que quiere tener una mejor atención y  para comprar un freezer, en su primer crédito demostró un buen comportamiento de pago. La Sra. Segundina es una persona trabajadora, responsable que busca la forma de superarse y seguir adelante y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Senora Segundina sells food from her home.  This is her second cycle with the institution and she continues to rely on the help of her son who assists her with the preparation of some dishes.  Her husband, Eladio, works nights as a security guard.  The new loan will be used to rent a location above the tire store, as she wants to gain more attention, and to buy a freezer.  With her first loan she showed good repayment ability.  Segundina is a very hardworking, responsible person who is looking to better herself and improve the quality of life of her whole family.  She is very thankful to the institution for the support that it has given her.

loans.use: To rent a store, and buy a freezer and business capital

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana Francisca es de Carapeguá, es casada y tiene 46 años, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son menores y 2 ya independizados, cuenta con casa propia.
La Sra. Juana se dedica como vendedora ambulante de ropa hace más de 10 años;  se dedica a este trabajo ya que cuenta con 2 telares grandes para tejer colchas, lo cual fabrica para otros vendedores y a la vez los comercializa por cuenta propia en otras ciudades. Cabe destacar que comercializa también varios otros artículos dependiendo de su clientela.
Cuenta con un ingreso estable mediante este trabajo.
Cuenta con 50 clientes activos por las ciudades donde comercializa sus productos.
Solicita el crédito con la Fundación Paraguaya para compra de otro telar  de modo que obtenga una mayor producción y ganancia.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca is from Carapeguá.  She is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children: 2 are grown up and 2 are still dependent on her.  She owns her own home.

Juana has been working as a traveling saleswoman for more than 10 years.  She has two large looms for weaving bedspreads.  She makes these for other sellers but also sells some herself in other towns.  She also sells other items depending on her customers.

Through this work, Juana makes a stable income.  She has 50 regular customers in the towns where she sells her products.  

Juana is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy another loom so that she can make more of her products and thereby make more profits.

loans.use: To buy fixed assets and clothes (t-shirts, shorts, pants, shirts, etc.)

loans.name: Melvin Jose

texts.es: Melvin José tiene 42 años, su actividad es la crianza de pollos de engorde. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, ya que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante su actividad. Es un hombre muy responsable por lo que siempre está pensando en la forma de mejorar sus ingresos el disfruta de tener un medio de vida que le ha brindado lo necesario para mantener a su familia. El solicita este crédito para la compra de pollos, alimentos para ellos entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en: Melvin José is 42 years old. His activity is raising meat chickens. He has had this business for 2 years and with much effort he has managed to get his activity ahead. He is a very responsible man and is always thinking of ways to improve his income. He enjoys a lifestyle that has given him everything he needs to support his family. He is asking for this loan to buy chickens, feed for them and other necessary things.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Alpina

texts.es: Rosa Alpina se dedica a una pulpería, tiene 3 años en este negocio pues con mucho empeño y dedicación ha logrado obtener este medio de vida. Inicio con pocos productos ya que ciertos clientes le realizan diferentes pedidos, pero con el paso del tiempo obtuvo la experiencia necesaria para seguir creciendo con su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, pan, refrescos entre otros.  Ella sueña con mantener su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en: Rosa Alpina has a small store. She has had this business for 3 years and with a lot of hard work and dedication has been able to have this lifestyle. She started with a few products since certain customers make different orders. As time passed, she obtained the necessary experience to keep growing with her business. The reason for the loan is to buy basic grains, detergent, candies, bread, and more. Her dream is to have a well supplied business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dominga De Los Angeles

texts.es: Dominga De Los Ángeles tiene 50 años, su actividad es la venta de carne, hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio este medio de vida, con muy poco capital de trabajo pues su con mucho esfuerzo ha salido adelante ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a su familia. Ella solicita este medio de vida para la compra de pollo, huevo y carnes. Sueña con mantener siempre activo su medio de vida.
texts.en: Dominga de los Angeles is 50 years old and she has a butcher shop. She has had this business for more than 2 years. She started this business with very little working capital but with a great deal of effort she has been able to succeed. She has always enjoyed to work and to support her family. She requests this loan to purchase chicken, eggs, and meats. She dreams of always having an active lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase chicken, eggs, and meats.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. María Mercedes V. V. ella es trabajadora activa del Colegio Público ”CERMA” desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria  tiene  Veinte y tres   años de trabajar como docente, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  doce créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Maria Mercedes V. V. is an active and hardworking person employed by the public school named "Cerma". She is employed as a primary school teacher and she has twenty three years in the field. She is married. She has had twelve previous loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and  each on has been used to purchase construction materials, including sand, cement, rocks, gravel,  etc. She has been expanding and improving her home. The loans granted through Ceprodel have helped her very much and she has been able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio C. de 39 años, natural del distrito de San Francisco, esta casado con doña Macedonia Quispe  de 37 años de edad,  fruto del gran amor ha logrado tener 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa donde reina la felicidad. Antonio, es un hombre de mucho provecho, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Él es campesino, y siempre esta labrando la tierra, posee una parcela en donde siembra: cacao, hojas de coca, café y plátano, en donde los tres primeros son los productos que mayor rentabilidad le da, debido que las empresas acopiadoras son los que más demanda le hace de estos frutos y le dan una buena paga por cada kilogramo. Han transcurrido 20 años y continua trabajando con mucho esmero en esta actividad,  sin embargo debe tener mucha paciencia para poder combatir con los insectos, ya que dañan los frutos que cultiva. En adelante, espera juntar más capital para poder comprar nuevas tierras. Este es el 15avo  crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao, café y sacos de abono para cubrir su parcela.
texts.en: Antonio C. is 39 years old and he is originally from the district of San Francisco. He is married with Mrs. Macedonia Quispe, 37 years old, and the fruit of their great love has been their 3 children. they live together in their own home and in complete happiness. Antonio is someone who looks to succeed, working with great care in his business. He is a farmer and he has always worked the land. He has a parcel of land where he sows cocoa, coca leaves, coffee, and bananas. The three first products are the most profitable given that these products are the most requested by wholesale companies and he gets good remuneration for each kilogram of product.  Twenty years have passed and he continues to work on his business with great care, but he still needs to exercise a great deal of patience when faced with insect plagues that damage the harvest. IN the future he plans on saving enough capital funds to purchase more land. This is his 15th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he knows that he needs to take the responsibility to make his payments on time, and he is ready to do so. He is always up to date with all the agreements that take place at his communal bank. With the three thousand nuevos soles that he requests, he will purchase cocoa and coffee seeds and sacks of fertilizer to distribute over his land.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco Antonio R. H. él es trabajador activo de la empresa de Enacal Carazo desempeñándose como Fontanero  tiene  cuatro    años de trabajar para esta institución es casado  actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia
texts.en: Francisco Antonio R. Hernandez is an active employee of the Enacal Carazo company, working as a plumber. He has four years working with the company. He is married. He has had two past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each was used to purchase construction materials, including sand, cement, rocks, gravel, etc. to expand and improve his home. the loans granted through Ceprodel have helped him a great deal and he has improved his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, and zinc.

loans.name: Izkra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Izkra; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia trabaja en forma independiente llevando la ropa a diferentes instituciones o al público en general, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar blusas, camisas, pantalones y chompas para el negocio de venta de ropa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Entrepreneurs of San Cristobal". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Izkra. She is 27 years old, single, and the mother of one. She alternates her daily activities with a clothing business. She works independently, offering articles of clothing to various businesses or to the general public. She wants to expand and improve her clothing business. She requests a loan to purchase blouses, shirts, pants, and jackets for her business. 

she is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase articles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionisio A. de 39 años, natural de San Francisco, esta casado con María Pacheco de 40 años de edad, juntos tienen 04 hijos;  viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Carmen pampa anexo del Distrito de Ayna San Francisco. Dionisio es el sustento de su familia; desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar y ha ganarse el dinero con esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza es comprar los productos a los campesinos tales como: café, achiote, cacao y palillo; que son productos netamente de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac y Ene. Ya tiene más de 17 años en este negocio, y cuenta  con el apoyo de su esposa, quien se encarga de pesar los kilogramos de cada producto que vende. Asimismo posee un carro, herramienta que le ayuda a transportar a los diversas comunidades en busca de productos, una vez acumulado una buena cantidad de mercadería lo trasfieren a las empresas acopiadoras de gran renombre como: Cooperativa Agraria, Cacao Vrae, Machupichu; quienes le pagan un gran porcentaje por cada kilogramo de la carga entregada. Su negocio le es muy rentable, asimismo gana extras cuando tiene que entregar la mercadería a las empresas acopiadoras y por tal le premian con una buena cantidad de dinero anualmente. Los meses de enero, febrero y marzo, son épocas de lluvias y derrumbes en las carreteras, lo cual significa impedimento para que pueda transportar dichos productos. Los planes para el futuro es seguir trabajando con el mismo ahínco que le caracteriza para así  sacar adelante a los miembros de su familia. Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos; sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, para así acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido por el resto de los integrantes. Los tres mil nuevos soles que recibirá, lo invertirá como capital para comprar productos a los campesinos.
texts.en: Dionisio A. is 39 years old and originally from San Francisco. He is married with Maria Pacheco, 40 years old, and they have 4 children together. They live in their own home located in the community of Carmen Pampa, near the district of Ayna San Francisco. Dionisio is the sole supporter of his family. Since he was a boy his parents taught him the value of work and that money needs to be earned. His business involves purchasing harvest products from farmers, such as coffee, annatto seeds, cocoa, and guavas. These are products that are native to the forest region of Valle Rio Apurimac and Ene. He has 17 years in the business and he has is wife’s support. She takes care of weighing the products before the sale.  He owns a car and it is a tool which helps him travel to various communities in search of products. Once he has acquired a fair amount of product he transports them to the renowned wholesalers, including Cooperativa Agraria, Cacao Vrae, and Machupichu. They pay him a significant percentage per kilo of product.  His business is very profitable, and additionally, the wholesalers who purchase his merchandise award him with a good sum of money annually. The months of January, February, and March are rainy and roads wash away, impeding him from transporting his gods. His plans for the future are to keep working in the same business in order to support the members of his family. This is his 15th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he has been responsible with his previous loans. He knows he needs to make his payments on time in order to be able to access loans in the future.  He is a very well liked member of this communal bank. The three thousand nuevos soles he requested will be invested in the purchase of harvest products from producers.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
The name Piñata Land brings to mind images of good times and family fun.  Alejandro D. and his family recently bought a party accessory business in their home town of El Paso.  They renamed the store Piñata Land, emphasizing the colorful variety of piñatas they offer.  

The idea of owning a store specializing in piñatas first presented itself when Alejandro’s sister-in-law, who was working at the party accessory store at the time, discovered her employers’ intention to sell the business.  After Alejandro and his family decided they wanted to purchase the business, they approached the store’s former owners with an offer contingent upon financing.  Alejandro needed this financing quickly, before the owners moved on to other interested buyers.  With a loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana, they were able to purchase the store, including the store’s equipment and remaining inventory.

Piñata Land is a true family-owned and operated business, consisting of Alejandro, his wife, brother-in-law, and sister-in-law.  Alejandro’s wife and sister-in-law run the storefront and day-to-day operations, while Alejandro and his brother-in-law balance full-time jobs with managing Piñata Land finances.  Alejandro and his wife handle all of this in addition to raising two small children (ages 3 and 4).  The kids have adapted to their parents' constantly being at work because, as Alejandro explains, “we bring them with us (to the store)… they like being there.”

Alejandro hopes to eventually expand Piñata Land into a catering business, possibly also opening a second storefront.  For now though, he and his family are focused on strengthening their inventory to sell party accessories.   They are off to a good start.  “January is traditionally a slow month, but so far sales are better than expected.”

loans.use: Purchase of business, including existing inventory

loans.name: Uriel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Uriel; el tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artefactos como televisores, computadoras y celulares, el vende los artefactos pero algunos son de segunda mano, el tiene una pequeña tienda que queda en su casa, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artefactos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artefactos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Entrepreneurs of San Cristobal". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

His name is Uriel. He is 33 years old, married common-law, and the father of one. He alternates his daily activities with his electronics business, selling televisions, computers, and cell phones. Some of the products he sells are second hand. He has a small store installed in his house. He wishes to expand and improve his electronics store. He requests a loan to purchase electronics. 

He is happy to receive this loan and he is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase electronics.

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es: Carla Vanessa tiene la edad de 35 años, sus propósitos son superarse en la vida para salir adelante con su negocio ya que es lo que mas importante para seguir generando a su familia el sustento diario. Su actividad económica es la brindar el servicio de bar y comedor, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano para limpiar, realizar las compras y en la elaboración de sus deliciosos platillos. Hace más de  12 años, inicia este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo es que decide establecer un pequeño negocio al principio no poseía la experiencia necesaria para con este negocio, pero con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo la habilidad para hablar con sus clientes. El financiamiento es para granos básicos, frutas, verduras, platos desechables y cubiertos.
texts.en: Carla Vanessa is 35 years old and her goal is to improve herself in order to make her business a success. The most important thing is to keep generating an income for the daily support of her family. She has a restaurant bar. She starts her day very early to clean up, to make her purchases, and to make her delicious recipes. She started her business more than 12 years ago and she started out for the need to find work. She decided to establish a small business of her own. She didn't have the experience she needed with the business but with time she acquired the ability to chat with her clients. Her loan will be used to purchase basic grains, fruits, vegetables, and disposable plates and cutlery.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Cecilia del Carmen G. M. ella es trabajadora activa de la Empresa Ministerio de Salud desempeñándose como Inspectora control de Vectores tiene  Veinte y dos  años  de trabajar para esta institución, es acompañada actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Cecilia del Carmen Garcia M. is an active employee of the Ministry of Health, and she works as a vector control inspector. she has twenty-two years working for this organization. She is married and she has a school-aged son. She has had four past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and she used each one to purchase construction materials, including sand, cement, rocks, gravel, construction blocks, etc., in order to expand and improve their home. The loans granted through Ceprodel have been a great help and she has been able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Danixa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Danixa; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción, ella tiene carros que llevan materiales de construcción a la persona que compra, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pagar el combustible de los carros que realizan el servicio de llevar los materiales de construcción.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Entrepreneurs of San Cristobal". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Danixa. She is 36 years old, married common-law, and the mother of 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business, selling construction materials. She has trucks that deliver construction materials to the purchaser. She wants to expand her construction materials business. She requests a loan to pay for the fuel for the delivery trucks. 

She is happy to have this loan and she is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: To buy fuel the delivery trucks.

loans.name: Williams Erick

texts.es: El señor Williams se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en el radio urbano de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  trabaja con su auto que ahora se encuentra en mal estado el motor ya no tiene fuerza y por esta razón necesita un cambio de motor motivo por el cual solicita el préstamo. El señor vive en casa de su mama  vive con su esposa y sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  su esposa es profesora y también comercia sabanas, edredones y demás.  Ambos de una  u otra forma generan ingresos para la manutención de su familia y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida, es un apersona muy trabajadora y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Williams is a taxi driver in the urban region of the city of Cochabamba. He works with his own car but the engine is in disrepair. The car needs a new engine and it is the reason why he has requested a loan. He lives in his mother's house, living together with is wife and school-aged children. His wife is a teacher and she also sells bedding, dresses and more. They both generate an income one way or another for the support of their family and to improve the quality of their life. He is a very hardworking person and he is thankful to the organization for the support they provide.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his car.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth vive con su familia, ella tiene 56 años y su microempresa es una soda en dicha ciudad. Tiene más de 10 años de tener este negocio y siempre para las fechas de inicio del curso lectivo solicita un crédito con el que abastece su negocio de  productos que vende en su local, tales como gaseosas, galletas, materia prima para la preparación de almuerzos  y otros.
El horario del local es de 7 de la mañana a 8 de la noche, ya que también atiende la escuela nocturna, además los Sábados trabaja de 8 de la mañana a 3 de la tarde, ya que la escuela también trabaja con estudiantes a distancia.

Su familia  es  el principal apoyo del negocio, sus hijas trabajan con ella y generan los ingresos para mantener a sus hijos (nietos de la solicitante) y la confianza que tiene Elizabeth en ellas hacen que el negocio camine mejor.

Su principal clientela son los estudiantes de primaria y el personal docente y administrativo, quienes se deleitan con los deliciosos almuerzos  preparados por ella y además disfrutan de una golosina para el postre. Los ingresos de la actividad son fijos, por lo que el pago de este préstamo es viable. Además este es el segundo crédito que la clienta solicita a Kiva, por medio de Fundación Mujer, demostró tener una excelente conducta de pago con este, cancelándolo en la fecha establecida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives with her family. She is 56 years old and she has a canteen business located in the same city.

She has been in business more than 10 years and at the beginning of the school year she always  requests a loan to supply her business with products, including soft drinks, cookies, and  ingredients to prepare foods. 

Her hours of operation are from 7am to 8pm, also catering to night school. On Saturdays she works from 8am to 3pm because the school is open to distance education students.

Her family is the main support of the business. Her daughters work with her and generate an income of their own to support their children (grandchildren to Elizabeth) and the trust she imparts on them to run the business makes it run smoothly.

Her main clients are the primary school students, and the teachers and administrative staff.  They delight in the delicious foods she prepares and they can also enjoy a sweet for dessert.   The income generated by this business is steady which is why making loan payments is viable.  This is the second Kiva loan accessed by her through Fundacion Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) and she demonstrated excellent conduct with her payments, repaid on the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her canteen.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Susan; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cámaras digitales, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria, ella vende a las personas en general, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cámaras digitales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cámaras digitales.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Entrepreneurs of San Cristobal". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Susan. She is 32 years old, married common-law, and the mother of one son. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling digital cameras. She makes her sales itinerantly to the general public. She wishes to expand and improve her business selling digital cameras. She requests a loan to purchase more digital cameras. 

She is happy to have this loan and she is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase digital cameras.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban O.  tiene 46 años, natural del distrito de San Francisco; esta  casado con la señora Esidora Quispe, de 42 años de edad,  fruto del inmenso amor que tuvieron concibieron 05 hijos; juntos viven en su propia casa  en la localidad de Carmen pampa anexo de San Francisco. Esteban, es campesino  sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niño,  viene trabajando en su propia chacra hace 20 años  donde cultiva los siguientes productos: cacao, café y plátano. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y los jornaleros. Sabe muy bien el dinero que obtiene es por producir buena calidad de frutos. Sus productos de cacao y café los comercializa  en la ciudad de San Francisco, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen por la calidad de sus granos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo no han sido en vano. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para aumentar su producción. Este es su 16avo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en: Esteban O. is 46 years old and originally from the district of San Francisco. He is married with Esidora Quispe, 42 years old, and the fruit of their immense love is their 5 children. They live together in their own home in the community of Carmen Pampa near San Francisco. Satan is an agriculturist and his parents taught him the business since he was a boy. He has been working his fields for 20 years, cultivating the following products: cocoa, coffee, and bananas. During the harvest season he depends on his family's support and that of hired laborers. He knows that his earnings directly depend on the quality of the harvest. He sells his cocoa and coffee harvest in the city of San Francisco where he gets the best prices for the quality of the grains.
