Yedi belongs to the “Hijas de María” (Maria's Daughters) communal bank, a part of the Arariwa Association, Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is in its third year, and it has been going very well for all of the members.

loans.use: Personal use.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco las personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios. Juana se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir y tiene un pequeño taller donde realiza sus actividades. Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar más telas, hilos, botones y muchas cosas más. El sueño de la socia abrir otra tienda donde tenga maquinas de coses industriales.    
    
Juana pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the historic city of Cusco, Cusco Department, Perú.  In the city of Cusco, people make their livings with different types of businesses and services.  Juana makes her living making clothing, and she has a small workshop in which to create the garments.  Juana needs the loan to purchase more fabric, thread, buttons and many other things.  Her dream is to open another store where she would have industrial sewing machines.  
    
Juana belongs to the "Hijas de María” (Maria's Daughters) communal bank, a part of the Arariwa Association, Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is in its third year, and it has been going very well for all of the members.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric, thread, buttons and many other things.

loans.name: María Ercilia

texts.es:
La Señora María Y. es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por la comunidad de La Ramada que  pertenece al cantón Nabon, este sector es de clima frió su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. 

La Señora. María tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de 23, 18, 16, 14, 10, 7 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, sus 4 hijos siguientes son discapacitados, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela del sector. Su esposo labora como albañil, han construido su casa con mucho esfuerzo pero ahora por una inestabilidad del suelo su casa esta con grietas a punto de derrumbarse por lo tanto vive en una casa donde está  trabajando.

Doña María se dedica a la agricultura, labora un día en las tierras de sus jefes y otro día en sus terrenos alternativamente de domingo a domingo, también cría animales como: cerdos, cuyes y borregos a los cuales los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas para sus huertos y abono. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para construir otra casa.
texts.en:
Ms. María Y. is a member of the Nuevo Bankito la Ramada ["New Bank of Ramada"] and lives in the community of La Ramada, in the canton of Nabon. It is a region with a cold climate, where the people work in farming and livestock.

Ms. María is 41 years old, married, and has seven children, ages 23, 18, 16, 14, 10, 7, and 6. Her oldest son is married and lives on his own. Her next four children are handicapped, and her youngest two study at the local school. Her husband works as a mason. He put a great deal of effort into building their house but now, due to an instability in the ground, their house is cracking and on the brink of collapse. Therefore, they are currently living in a house where María's husband is working.

Ms. María works in agriculture. She works one day on her employers' land and the next day on her own, every day of the week. She also raises animals like pigs, guinea pigs, and lambs, which she sells when she needs the money. 

She has been a member of her communal bank for a year and she plans to invest her loan in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for her fields. Her dream is to buy a piece of land to build another house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco las personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios. Vilma se dedica a elaborar artesanía y exporta sus productos. Vilma requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales. El sueño de la socia es abrir una tienda donde puede vender sus productos.  
       
Vilma pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Vilma lives in the historic city of Cusco in the Department of Cusco, Peru. In the city of Cusco, the residents engage in different types of businesses and provide services. Vilma makes handicrafts and exports her products. She needs a loan to buy materials. Vilma’s dream is to open a store where she can sell her products.

Vilma belongs to the Communal Bank “Hijas de María” (Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Araiwa, in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
ose Martin de 48 años de edad casado, labora para DISSUR como tecnico en lectura y reparto desde hace 23 años.  Su esposa le ayuda con los gastos familiares, ella labora para el complejo, tienen 3 hijos los cuales 2 se encuentran estudiando en la secundaria y el menor esta en primaria.  
Necesita este financiamiento para realizar mejoras a su vivienda  parte de la construccion del muro del patio de su casa y brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. 
Suena con darle buena educacion a sus hijos que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Jose Martin is 48 years old and married.  He has worked for DISSUR (Nicaragua power distributor) as a technician in reading and distribution for 23 years.  His wife helps him with the family expenses.  She works for the complex.  They have three children.  Two of them are in high school, and the youngest is in elementary school.

He needs this loan to make improvements on his house.  He will build a wall to the patio at his house.  This will give his family better living conditions.

He dreams of giving his children a good education and that they become respectable people.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Fernando es el diseño grafico, creación de páginas web y también brinda servicios de mantenimiento de computadoras. El es profesional independiente que tiene una oficina en su domicilio y depende de las oportunidades de negocio que existan en el momento. Fernando nos cuenta que también se dedica a alquilar locales que sirven para oficinas y tiendas. Fernando requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer mantenimiento de los locales que alquila. El sueño de Fernando es abrir una imprenta.   

Fernando pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in the city of Cusco, located in the Department of Cusco, Peru. His main business involves graphic design, the creation of web pages, as well as providing computer maintenance services. He works as an independent professional in an office in his home and depends on the business opportunities that exist at the moment. Fernando says that he also rents out locations used for offices and shops. He needs a loan to buy materials for maintaining these rental properties. His dream is to open a print shop.

Fernando belongs to the Communal Bank “Hijas de María” (Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Araiwa, in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is in its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well.

loans.use: Purchase materials to maintain his rental properties

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Bertha es la venta de zapatos, ella compra mercadería de los proveedores y hay veces viaja a comprar mercadería a la ciudad de Arequipa, Lima y Tacna. Bertha requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como zapatos tanto como para niños, mujeres y varones. 

Bertha pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Bertha lives in the city of Cusco, which is located in the Department of Cusco, Peru. She sells shoes and buys her merchandise from the distributors. There are times when she must travel to the cities of Arequipa, Lima, and Tacna to acquire her inventory. Bertha needs a loan to buy merchandise such as shoes for children, women, and men.

Bertha belongs to the Communal Bank “Hijas de María” (Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Araiwa, in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is in its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well.

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Ninoska

texts.es:
Ninoska tiene  31 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Ninoska es la venta de licorería, ella alquila el local y le puso de nombre “Licoreria Open”, la tienda funciona toda el día y toda noche donde a tienden dos personas cada una en su respectivo turno. Ninoska requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como gaseosas y otras cosas más. Su anhelo de Ninoska es abrir otra tienda de licorería.  

Ninoska pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Ninoska is 31 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, which is located in the Department of Cusco, Peru. Her main business activity involves selling liquor from a shop she rents called “Licoreria Open”. Her store is open all day and all night and attended by two employees who work in shifts. Ninoska needs a loan to buy merchandise such as sodas and other items. Her dream is to open another liquor store.

Ninoska belongs to the Communal Bank “Hijas de María” (Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Araiwa, in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is in its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as sodas and other beverages

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet tiene  30 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Janet es la venta de muebles y colchones, ella tiene su propio local en la plaza principal del distrito de Santiago, Cusco.  Ya son 4 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Janet requiere el préstamo para comprar muebles como por ejemplo roperos, sillas y otras cosas más. El sueño de la socia es abrir otras tiendas. 
 
Janet pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, which is in the Department of Cusco, Peru. Her main business activity is selling furniture and mattresses. She has her own shop in the main plaza in the District of Santiago in Cusco. Janet has been in this business for four years and has done very well. She needs a loan to buy furniture such as wardrobes, chairs, and other pieces. Her dream is to open other stores.

Janet belongs to the Communal Bank “Hijas de María” (Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Araiwa, in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well.

loans.use: Purchase wardrobes, chairs, and other furniture pieces

loans.name: Excelencia Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Excelencia,escogio este nombre  porque tienen el reto D. comportarse como lo dice su nombre, este grupo se encuentra en Toluca Estado D. Mexico; el grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes, una D. las integrantes es la señora Irma R., tiene 35 años y casada desD. hace 18 años; tienen 2 hijos D. 17 años y 7 años estudian actualmente la educacion media superior y la educacion primaria. La señora decidio apoyar a su marido con la venta D. zapato por catálogo, solicito el prestamo para una  mayor cobertura D. entrega a sus clientas y así elevar sus ventas. Sus hijos son su mayor inspiracion para trabajar día con día teniendo como meta darles una mejor educación.
texts.en:
This group is called “Excelencia” (Excellence), a name that was chosen because the members have been challenged to conduct themselves in such a manner. The group is from Toluca in the State of Mexico and consists of ten members.

One of the members is Sra. Irma R.. She is 35 years old and has been married since she was 18. Irma has two children, ages 17 and 7, who are currently in high school and elementary school respectively. She decided to help her husband by selling shoes through a catalog. Irma is requesting a loan so that she can cover most of the cost of her customers’ orders and increase her sales. Her children are her greatest inspiration, so she works day after day to proviD. them with a good education.

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Yanett Del Pilar

texts.es:
Yanett Del Pilar tiene 40 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Yanett Del Pilar es la elaboración y venta de artesanía como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas, escarpines, ella no solo distribuye a las vendedoras de artesanía de la zona del Cusco sino también envía mercadería a Italia a sus familiares. Ya son 4 años y medio que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Yanett requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar artesanía. El sueño de la socia es abrir una tienda, trabajar de forma más formal y distribuir a otros países. 

Yanett pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Yanett Del Pilar is 40 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, which is located in the Department of Cusco, Peru. Her main business activity is making and selling handicrafts such as sweaters, scarves, and socks. In addition to distributing to the craft merchants in the District of Cusco, she ships her merchandise to her relatives in Italy. Yanett has been in business for 4½ years and has done very well. She needs a loan to buy materials for making crafts. Her dreams include opening a store, working in a more formal manner, and exporting to other countries.

Yanett belongs to the Communal Bank “Hijas de María” (Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Araiwa, in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is in its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making crafts

loans.name: Yolanda Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 40 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de Elsa es la venta de ropa interior de forma ambulatoria, ella se instala en la puerta de un centro comercial que se encuentra ubicado entre las calles Pera y Trinitarias. La pueden encontrar desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche todos los días ofreciendo sus productos. Ya son 8 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Elsa requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como medias, calzones calzoncillos y entre otros. 

Elsa pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old and lives in the city and department of Cusco, Peru. Her main source of income is selling undergarments, which she does in an ambulatory manner. She typically sets herself up at the entrance of a commercial center located between Pera and Trinitarias Streets. You can find her there selling her merchandise from 10 in the morning until 9 at night every day. She has been running this business for eight years already and it is going very well. Elsa needs this loan to buy merchandise like hosiery, underwear, and other items.

Elsa belongs to the "Hijas de María" ["Daughters of María"] communal bank of Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Peru. Her communal bank is in its third year of existence and all of its members are doing very well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as hosiery and undergarments

loans.name: Rosa Alegria

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por la comunidad de La Ramada que  pertenece al cantón Nabon, este sector es de clima frió su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.
 
Doña Rosa tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, tres de ellos son casados de los que solo dos viven independientes y uno vive en su casa y comparte los gastos, sus otros hijos de 16, 12, 8 y 6 años de edad, estudian en el colegio y en escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, han logrado construir su casa propia en unión conyugal.

La Señora. Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas las que son para su consumo y las vende en su comunidad, también cría animales como: cerdos, cuyes y gallinas.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal hace un años y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas en el, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas y en su alimento. Su sueño es  mejorar su casita.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the Nuevo Bankito la Ramada Banco Comunal. She lives in the La Ramada  community in the Nabon canton, which has a cold climate.  Her people work in farming and raising cattle.

Señora Rosa is 49 years old. She is married and has seven children, three of whom are married and out of those three only two live independently and the other one lives in her house and shares the expenses. Her other children, aged 16, 12, 8 and 6, attend elementary school and high school in the community. Her husband works as a builder, and they have built their own family home themselves.

Señora Rosa works in farming, growing vegetables for their own consumption and to sell in the community. She also rears animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.

She has been a member of the Banco Comunal for one year and she likes the fact that she has good friends there. She will use the money from her loan to buy chickens and chicken feed. Her dream is to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 51 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Silvia trabaja en la institución privada ABC de PRODEIN como personal de limpieza y lavandera. Silvia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que en sus horas libres se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades y ofrece sus productos en la feria sabatina y dominical de la plaza Túpac Amaru del distrito de Wanchaq, Cusco. Ya son 2 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Silvia requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo telas, napa, cintas, globos, pintura, lana y mantas.  

Silvia pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Silvia is 51 years old and lives in the city of Cusco in the department of Cusco in Peru. She works in the private institution, ABC, which is operated by PRODEIN (the human rights branch of the Catholic Order, Lumen Dei), where she is a member of the cleaning and laundry staff. Silvia is a determined and enterprising woman, who spends her spare time making handicrafts, which she sells at the weekend fair in the Túpac Amaru square in the Wanchaq district of Cusco. Silvia has dedicated the last two years to this business and it is going well. She needs a loan to buy materials such as fabrics, imitation leather, ribbons, balloons, paint, wool and blankets. 

Silvia belongs to the Asociación Arariwa's "Hijas de María" Banco Comunal in Cusco, Peru. This Banco Comunal is in its third year of operation and all the members are very happy with it.

loans.use: To buy materials such as fabrics, imitation leather, ribbons, balloons, paint, wool and blankets

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina tiene 31 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Guillermina y su esposo Alberto tienen un pequeño taller de fabricación de muebles de madera. Su esposo es el que fabrica los muebles de madera y Guillermina le da el acabado a los muebles ósea pule, pinta y saca brillo. Ellos venden sus productos los sábados al lado del populoso mercado “El Molino”. Ya son 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Guillermina requiere el préstamo para comprar madera de tipo caoba, corriente y otras.
 
Guillermina pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 31 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco, in Peru. Guillermina and her husband Alberto have a small workshop where they make wooden furniture. Her husband is the one who makes the furniture out of wood, and Guillermina puts finishes on the furniture, that is, she polishes it, paints it, and makes it shine. They sell their products on Saturdays alongside the popular "El Molino" market. They have already worked at this business for six years, and it is going very well for them. Guillermina needs the loan to buy wood such as caoba (mahogany), softwoods, and other types.

Guillermina belongs to the community bank "Hijas de Maria" (Daughters of Mary) of Asociación Arariwa, in Cusco, Peru. The community bank is in its third year, and it's going very well for all the members.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Alfredo Saturnino

texts.es:
Alfredo vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Alfredo trabaja como empleado en la municipalidad del Cusco, él  es supervisor del área de limpieza pública. Alfredo y esposa Rosa Mery tienen una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ellos se turnan para atender la tienda y la tienda está abierta desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche todos los días. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Alfredo requiere el préstamo para aumentar la mercadería y desea comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. 
Alfredo pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en: Alfredo lives in the city of Cusco in the department of Cusco, Peru. Alfredo works as an employee of the municipality of Cusco. He is the supervisor in the area of public sanitation. Alfredo and his wife Roda Mery have a small grocery store. They take turns attending to the store and the store is open from 6AM until 9PM every day. They've been dedicated to this business for ten years and it's been going well. Alfredo requires the loan to expand merchandise and he wishes to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and many more things. Alfredo belongs to the "Hijas de Maria" community bank of the Arariwa Association of Cusco, Peru. The community bank is its third year of operation and all of the members are doing well.

loans.use: To expand merchandise.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina tiene  44 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Josefina trabaja como empleado de la municipalidad del Cusco, ella trabaja en el terminal terrestre como recaudar del TAME. Josefina y dos de sus hermanos tienen una casa que están haciendo construir para luego abrir un restaurante. Josefina requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales y con estos hacer revestir la casa. 

Josefina pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en: Josefina is 44 years old and lives in the city of Cusco in the department of Cusco, Peru. Josefina works as an employee of the Cusco municipality. She works in the bus terminal collecting TAME. Josefina and two of her brothers have a house that they have been building so they can then open a restaurant. Josefina requires a loan to buy materials with which she can redo the house. Josefina belongs to the Hijas de Maria community bank of the Arariwa Association of Cusco Peru. The community bank is in its third year of operations and all of the members are doing well.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón tiene 25 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Simón trabaja en la institución privada ABC de PRODEIN como vigilante, él socio viaja a la ciudad de Oropesa donde cuida el local de la institución, él empieza su jornada laboral a partir de las 7 de la mañana hasta el otro día pero el trabajo es inter diario. El socio nos cuenta que su papá Martin vive en la ciudad de Paruro donde se dedica agricultura y ganadería, simon está pensando invertir dinero en el negocio, el socio Simón con el préstamo está pensando comprar herramientas para ayudar a su padre en el cultivo y la cosecha.

Simón pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Simón is 25 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  Simón works as a security guard for the private institution ABC which is operated by PRODEIN (the human rights branch of the Catholic Order, Lumen Dei).  He travels to the city of Oropesa where he looks after the institution.  His work day starts at 7.00am and lasts until the following day but he only works every second day.  He tells us that his dad Martin lives in the city of Paruro where he grows crops and raises livestock.  Simón is thinking of investing money in the business.  Simón is planning to buy tools to help his father with his crop farming.

Simón is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Hijas de María” (Daughters of María) community bank, in Cusco, Peru.  The community bank is in its third year and is working very well for all its members.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Carmen Piedad

texts.es:
Señora. Carmen L. es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por la comunidad de La Ramada que  pertenece al cantón Nabon, este sector es de clima frió su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.
 
La Señora. Carmen se dedica  a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y verduras los que son mas para su consumo, también cría animales como: gallinas, cuyes, cerdos y borregos los que vende en su comunidad.

Doña Carmen tiene 21 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es la herencia de sus padres.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas y en el alimento para sus animales. Su sueño es tener su casa propia
texts.en:
Carmen L. is a member of the Nuevo Bankito la Ramada community bank.  She lives in La Ramada neighborhood, in Nabon canton.  This area has a cold climate.  Its people work in crop farming and livestock raising.

Carmen does her housework and farms.  She sows vegetables and greens which are mainly for her own consumption.  She also raises animals such as hens, guinea pigs, pigs and lambs which she sells in her area.

Carmen is 21 years old, married, and has a 3 year-old son.  Her husband works as a construction worker.  The house they live in is her parents' inheritance.

Carmen has been a member of her community bank for one year and she will invest her new loan in buying hens and feed for her animals.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy hens and animal feed

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 29 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Ruth trabaja en la institución privada ABC de PRODEIN como cocinera, ella también tiene un pequeño galpón donde cría animales menores como cuyes, ella vende sus animales a precios cómodos y accesibles para el cliente. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes reproductores y que se han de buena raza.   

Ruth pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Ruth is 29 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  Ruth works as a cook for the private institution ABC which is operated by PRODEIN (the human rights branch of the Catholic Order, Lumen Dei).  She also has a small shed where she raises animals such as guinea pigs.  She sells her animals at prices that are affordable to her customers.  She requires this loan to buy a good breed of guinea pigs that she can use for breeding.

Ruth is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Hijas de María” (Daughters of María) community bank in Cusco, Peru.  The community bank is in its third year and is working very well for all its members.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Cheam's Group

texts.en:
In this group loan there are four members, located in Preaek Hour Lech village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Cheam N. is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. She stays at home, while her husband, Mr. Chham Vuthy, earns their living as a motorbike taxi driver and earns a small income to support his family. This couple has three children. Two are security guards, and the other is a seamstress in a garment factory. 

Now her husband's motorbike is broken, so she would like to ask for a loan to support its repair.

loans.use: To support her husband’s motorbike repair

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. María trabaja en la institución privada ABC de PRODEIN y Casa Campesina como asistencia social, ella también tiene un pequeña librería frente al colegio “Humberto Luna”, ella nos cuenta que trabaja como asistente desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde de lunes a sábados, ella por las tardes atiende su librería. Ya son cuatro años que abrió la librería y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. María requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería pues ya se esta acercando campaña escolar.  

María pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
María lives in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  María works as a social worker for the private institution ABC which is operated by PRODEIN (the human rights branch of the Catholic Order, Lumen Dei).  She also has a small book store opposite Humberto Luna school.  She tells us that she works as a social worker from 10.00am to 2.00pm, from Monday to Saturday.  In the afternoons, she serves in her book store.  She opened her book store four years ago and it is doing very well thanks to her hard work.  María requires this loan to buy merchandise since the school year will start soon.

María is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Hijas de María” (Daughters of María) community bank in Cusco, Peru.  The community bank is in its third year and is working very well for all its members.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 46 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Mercedes después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a tender su tienda de abarrotes, ella abre la  tienda aproximadamente a las 5 de la mañana y cierra a las 10 de la noche todos los días. Ya son 16 años que abrió la tienda y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Mercedes requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. 

Mercedes pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 46 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  After she has done her housework every day, Mercedes serves in her grocery store  She opens her store at around 5.00am and closes at 10.00pm, every day.  She opened her store 16 years ago and it has done very well thanks to her hard work.

Mercedes requires this loan to buy merchandise such as, for example, rice, sugar, noodles and many other products.

Mercedes is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Hijas de María” (Daughters of María) community bank in Cusco, Peru.  The community bank is in its third year and is working very well for all its members.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as, for example, rice, sugar, noodles and many other products

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es:
Prudencia tiene 43 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Prudencia se dedica a la venta de carne y quesos y tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Prudencia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo carne y queso. 

Prudencia pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Prudencia is 43 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  Prudencia sells meat and cheese and has a small store in her home.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well thanks to her hard work.

Prudencia needs this loan to buy merchandise such as meat and cheese.

Prudencia is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Hijas de María” (Daughters of María) community bank in Cusco, Peru.  The community bank is in its third year and is working very well for all its members.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as meat and cheese

loans.name: David Gaudencio

texts.es:
David vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. David se dedica a la venta de bocaditos especiales llamados “Churros”, él y su esposa Lidia venden de forma ambulatoria en sus productos en carretas acondicionadas para este negocio, ellos trabajan con cinco empleados quienes atienden las carretas. Ya son varios años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. David requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, miel y muchas cosas más.   

David pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
David lives in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  He sells special snacks called 'churros'.  He and his wife Lidia sell their products as itinerant street vendors from small carts which are adapted for this business.  They work with five employees who serve from the carts.  They have been in this business for several years and it is doing very well thanks to their hard work.

David needs this loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, honey and many other products.

David is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Hijas de María” (Daughters of María) community bank in Cusco, Peru.  The community bank is in its third year and is working very well for all its members.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as flour, sugar, honey, and many other products

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 51 años D. edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Lidia se dedica a la venta D. bocaditos especiales llamados “Churros”, ella venD. D. forma ambulatoria en sus productos en carretas acondicionadas para este negocio, ella trabaja con cinco empleados quienes atienden cada uno D. las cinco carretas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Lidia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, miel y muchas cosas más.   

Lidia pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas D. María” D. la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año D. funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Lidia is 51 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  Lidia sells special snacks called 'churros'.  She sells her products as an itinerant street vendor from small carts which are adapted for this business.  She works with five employees who serve from the five carts she has.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well thanks to her hard work.

Lidia needs this loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, honey and many other products.

Lidia is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Hijas D. María” (Daughters of María) community bank in Cusco, Peru.  The community bank is in its third year and is working very well for all its members.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna U. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 57 years old. Myrna is a widow and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. 

Myrna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora J. is 59 years old. Leonora is married. To make a living, she cultivates decorative trees to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. 

Leonora is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which again will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta P. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 37 years old. Julieta is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Julieta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita C. is a married woman who lives in Aguinaldo, Calubang, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business.  Her husband, Hernany, who is 57 years old, works as a Barangay Tanod (village policeman) to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 19 and 31 years old. 

Florita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $233, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children’s education and house expansion. Florita C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Rheza

texts.en:
Rheza B. is from the village of Panalsalan. She is 33 years old. Rheza is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She is just starting this business.

In 2005, Rheza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Rheza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 11th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Snguon's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members located in Ta Kdol village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Snguon K. is 38 years old, and she is the group leader. She was selected to be group leader by the other members. She earns her living by selling vegetables in the market. In order to support this business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to increase her business. Her husband, Mr. Kheav Kosal, is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. 

This couple is working hard with their businesses to support their four children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a mechanic, and one is a student in a local school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to increase her business

loans.name: Maria Leanie

texts.en:
Maria Leanie A. is from the village of Bato. She is 42 years old. Maria Leanie is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Leanie owns and operates a fishing business venture in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Maria Leanie is just starting this business.

In 2005, Maria Leanie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Leanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Maria Leanie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Maria Leanie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lonh's Group

texts.en:
In the Preaek Hour village in Kandal province there are four people who form this group loan. The members of this group will use their money to support their different purposes.  

Mrs. Lonh P. is a 41-year-old married woman, and she is the group leader who was selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Ouch Thon, earn their living by cultivating mushrooms.  They lack enough money to continue to grow them, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase mushroom seeds for growing mushrooms. Aside from farming, they also earn their living by selling honey from bees. 

Mrs. Lonh P. is the mother of five children, two of whom are working in a printing house while the others are students in the local school. They also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To purchase mushroom seeds for growing mushrooms.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Manuel C. G. él es trabajador activo del Ministerio de salud de  San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como conductor tiene  Veinte y un años  de trabajar para esta institución ,es casado actualmente tiene dos  hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel C. G. works as a driver for the Ministry of Health in San Rafael del Sur.  He has been working for this institution for twenty-one years.  He is married and has two school-age children.

Juan Manuel has had five loans from CEPRODEL and has used each one to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc. in order to extend and improve his home.  Ceprodel's loans have been very useful to him since they have enabled him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy building supplies: sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Paen's Group

texts.en:
In Preaek Hour Kaeut, this village bank loan has seven members. It is located in the Kandal province. Each member of this village bank will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Paen S. R. was born in 1967. She is the village bank president selected by the other members. She earns her living by selling groceries in the  village. In order to increase her income to improve her famiL.’s situation, she would like to ask for a loan to buy mobile phone top up cards to sell. Her husband, Mr. Kong Sopheap, is 49 years old and works as a police officer and is able to receive a little income to support his famiL.. 

This couple has two children who are students in the local school and also support their mother's business.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone top up cards to sell.

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel S. is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: the buying and selling of Nipa (palm fronds woven into roof materials) and a general store business. She lives in Purok Bugnay, Barangay Vista Alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her buying and selling of Nipa and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $114. 

Jocel is now borrowing 29,500 PHP so that she can purchase more materials.  This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jocel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more materials

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita P. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 48 years old. Lolita is a widow and has ten school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2003, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase a fishing boat. 

Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This will be her 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members. They are located in Preaek Ruessei village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Van R. is a 25-year-old married woman, and she is also the group leader selected by the other members. She is a staff worker at a gasoline station, and her husband, Mr. Tit Phearith, works as a medicine seller for a salary. With their occupations, they are able to receive a little income to support their family. This couple doesn’t have any children.  

Mrs. Van R. has a problem because her father recently died from an illness. She would like to ask for a loan to pay for her father's funeral.

texts.en:
These four people are forming a group loan; they are located in Lekh Bei village in Kandal province.  While each member of this village will use their money to support their own different purpose. 

Mrs. Phum P. is 48 years old, and she is the group leader.  She was selected as the group leader by its members.  She and her husband, Mr. Choup Choeun, are farmers who own a plot of land for growing green vegetables that they sell to support the family.  With this farm, they do not have enough money to farm it.  So Mrs. Phum P. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her farming. 

They have four children: three are seamstresses in the garment factory and the last one is attending a local school.

Her husband, Mr. Sman You, is fishermen who are able to earn a little income to support their family living.

This couple has eight children: five of whom are fishermen and two are attending in the local school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith E. is a married woman who lives in Purok 4, Brgy. Tuyom, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, a rice mill and a sugarcane plantation. 

Her husband, Lauro, who is 51 years old, manages the sugarcane field to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. 

They have two children who are 19 and 23 years old. 

Judith joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Judith has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use as funds in her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future household and family expenses. 

Judith E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Mr. Daim Norith Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 15 people who live in Kruos village in TaK. province. 

Mr. Daim N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. They will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to support their families. 

Mr. Daim N. owns a rice mill in the local village and he is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family.

His wife, Mrs. Yorm Net, is a weaver who is able to earn some money to support her family, too. 

They have  three children, one of whom is a weaver, one is employed in a garment factory, and the other is a student.

Currently, Mr. Daim N. wants to breed a cow, yet his savings money is not enough to buy one. So Mr. Daim N. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Nine people are forming a village bank loan. They are located in Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province. The other members selected Mrs. Leng P., a 31-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. 

Mrs. Leng P. and her husband, Mr. Dul SoK., have two children. One is attending a local school and the younger is 3 years old.
 
They are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land that they use to cultivate rice, peanuts and vegetables for selling to support the family. 

With this farming, they still earn less income than they need to improve their lives. So, Mrs. Leng P. would like to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding and pig food. With her new business, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family’s condition.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda N. is from the village of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Melinda is married. To make a living, Melinda owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melinda has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1999, Melinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Melinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 19th loan taken out by Melinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna M. is 57 years old, married and supports her family by selling nipa, or palm leaves which are used in homes and to make baskets. She lives in Prk. Aguinaldo, Brgy. Calubang, Ilog, Negros Occidental and has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996. She has made good use of loans from NWTF to improve her family's living standards. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,500 and is applying for a new loan, for PHP 12,000, to buy more nipa to sell to her customers. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and her goal is to continue to improve her family's living standards. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more nipa leaves to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ruth Zenelia

texts.es: La  Sra. Ruth Zenelia S. B. ella es trabajadora activa de la Empresa “Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur” desempeñándose como  Operario de Patio tiene  dos años  de trabajar para esta institución, es Acompañada actualmente tiene dos  hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y uno lo realizo para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, este lo está solicitando para la compra de una cabeza de ganado, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth Zenelia S. B. works at the municipal mayor's office as a grounds maintenance worker. She has held this job for two years. Ruth has two school-aged children. She has previously had two loans from CEPRODEL, one of which she used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, cinder blocks, etc. to expand and improve her house. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase livestock. Loans from CEPRODEL have greatly benefited Ruth's, allowing her to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda B. is married and lives in Prk. Bugnay, Brgy. Vsta Alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by buying and selling nipa, a type of palm leaf which is used in homes and to make items such as baskets. Her husband Josue B., who is 52 years old, works as caretaker of a fish pond and also helps in his wife in her business activities. They have two children who are 18 and 21 years old. The older one is married while the younger is still in school. Merlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she wanted a better for her family. With the help of her 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been slowly lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. She has applied for a new loan to buy more nipa to sell, and hopes to generate enough income to help her younger child complete school. Merlinda B. following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman who lives in La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (variety) store and pig fattening. Her husband Ignacio G., who is 62 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are between 25 and 38 years old; all of her children have their own family now. 

Rosita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1990 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion. Rosita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna V. is a 44-year-old single woman who lives in La Castellana in Negros Occidental province in the Visayas islands. She supports her family through two businesses: a sari-sari (general) store and a pig-fattening venture. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1992 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store and pig-fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 PHP.

Johna is borrowing 20,000 PHP, her fifteenth loan from NWTF, so that she can fund her operations. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Johna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Patila Usonova's Group

texts.en:
Patila U., 66, is the leader of this group. Unfortunately, Patila is a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. Her first son and her daughter are married; they are employed and live with their families. Her second son went to work in Russia in order to earn money. She is a resident of Uzgen, an ancient town near Osh.

Ten years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS Patila started to prepare and sell food. In this way she earns 5,000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more food in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future Patila wants to improve the family’s living conditions.

About Mol Bulak Finance (MBF):

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase food to prepare to sell

texts.en:
Anita A. is 62 years old, married and, unluckily, has no children. She is from the village of Siparok, a part of the municipality of Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte province of the Mindanao islands. Anita runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She also receives a monthly pension. Anita has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from both these sources.

Anita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Anita is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP that will be used to add to her capital for her business. This is the first loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy products for her store.

location.town: Siparok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Mairambu's Group

texts.en:
Mairambu A. is the treasurer of this group. She is 52 and married. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters and a son. All the children are married and live separately with their families. Seven years ago, with the initial investment of 10,000 soms, the family bought a cow for breeding. Since that moment the family breeds livestock to earn money. With money received from the loan, Mairambu wants to purchase livestock. In the future she wants to enlarge her shed and expand her business.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mathews

texts.en:
Mathews has been practicing mixed farming for the last six years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His main products are tomatoes, milk, bananas and onions which are all sold locally.

He has requested a loan of 31,200 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with the dairy cow he will acquire, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and for sale. He says that in the next 5 years he would like to have 5 dairy cows and be the main supplier of milk to the local dairy plants.

Mathews is 30 years old and married with 3 children whose ages range between 3 and 9. Two of the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edgar Osmin

texts.es: Edgar Osmin R. G., reside en el departamento de Chalatenango, ubicado al norte del país, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa.  Edgar es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica a vender minutas, las cuales son hechas de hielo granizado, cubierto de jarabes de frutas, las cuales comercializa de forma ambulante por diferentes lugars de Chalatenango. Su venta es bastante estable, y es la que le permite sostener su hogar, ya que su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Edgar solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de maquetas de hielo, así mismo para comprar más variedad de jarabes de distintos sabores. De esta manera él espera mejorar sus ganancias y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Edgar Osmin R. G. lives with his wife in the Chalatenango department, which is in the northern part of the country.  Edgar is a very hard-working person.  He sells snacks, which are made from crushed ice and covered with fruit syrups.  He sells in an itinerant manner at different places in Chalatenango.  His sales are stable enough, and they allow him to support his household.  His wife does the household chores.

Edgar is requesting a loan to be able to have the money he needs to buy a greater quantity of blocks of ice.  He also wants to buy a greater variety of different flavors of syrup.  This way he hopes to improve his earnings and get ahead.

loans.use: To buy ice and fruit flavored syrups

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred, 31, is married with four school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer in Kitale town, western Kenya, where he has been farming for seven years. He sells his milk and onions at the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.

He recently repaid his previous loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested another loan of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to send his children to a better school. His major challenge is lack of enough animal feed, especially during the dry season.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been practicing mixed farming for six years now in Kitale town, western Kenya. His main products are milk and eggs which are sold locally. He also earns income from his motorcycle transport business in the same location.

John has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, having successfully repaid his three previous loans. He has requested this loan of 30,000 Kes to expand his poultry farm. The profits from this investment will enable him to meet the basic needs of his family. He plans to acquire a generator and a power-saw in the next five years.

John is 33 years old and married, with three school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farm

loans.name: Mpara Church Leaders Group

texts.en: Violet is a member of Mpara Church leaders group where each member guarantees the other to access credit. She lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda and her family dream is to build a permanent house. For three years she has been in the retail  trade and with the profits she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Violet intends to use the loan to buy cooking oil, salt, and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing cooking oil, salt, and cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Jepta

texts.en:
Jepta, 43, is married with 3 children whose ages range between 3 and 10. One of the children is currently attending school. Jepta has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years in Kitale, western Kenya. His farm produces eggs and milk, which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his tailoring business in the same town.

Jepta has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry farm. The extra income from this loan will help him pay his children's school fees. He would like to acquire a posho mill and a chaff cutter in the next five years. His biggest challenge has been the transportation of eggs to the market.

loans.use: to expand his poultry farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to enlarge his shop

loans.name: Angie

texts.en: Angie V., 27 years old, lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is married with 2 daughters and 2 sons. Angie owns and operates a fishing business. She operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. She works hard to provide for her family's needs. Angie is in need of  fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva's partner, CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Liezel's Group

texts.en:
Liezel C. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 30 years old. Liezel is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Liezel is married and has 1 school-aged child. She owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Liezel has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Liezel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liezel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Liezel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Liezel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for his shop

loans.name: Merlita's Group
