Merlita S. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 51 years old. Merlita is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Merlita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Bodesmus

texts.en:
Bodesmus is a farmer from Kitale, in western Kenya. He has been farming for six years and his main products are milk, beans and maize, which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his hotel business in the same region. Bodesmus is 33 years old and married with 2 children, ages 2 and 12. 

Bodesmus has requested a loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this acquisition will guarantee his family enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to acquire 3 quality dairy cows in the next 5 years to improve his milk production.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Amalia's Group

texts.en:
Amalia R. is from the village of Magdalena, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Amalia is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Amalia is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Amalia has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Amalia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amalia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Amalia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Sreyleav

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyleav S., 26 years old, and her husband, Mr. Samat Son, 29 years old, have been married since 2005 and have a young daughter. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sreyleav sells fried cricket in her village. Her husband is a driver. She hopes to expand her business, so she is asking for a loan of $500.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy necessary items for the shop

loans.name: Anelita

texts.en:
Anelita is a married woman who lives in Tanjay City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 2 businesses: dressmaking and buying and selling rice. Her husband, Rustico S., 57 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have 6 children between the ages of 13 and 28. Anelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and her own efforts, Anelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, raising the family's standard of living.

For her 17th loan, Anelita is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to purchase more tailoring materials in order to save up for future food and education. Anelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

Bora is asking for another loan of $1,200 because he and his wife hope to expand their business by buying chicken for resale. This couple has been married since 1986 and has five children. The family lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying chicken for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a thirty-four-year-old married woman with four children. She started a small eating joint and raised capital which she used to buy fresh food. She now sells this fresh food in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She hopes to grow her business to sustain her family. Beatrice wants a loan to buy fresh food to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing fresh food to sell

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
"Adelfa is 65-year-old married woman. She supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store coffee shop and a fishing business. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store coffee shop and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6000. Adelfa is borrowing PHP 18500 so that she may purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her eighteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Adelfa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Ann Wanjiru

texts.en:
Ann Wanjiru M. runs a retail shop in Mlolongo and earns a good income. She is married to Sammy and they have two school-aged children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She has never borrowed from any other MFI. She is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy maize flour, sugar, and sweets to add to the stock in her shop. 

Ann hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To stock her retail shop with items like sugar, maize flour,and sweets

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Mrs. Sarin M. and her husband, Mr. May Man, live in a village off of National Road Number Two, about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. Sarin sells fish at the Takhmao market. Her husband is a construction worker. The couple has asked for Kiva loans several times. Sarin is now asking for another loan of $1,200 to purchase her neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.use: to purchase her neighboring land to expand her property

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a business buying and selling rice. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,200.

Erlinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 in order to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Erlinda hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish for resale. Luzbe is 29 years old with six children.

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru: Олимов Акрам проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 33 года. Он Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование у него среднее. Он более 15 лет занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает стройматериалы. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Akram O. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 33 years old, married, and has two children. He has a high school education. He has been working in sales for more than fifteen years.  He has a shop where he sells building materials.  He is taking out a loan to increase sales.

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophon V. is 37 years old.  Her husband, Mr. Sophea Son, is 38 years old.  They live on an island in the Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1991 and have one son and one daughter. 

Sophon runs a business renting her van to garment factories and individuals. Her husband builds houses.  Sophyn is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to expand her business by purchasing one more van.

loans.use: To add to her own money to purchase a van

loans.name: Tyas

Tyas sells snacks from home. Her husband is a fisherman. She is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a fishing boat for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a boat for her husband for fishing

Susan has requested a loan of 31,200 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will enable her to take her children to better schools. Her primary challenges in this business have been diseases and water shortages, which affect her production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs. Thol S. is 36 years old and her husband, Mr. Thol Prem is also 36 years old. They have been married since 1998 and have four children - three sons and one daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Thol S. stays at home. The main source of their income is from her husband’s business. He is a wooden house constructor. He does not have enough materials to work, so Thol is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Dailinda

texts.en:
Dailinda T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 46 years old. Dailinda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Dailinda owns and operates a fish business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and reselling assorted fish. 

Dailinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dailinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah, 51, is a married mother of six children whose ages range between 17 and 37. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years and raises cows that produce milk which she sells locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to provide the basic needs of her family.

She has requested a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The profits from this loan will help her provide for the basic needs of her family. She plans to buy at least four dairy cows and a motorcycle to transport milk to the market in the near future. Her biggest challenge has been transporting her farm produce to the market.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Forty-year-old Valentine would like a loan to buy land to expand his agriculture business. He is a commercial agriculturalist living in Kyenjojo, Uganda in a semi-permanent house. He intends to put up a permanent house, educate his children and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy land to expand agriculture business

loans.name: Nazila

texts.ru:
Nazila G. rodilas v 1962 qodu. Ona zamujem i imeyet 4 detey. Nazila yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Djabrail regiona i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione. Yeyo deti umnie i ochen poslushniye oni ochen lubat pomoqat svoyey mame po rabote i doma. Nazila uje 10 let kak imeyet etoto maqazin dlya prodaji produktov. 
Nazila seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Nazila G. was born in 1962.  She is married and has 4 children.  Nazila is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She moved from the Djabrail region and now lives in the Absheron region.  Her children are smart and well behaved, and love to help their mother with work and at home.  Nazila has owned her store, where she sells products, for 10 years.  Currently, Nazila needs 2000 AZN in order to expand her store space and grow her business.

loans.use: Expansion of store space

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch P. (in the photo) is 44 years old and her husband, Mr. Thon Proem, is 33 years old. They married in 1983 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Touch stays at home and takes care of her children. Their main source of income is from her husband’s business. He is a builder of wood houses. He wants to buy additional construction materials for his work, but he does not have the capital.

Hence Touch is asking for a loan of $1,000 to make the purchases for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Chamreun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamreun S. (in the photo) is a widow with eight children: three sons and five daughters. Five are married, one is a teacher, one has full-time employment and another attends school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Chamreun is a silk weaver. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter, who is a teacher, to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughter to commute

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 51 years old. Virginia is married and has six children. To make a living, Virginia grows crops. The main source of income for the business comes from rice farming rice. Virginia and her husband are also involved in fishing. She sells her husband's catch to their community.

Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to buy farming supplies and fishing gear. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and fishing gear

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm, which is located in Kitale town, western Kenya, is currently producing milk which he sells locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to provide the basic needs of his family.

He has requested a loan of 41,600Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income that will be generated from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family. His primary challenges have been disease and insufficient water for his dairy cows.

David is 44 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en:
Mr. Sorm S. is 29 years old. His wife, Mrs. Rotha Pach, is 26 years old (pictured together)--they live along National Road Number 1, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 2006 and have a young son. 

Sorm is a building contractor (laying brick and plastering the ceiling and walls of houses). His wife is a garment factory worker. He does not have enough work, so he is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional materials to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his construction business

loans.name: Mrs. Sinat Auk Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of thirteen people who are living in A Cheang village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sinat A. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for varied ways to improve their family's living situation. She is a noodle seller in a local village where she is able to earn some profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Norn Ai, is a construction worker. She wants to start selling fish, but does not have a bicycle for transportation. Mrs. Sinat A. is taking a loan to buy a bicycle. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in a local school. The youngest child is one year old.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle for transportation to sell fish

loans.name: Dilnaz's Group

texts.en:
Dilnaz T. K., 19, is the leader of this group. She is a student. She earns money by working as a cook in a cafeteria. A year ago Dilnaz invested 4000 soms to purchase two livestock animals for breeding. Through livestock breeding, she earns additional 1000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase additional cattle for breeding. In the future Dilnaz wants to graduate from the university.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mrs. Roeun R. and her husband, Mr. Kheng Klork, live along National Road Number 1, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have five children.  Roeun sells fruits. Her husband is a construction contractor. Typically when 10% of the construction is finished, his customers will pay him. But he has to pay for workers upfront and does not have the funds to do so.  Therefore, Roeun is requesting a loan for her husband, which will be use to pay his workers.

loans.use: To pay for workers fees

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en: Mrs. Ngoun S. is 61 years old and has nine children. Three of them are married, two live outside the family home, and the others are garment factory workers. Her source of income is from her children’ salaries.  Nguon is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to build a shop for her son-in-law to operate business repairing motorbikes.

loans.use: To build a shop for her son-in-law to operate a motorbike repair business

loans.name: Olmoskan's Group

texts.en:
Olmoskan S. is the leader of this group. She is 41, married, and has five children, all of whom attend school. In order to earn money, Olmoskan and her husband breed cattle. They earn money by selling cattle after fattening at a higher price. With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the number of cattle they own. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Aydin

texts.ru:
Aydin M. 53 qoda. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona, seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Aydin jenat i imeyet 2 detey.
 On uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji tovarov dlya remonta( kraski, kistochki, shpateli i t.d) Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovari dlya svoyeqo magazina chtob pereprodat ix.
texts.en: Aydin M. is 53 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Dispaced Person).  He moved from the Fuzuli region and now lives in the city of Baku together with his family.  Aydin is married and has 2 children.  He has been involved in the business of selling repair tools (paint, paint brushes, paint tools, etc.) for 9 years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy goods for his store for subsequent resale.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for resale

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip L. has been in the farming business for over seven years now.  His mixed farm, which is located in Kitale town, western Kenya produces milk and eggs which are all sold locally.  He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.

Philip is 55 years old and married with 3 school-aged children who all attend school.

He has requested a loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  The extra income from the sale of milk will help him improve his family's livelihood.  He plans to acquire 4 more dairy cows and a chaff cutter in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Oem

texts.en:
Mr. Oem M. is living in Thnoas village, Takeo province and he was born in 1967.  He and his wife, Mrs. Chrean Ben, are farmers who own 3-hectares of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family.  Besides farming, he is a fisherman and he owns a mill where he is able to earn some profit to support his family.  

In the past, he wanted to breed a cow, but he did not have enough money to buy one.  In order to do that, Mr. Oem M. is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding so he can start a new business.  He is a father of five children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, while the other one is attending a local public school, and the others are too young to work or study.  His wife is taken in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha P. and her husband, Mr. Khay Kung, live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokha sells vegetables, while her husband is a wooden house builder. She is asking for a loan of $1,000. She will use $600 of the loan to purchase more vegetables for resale and the remaining $400 to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable for resale and build a restroom for house

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a widow who lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a Natasha dealer business. She has 4 children who are between 27 and 38 years old.  All of her children are married. 

Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Erlinda's previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6400, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks to sell so that she can continue to save up for future household expenses. Erlinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira K. is the leader of this group. She is 35 years old, married, and has two sons and a daughter. Her sons are students and her daughter is of  pre-school age (under seven). 

Damira works as a teacher at a school.  Her husband earns money by breeding livestock animals. By reselling livestock after fattening them, he adds 1500 soms to their family budget. With the money received from this loan, Damira wants to increase their number of livestock. In the future, she will make efforts to build a house for her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Burambira Twekorere Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Alex T. is the leader of Burambira Twekorere group in Kihihi. He is 26 years old and is married with 1 child. For the past 2 years, he has been operating a retail shop selling general merchandise such as books, pens, soap, sugar, salt, cooking oil and cereals.  He is able to save 100,000 UGX every month.   Alex has another source of income – his agriculture business, where he make 20,000 UGX in weekly profit. 

Alex is very hard working and cooperative. His dream is to expand his shop further and advance his agriculture business to a more profitable stage.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 33 years old.  She is married and supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. 

Marites has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6000. 

Marites is borrowing PHP 18000 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. 

Marites aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gulnura's Group

texts.en:
Gulnura M. is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married. Her husband works as a warehouse supervisor. They have two daughters and one son. Their son studies at university and their daughters are in school. 

Gulnura works in a sewing shop. Four years ago she rented a piece of land and started an agricultural business. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase fertilizers. In the future, she wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of auto parts

loans.name: Joyce  Kavele

texts.en:
Joyce Kavele Nzue has been selling fruits and vegetables of various kinds in Mlolongo market for about 10 years.  She earns a profit of KES 10,000 per month.  She is 65 years old and is married to Francis, who is a driver.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client and has never borrowed from any other MFI.  Joyce is applying for her second loan from KADET,  which she intends to use to add more stock of tomatoes and various types of vegetables for resale. With the anticipated profit, she plans to accumulate savings and buy a pick-up truck to transport tomatoes from the farms to the marketplace.

Joyce describes herself as hardworking. She desires to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Elgiza's Group

texts.en:
Elgiza O. is the treasurer for this group. She is 26 and married. Her husband works as an excavator driver. Together they bring up a son and two daughters. Their son goes to school and their daughters are still of pre-school age (under seven). 

Five years ago, with the initial investment of 2000 soms, Elgiza and her husband bought four goats for breeding. Since that time, the family has been  engaged in livestock breeding. With the money received from this loan, Elgiza wants to increase their number of livestock. In the future, Elgiza wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Kibaya Tutungukye Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Justus T. is the leader of Kibaya Tutungukye group in Kihihi. He is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. 

Justus has been engaged in the sale of produce from Kibaya for over 10 years.  He is able to make 80,000 UGX in weekly profit.  He also has another source of income from the selling of goats.  He started these businesses with savings from an agricultural venture. He now also grows some of the produce that he sells, and buys the rest from farmers who cannot take their products to directly to market. 

Justus is a friendly and cooperative man, who hopes to expand his business and develop his family in the future.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Munno Mubyonna Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Alice N. is a 38-year-old happily married mother of 3 happy-go-lucky kids who are all in school.  For the last 4 years, she has been operating a business selling food, principally bananas, at the local food market in Mulawa-Mukono.  Alice says that she was inspired by a close friend to try a hand in this business, which generates for her 100,000 shillings weekly. Previously, Alice was running a grocery store. Her future plan is to expand her banana sales business to markets in other districts where people's consumption rates of bananas are high. 

Alice belongs to Munno Mubyonna Development group-Mukono.  She says that with this loan, she is going to purchase more bananas to resell. She says this will the first step in her quest to expand and consolidate her sales revenue base, which at length will lead to business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Lucia currently has a business selling green vegetables and tomatoes. She is 24 years old, married to a farmer, and has 1 child who is not school-going.

Lucia borrowed a loan to stock more green vegetables and tomatoes to sell.  With the extra profits from the business, Lucia hopes to open up a shop in the future.

loans.use: To stock more green vegetables and tomatoes

loans.name: Fazeelat's Group

texts.en:
Fazeelat lives in Faisalabad, Pakistan’s third largest city known for its textile industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Ghulamabad. She moved here 6 years ago. 

Fazeelat is 48 years old, married to N. M., and has 6 children: 5 sons and 1 daughter. She could not educate her children due to poor financial conditions. 

Fazeelat is a very responsible person, and carried out her responsibilities of a housewife and caring for her family very well. Her husband operates a grocery store in a nearby market. Through his shop, he sells daily use items such as sugar, cooking oil, lentils, etc. He is known in his area for his good customer service and quality products.   Fazeelat’s two elder sons operate a cloth selling business.  

Fazeelat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will purchase more groceries in bulk, which will help him fulfill the demands of his customers and make more income.   Fazeelat hopes that this investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and improve the living standards for her family.   She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with the raised hand is Fazeelat.

loans.use: To buy stock for grocery store business

loans.name: Gaburira Bakyara Twetungure-, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
Winnie T. is the leader of Gaburira Bakyara Twetungure group, Ntungamo.  She is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children. 

Winnie has a business selling bananas from Ndoragi, from which she is able to make 50,000 UGX in weekly profits. She sells by the side of the road to various customers and has been in this business for 20 years. She is also involved in agriculture and her former business was selling used clothes. 

Winnie is social and hardworking and she is grateful that a friend introduced her to this prospering business. Winnie needs a loan to be able to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.use: To buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Меликбоева Зарина проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 41 год. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж находится в России. Сама Зарина имеет средне - специальное образование. Она медсестра. По специальности проработала пять лет. На сегодняшний день она занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Zarina M. lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 41 years old, married and has 5 children.  Her husband is in Russia.  Zarina has a secondary-specialized education.  She is a nurse and spent five years working in that field.  Today, she is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds livestock at home.  Zarina has been involved in this business for over 10 years.  She breeds livestock for future sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Namanve Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
28-year-old Mariam N. runs a beauty salon enterprise, which has now been in existence for the past 5 years in Kazinga-Mukono. She credits a close friend with talking her into setting forth in this business.  Her friend had to prevail to talk her out of her erstwhile retail business. 

Mariam comes across as a courteous, hardworking, and determined lady who says she wants the best in terms of welfare for her family of 5 kids and her husband. Mariam says her business generates for her 250,000 shillings monthly.  With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more cosmetics and other hair products for use in her beauty salon. 

Mariam belongs to Namanve Development group-Mukono. The person seated in the back on the computers is a credit officer.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her glove making business. She makes variety of gloves out of wool and leather to sell to her customers. She will utilize the loan money to buy raw materials like leather, thread, and wool in bulk to make larger quantity of gloves.  This will help her fulfill larger orders and make more income. 

Razia lives in Faisalabad, Pakistan, a city famous for its textile industry. She lives there in a 2-room  brick house in the area of Ghulamabad. She moved  here after her marriage 20 years ago to A. B.. 

Her husband works for a private company for a very small income.  For that reason, Razia started her business to help share the financial burden with him. They have 7 children, but due to financial reasons only 3 of them are able to get an education.  

Razia has been operating her business for the past 4 years and is very confident that she will be able to improve the living standards for her family by expanding her business.   She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note:  In the photo, the lady with the raised hand is Razia.

loans.use: To buy leather, thread, and wool for glove making business

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Махмедова Гуландом жительница района Вахдат. Ей 44 года. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование-среднее. Более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Она в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для увеличения количества скота.
texts.en: Gulandom M. lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 44 years old, married and has 5 children.  She has a secondary education.  Gulandom has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years.  She primarily feeds up and sells livestock.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase the quantity of livestock.

loans.use: Increasing quantity of livestock

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Natif de Mopti, Monsieur Hamidou T. a 41 ans mari d’une épouse et père de 4 enfants, il loge  dans le quartier Darsalam II de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Dû à des raisons familiales, Hamidou n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier.  Pour cela cet aventurier  Dogon a commencé ses activités par le gardiennage et  avec son salaire, il a pris l’initiative de s’insérer dans les activités génératrices de revenus, aujourd’hui il est vendeur de boissons dans un centre culturel de Koutiala depuis 3 ans.  L’ activité qu’il mène est très rentable, car il vend beaucoup  de casiers de boissons par jour.  
Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, Mr T. a cherché une collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2 ans.  Il est à son troisième prêt individuel car les deux précédents ont été bien payés. 
Hamidou compte acheter,  30 casiers de boissons  avec son montant financé, il vend au centre culturel de Koutiala à une clientèle  composée de femmes et d’ hommes  au comptant. Avec le renforcement de son fonds de commerce, il compte sur un bénéfice de 75.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, prendre les charges totales de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
A native of Mopti, Mr. Hamidou T. is 41 years old, has one wife and is the father of four children.  He lives in the Darsalam II district of the city of Koutiala (in the region of Sikasso).  
Because of family circumstances, Hamidou did not get the chance to study.  That is why this adventurous member of the Dogon tribe began work as a caretaker and, with his earnings, took the initiative to enter into money-making ventures.  He has been selling beverages at a cultural center in Koutiala for three years.  The work he does is very profitable because he sells many cases of drinks per day. 
In order to increase his working capital, Mr. T. has partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for two years.  He is on his third individual loan, having properly repaid the first two. 
Hamidou plans to buy 30 cases of drinks with his loan.  He sells them for cash at the cultural center in Koutiala to a clientele of men and women. With this increase in funds he plans to earn a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which he will use to pay interest on the Soro Yiriwaso loan, take over all family responsibilities, and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Tacaddin

texts.ru:
Tacaddin jenat i imeyet 2 detey, On jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi kotoriye pomoqayut yemu po rabote. Tacaddin R. 41 qod. On uje 7 let kak otkril sebe magazin po prodaje fruktov i ovoshey. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya toqo chtobi pomeshalos bolshe tovara dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en: Tacaddin is married and has 2 children.  He lives in the city of Baku together with his wife and children, who help him with work.  Tacaddin R. is 41 years old.  He opened his store, where he sells fruits and vegetables, seven years ago.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to expand his store space to accommodate more merchandise for resale.

loans.use: Expansion of store space

loans.name: Omaro

texts.fr:
Monsieur Omaro Koné  est âgé de 29 ans,  marié et père d’un enfant, il est polygame et vit chez son père avec sa famille dans le quartier Hamdallaye  de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  
Il n’a pas fréquenté l’école du à des raisons sociales, c’est ainsi qu’il embrassa les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père depuis son jeune  âge et l’exerce pour lui-même il y a 6 ans.  Il est très bien sollicité par ses clients. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mr Koné a fait recours à   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est son  premier prêt individuel, qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 7 téléphones portables et des pièces de rechange à Bamako. Il effectue sa vente dans son kiosque au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle mixte, au comptant. Avec ce financement, il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA  pour subvenir à ses besoins,  rembourser le prêt, satisfaire les charges de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Dans les jours à venir, il envisage d’agrandir son activité pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Omaro Koné is 29 years old, married, and the father of one child.  He is polygamous and lives at his father’s house with his family in the district of Hamdallaye, in the city of Koutiala (region of Sikasso).  
He did not attend school regularly because of social circumstances.  This is why he took to working and earning money with his father at a young age. He has been working for himself for six years now.   He is in high demand from his clients. 
In order to satisfy this demand, Mr. Koné applied for a loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  He is on his first loan which he plans to use to buy 7 cell phones and spare parts in Bamako.  He makes his sales, in cash, from his kiosk at the main market in Koutiala to a mixed clientele. With this financing, he plans to make a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA which will allow him to meet his personal needs, repay his loan, meet family responsibilities, and reinvest in his business. 
In the near future, he foresees increasing his business activity in order to  attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and spare parts

loans.name: Nuraddin

texts.ru: Nuraddin M. rodilsya v 1972 qodu. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka kotoriy uchitsya v shkole. Nuraddin, yeqo lubimaya jena i rebonok jivut v qorode Baku. Nuraddin uje 6 let kak zanimayetsya stroitlstvom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svayeqo otca , s detstva koqda yeqo otec rabotal o vse vremya interesovalsya etoy rabotoy. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit nujniye pribori dlya stroitelstva.
texts.en: Nuraddin Mammadiv was born in 1972.  He is married and has one child, who currently attends school.  Nuraddin, his beloved wife and child live in the city of Baku.  Nuraddin has been involved in construction work for 6 years.  He learned this business from his father since childhood.  When his father worked, Nuraddin was always interested in this work.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase necessary tools for construction work.

loans.use: Purchase of necessary construction tools

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
La Sra. Estela vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, es propietaria de una librería en el centro mismo de la ciudad, es viuda y tiene dos hijas mayores que ya no viven con ella y son profesionales.
Solicita el crédito para compra de útiles escolares ya que se aproximan las clases y debe comprar este mes; y si realiza la compra al por mayor consigue mejores descuentos y aumenta su margen de ganancia.
La cliente opera con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2005 y cuenta con buen historial de crédito.
texts.en:
Estela lives in the city of Carapeguá.  She is the proprietor of a bookstore in the center of the city.  She is a widow, and she has two adult daughters.  They do not live with her now; they are professionals.

She is requesting the loan to buy school supplies.  Class will start soon, and she needs to buy the supplies this month.  If she makes the purchase wholesale, she will get better discounts and increase her profit margin.

She has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya since 2005, and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: To buy school supplies

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Zoumana Koné est âgé de 40 ans, marié à deux  épouses et père de 2 enfants.  Ce polygame vit  au quartier  Sogomougou de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  
Pour des raisons sociales, Zoumana n’a pas eu la chance d’être instruit  raisons pour laquelle il s’est intéressé aux activités  génératrices de revenus  depuis son jeune âge, qu’il apprit  auprès de son feu père  jadis commerçant. Zoumana décida d’évoluer le commerce d’articles divers.  Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus, sa notoriété est bonne car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité,  Monsieur Zoumana Koné a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis maintenant 3 ans.  Il est à son  quatrième  prêt  individuel après avoir correctement remboursés sans difficulté les précédents. 
Ce nouveau prêt sera  utilisé pour l’achat de stocks de marchandises. Il s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes  de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique au quartier Sogomougou de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’ hommes au comptant. 
Monsieur Zoumana compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA  qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro, satisfaire le besoin de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Il compte sur les financements de Soro pour élargir son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Mr. Zooming Koné is 40 years old, married to two women, and the father of two children.  He is polygamous and lives in the Sogomougou district of Koutiala (region of Sikasso).  
Because of social circumstances, Zoumana was not able to go to school.  It is for this reason that he became interested in earning money from a young age, which he learned from his late father who was a merchant.  Zoumana decided to develop a business selling various items. This work assures him sufficient income, and he is well known because he receives a good number of customers every day.  In order to meet his customers' demands and to grow his business, Mr. Zoumana Koné has been involved with the microfinance institution Soro Yirowaso for three years.   He is on his fourth individual loan after having properly repaid the preceding ones without any difficulty.  
This new loan will be used to buy merchandise.   He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Koutiala and makes his sales, in cash, from his shop in the Sogomougou region of Koutiala to a clientele of women and men.  Mr. Zoumana plans to earn a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA which he will use to pay interest to Soro and to meet the needs of his family.  He will invest the rest in his business.   
He is counting on financing from Soro to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El señor Feliano tiene 57 años de edad, es propietario de un taller muy conocido en la ciudad, vive en el  Barrio San Vicente de la Ciudad de Carapeguá.
También vende repuestos para motos, tiene clientela formada y quiere solicitar el crédito para aumentar su stock de mercadería ya que comprando en cantidad obtiene mejores descuentos y aumenta su margen de ganancias.
El cliente opera con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2007 y cuenta con buen historial de crédito. Tiene casa propia pero necesita aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Feliciano, age 57, is the proprietor of a very well-known workshop in the city.  He lives in the San Vicente neighborhood in the city of Carapeguá.

He also sells replacement parts for motorcycles.  He has a number of steady customers.

He wants to request the loan to increase his stock of merchandise.  He will buy in larger quantities in order to get better discounts and increase his profit margin.  He has been working with the Fundación Paraguaya since 2007, and he has a good credit history.  He has his own house, but he needs to increase his income in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy replacement parts

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru: Косимова Бахринисо проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 46 лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Мух, находится в России. Сама Бахринисо после отъезда мужа занялась животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Она в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Bahriniso K. lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 46 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband is in Russia.  Bahriniso became involved in animal husbandry after her husband left.  She breeds cattle at home.  She primarily breeds livestock for future sale.  Bahriniso has been involved in this business for 10 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Azam

texts.en: Azam is a 33-year-old married man who lives with his wife and 5 children in Gaza. In 2006 Azam opened his own paint shop since there were no shops of this type in the area. He hopes that thanks to this loan he will be able to buy new supplies for his paint shop. And hopefully this will bring in more customers and will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for his paint shop

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El cliente es de Carapeguá, es propietario de un colectivo que tiene como itinerario de recorrida el centro de la ciudad.
Está casado con María Pelagia Flores, ella es docente jubilada y tienen tres hijos, todos mayores de edad.
El cliente opera con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2000 y tiene buen historial de pago, por ello solicitan el crédito para reparación de su colectivo que es su fuente principal de ingreso económico.
texts.en: He is from Carapegua and he owns a bus and he operates a route that runs through the city. He is married with Maria Pelagia Flores, a retired teacher. They have three children and they are all grown. He has been working with Fundacion Paraguaya since the year 2000 and he has a good loan repayment history. He requests a new loan to repair his bus; it is his primary source of income.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his bus.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is 31 years old, married, and comes from Jericho. He lives with his wife and 4 children, none of whom have entered school. In 2006, Wael opened his own tire store and is now hoping that through this loan he will be able to buy new equipment and new supplies for his store. He hopes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and supplies for his business

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Yacine N. est sociétaire de la caisse de Fissel situé à quelques 50 km de Mbour; elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfant dont les 2 figurent sur la photo. Son activité principale est l'élevage de moutons et chèvres destinés à la revente. Elle a une ancienneté dans ce domaine et constitue pour elle une source de revenu
texts.en:
Mrs. Yacine N. is a member of the UIMCEC Fissel branch located about 50 km from Mbour. She is married with three children, two of which are shown on the photo. 

Her main activity is fattening sheep and goats for resale. She is experienced, and this activity is for her a source of income.

loans.use: Animal fattening

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a single woman with one child who is attending school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

She has been operating a restaurant business for the past two years.  Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby.  Zawadi faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands in her business. She hopes to expand her business and establish another business in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, vegetables, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of its good variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, vegetables, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is currently engaged in a business selling tea and drugs in a shop. She borrowed a loan to stock more tea and drugs to sell.  Lucia is 39 years old, married to an SPLA worker, and has 5 children who all go to school.   With the extra profits from her business, Lucia hopes to pay for her children's schooling in the future.

loans.use: To stock more tea and drugs to sell

loans.name: Elvio Gabriel

texts.es:
El señor Elvio Gabriel vive en el Barrio Virgen del Carmen  de Carapeguá, es propietario de un taller mecánico y cuenta con muchos clientes, es soltero y tiene dos hijos menores de edad.
Solicita el crédito para compra de repuestos para motos, para dar más facilidad y comodidad a sus clientes.
El cliente opera con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2009 y cuenta con buen historial de crediticio.
texts.en: Elvio Gabriel lives in the community of Virgen del Carmen de Carapegua. He owns an automotive repair shop and he has a long list of clients. He is single and he has two young children. He requests a loan to purchase spare parts for motorcycles in order to provide better access and service to his clients. He has been working with Fundacion Paraguaya since 2009 and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos para motos

loans.name: Pacila

texts.en:
Pacila is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a tailoring business for the past five years, offering sewing services in a shop to her neighbours. Pacila faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the loan for 20,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase a bundle of materials and threads for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials and threads for tailoring business

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristhian es de Carapeguá, tiene 30 años y actualmente  es soltero.
El Sr. Cristhian es carpintero, cuenta con local propio donde elabora los trabajos para sus clientes. Cabe destacar que es un profesional con una antigüedad de más de 10 años.
Aprendió a ser un profesional en dicho trabajo gracias a su padre, quien se desempeñaba como carpintero anteriormente. Hoy día dejó de trabajar por la elevada edad.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de activo fijo (herramientas).
texts.en: Cristhian is from Carapegua. He is 30 years old and he is single. Cristhian is a carpenter and he has his own shop from where to work on projects for his clients.  It should be noted that he is a professional with more than 10 years' experience. He learned his trade from his father who previously worked as a carpenter.  He doesn't work anymore given his advanced age. He requests a loan to purchase tools for his trade.

loans.use: To purchase tools.
